This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation names John Harbaugh as NFL Coach of the Year by _$TIME_1, if the award is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the award is given to a different coach, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing NFL official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 NFL Honors event does not occur or the award is not presented.

items.title: Los Angeles Rams win Super Bowl 60 by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Los Angeles Rams officially win Super Bowl 60 as determined by the final official National Football League (NFL) game outcome at the conclusion of the championship game held before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSuper Bowl 60@content_dividerthe 60th annual NFL championship game held in February 2026 – NFL Official Schedule)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if the Los Angeles Rams are declared the official winners by the NFL and the result is confirmed through the NFL's official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNFL official website@content_dividerhttps://www.nfl.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or official NFL social media accounts by _$TIME_1 . Verification may also be obtained from at least two major tier-1 media sources reporting the final confirmed game outcome.

This market resolves 'No' if the Rams do not win the Super Bowl by _$TIME_1, if the game is cancelled or postponed indefinitely, if official verification is unavailable by the deadline, or if the event never occurs as scheduled. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing NFL official declarations and verified media. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the Rams do not participate or the event never took place.

items.title: BTC price between $106,000 and $108,000 by October 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing price in USD on major cryptocurrency exchanges is between $106,000 and $108,000 inclusive at the close of trading on October 1, 2025, using aggregated exchange data and official price indexes _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative price data from at least two major exchanges or aggregated indices such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data aggregator – Official Website https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ report a closing price in USD within $106,000 to $108,000 by _$TIME_1. Verification includes timestamped official exchange data and archival snapshots from web archives or regulatory filings where available.

This market resolves 'No' if the closing price is outside the specified range at _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or exchanges are closed preventing price determination, if the event is indefinitely postponed or cancelled, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs and established aggregators. The market also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or the underlying price event does not exist at settlement.

items.title: It Was Just an Accident Best Picture nomination by January 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the film 'It Was Just an Accident' _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerIt Was Just an Accident@content_dividertitle of a motion picture - Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ receives an official Best Picture nomination _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBest Picture Nomination@content_dividerthe Academy Award category recognizing outstanding motion pictures – Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences)_$ANNOTATION$_ for the 98th Academy Awards _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_divider98th Academy Awards@content_dividerthe 98th annual ceremony of the Academy Awards presented by AMPAS – AMPAS official site)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official nomination list _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_divineresults announcement@content_dividerformal publication of nominees by AMPAS)_$ANNOTATION$_ released by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (AMPAS) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerAMPAS@content_dividerAcademy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, organization that administers the Academy Awards – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1 includes 'It Was Just an Accident' as a Best Picture nominee. Verification requires accessing AMPAS official announcements at https://www.oscars.org/news or verified AMPAS social media channels. Alternative confirmation may be sourced from major media outlets with dual tier-1 verification.

Resolves 'No' if no official AMPAS nomination list by _$TIME_1 includes the film, if the nomination event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative nomination data cannot be verified. Conflicting or ambiguous reports defer to the official AMPAS sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the film was never submitted or eligible for consideration for the 98th Academy Awards Best Picture category.

items.title: Prediction markets overtake on-chain volume by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether prediction markets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPrediction markets@content_dividermarkets where participants trade contracts based on the outcomes of future events – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ surpass all other types of on-chain _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOn-chain activity@content_dividerany blockchain-recorded transactions excluding prediction market transactions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ activity combined by transaction volume on all blockchains by _$TIME_1, measured through reliable on-chain analytics platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if official reports or analytics from at least two leading on-chain data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOn-chain analytics platforms@content_dividertools or services that analyze blockchain transaction data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm prediction markets' combined transaction volume exceeds all other on-chain activity combined by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published data or dashboards from providers such as CryptoQuant, Glassnode, or Nansen accessible at official websites or trusted archives.

Resolves 'No' if no such authoritative confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if prediction markets do not exceed combined on-chain transaction volume, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification data is unavailable. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official platform reports and cross-referencing multiple independent analytics. Also resolves 'No' if prediction markets never reached the specified threshold or never existed.

If primary data sources become inaccessible, verification will fallback to archived data on Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera digital archive of the World Wide Web – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or regulatory filings where applicable. Resolution uses UTC timezone for all timestamps and concludes exactly at _$TIME_1.

Non-occurrence includes absence of prediction markets as a significant category or lack of on-chain volume dominance by _$TIME_1, confirmed via authoritative statistical reports or official platform disclosures.

items.title: Kansas City Chiefs + Baltimore Ravens points > 48.5 by October 5?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the combined points scored by the Kansas City Chiefs and Baltimore Ravens during their 2025 NFL Week 5 game exceed 48.5 points according to official final game statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPoints total@content_dividercombined score of both teams in a game – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ published by the National Football League _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNFL@content_dividerNational Football League: professional American football league in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and ESPN.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerESPN.com@content_dividerOfficial sports news website owned by ESPN Inc. – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official final combined score of the Kansas City Chiefs and Baltimore Ravens exceeds 48.5 points as published by the NFL or ESPN.com by _$TIME_1. Verification includes NFL.com game box scores, official NFL game reports, or ESPN.com final game statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial game statistics@content_dividerValidated final scoring data published by NFL or ESPN.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Alternative verification may use archived NFL game data or major tier-1 sports media with dual source confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if the combined score does not exceed 48.5 points by _$TIME_1, if the game is cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if official scoring data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing NFL official sources over secondary media. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the game does not occur as scheduled or official sources confirm cancellation or non-existence.

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) > $10,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the daily closing price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized open-source blockchain featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ equals or exceeds $10,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at least once on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency exchange with high trading volume and regulatory recognition, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports a daily closing price of Ethereum at or above $10,000 USD by _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data from official exchange websites or trusted market data aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency price tracking website and data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, accessible at settlement. Backup verification includes archived data via Internet Archive and regulatory filings where available.

This market resolves 'No' if no such closing price is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges suspend ETH trading or delist Ethereum before _$TIME_1, if data is unavailable or unverifiable by authoritative sources, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting data will be adjudicated by prioritizing official exchange data and verified market aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or trading is halted indefinitely before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Netflix cease operations by October 1, 2030?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Netflix, Inc. _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNetflix@content_divideran American subscription streaming service and production company – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ ceases all streaming operations globally by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCease operations@content_dividercomplete discontinuation of all Netflix streaming services worldwide – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official Netflix corporate announcements or filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerSEC@content_dividerU.S. federal agency regulating securities markets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Netflix officially announces complete discontinuation of all streaming services worldwide or files regulatory documents explicitly stating cessation of operations by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Netflix’s corporate website, SEC filings, or verified official social media)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major tier-1 media reports with explicit Netflix confirmation or corroborated government filings.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, or if Netflix continues any streaming service in any country, or if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or verification sources are unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official Netflix statements and SEC filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Netflix operations never ceased or if the event never existed.

items.title: Bayern Munich 1st spot in Champions League group by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bayern Munich maintains first place in their UEFA Champions League group stage standings by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBayern Munich@content_dividerGerman professional football club based in Munich competing in UEFA competitions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as determined by official UEFA published group tables _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUEFA@content_dividerUnion of European Football Associations, the governing body of European football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and match results.

Resolves 'Yes' if official UEFA group stage standings show Bayern Munich ranked first in their group at or before _$TIME_1 as published on UEFA’s official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUEFA official website@content_dividerhttps://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/standings/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or in UEFA’s official regulatory documents by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived UEFA publications and major verified sports media with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if Bayern Munich is not ranked first in their UEFA Champions League group stage standings by _$TIME_1, if the competition is cancelled, postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, if official UEFA data is unavailable or contradicts the condition, or if Bayern Munich does not participate in the group stage. Conflicts resolved by official UEFA sources taking precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was not scheduled.

items.title: CZ posts >2 times about Aster on X during October 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Changpeng Zhao (CZ) posts more than two times referencing 'Aster' on his verified X account during October 2025 according to official X post counts using UTC timestamps _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerChangpeng Zhao@content_dividerfounder of Binance cryptocurrency exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerX@content_dividersocial media platform formerly known as Twitter – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official X post count data or direct statements from CZ's verified X account _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerverified X account@content_dividersocial media account confirmed by platform verification checkmark – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm more than two distinct posts mentioning 'Aster' were published between 2025-10-01T00:00:00Z and 2025-10-31T23:59:59Z inclusive by _$TIME_1. Verification may include Internet Archive snapshots or major media reporting with corroboration.

Resolves 'No' if no verifiable confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event of posting more than two times does not occur, if the account is inactive, or if posts are deleted and unverifiable. Conflicting or unavailable data defaults to 'No'. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the underlying event of posting about 'Aster' does not exist or CZ's account is not verifiably posting.

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz new haircut at Paris Masters debut by October 27, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether tennis player Carlos Alcaraz appears with his recent new haircut at his first scheduled match of the Paris Masters tournament on October 27, 2025 according to the official ATP tournament schedule _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerParis Masters@content_divideran annual professional men's tennis tournament held in Paris, France – ATP Tour)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified visual evidence.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified visual confirmation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividervisual confirmation@content_dividerphotographs or videos from official ATP sources, tournament organizers, or verified media outlets)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows Carlos Alcaraz sporting the recent new haircut during his first match day at the Paris Masters by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-10-27T00:00:00Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification may use official ATP live streams, tournament photographs, or reputable media coverage with source attribution.

Resolves 'No' if no such visual confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if Carlos Alcaraz does not participate in the Paris Masters debut match, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting evidence, priority is given to official ATP or tournament organizer sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Paris Masters debut match is not scheduled or does not occur.

items.title: LPL team wins 2025 League of Legends World Championship by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether a team representing the League of Legends Pro League (LPL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLPL@content_dividerthe professional esports league for League of Legends in China – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ wins the official 2025 League of Legends World Championship _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship@content_dividerannual global esports tournament organized by Riot Games – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by the official conclusion of the tournament on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-11-09T07:00:00Z UTC, converted from CST UTC+8)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by Riot Games.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Riot Games _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerRiot Games@content_dividerdeveloper and organizer of League of Legends esports events – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially announces the winning team of Worlds 2025 as an LPL team on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires Riot Games’ official website or verified social media confirmation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com/en-US/tournament/113475452383887518)_$ANNOTATION$_, or corroboration from at least two tier-1 esports news outlets with explicit verification.

This market resolves 'No' if no LPL team wins Worlds 2025 by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if Riot Games does not provide verifiable confirmation by _$TIME_1. Conflicting or unavailable information resolves to 'No'. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurs or the winner is not determined by Riot Games as specified.

items.title: BTS 2025 concert tickets sell out within 1 hour by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether all tickets for BTS's first 2025 concert tour _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBTS@content_dividerSouth Korean boy band formed in 2013, managed by BigHit Music – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerconcert tour@content_dividera series of live music performances by an artist or group at multiple venues – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ sell out within 60 minutes of going on sale by _$TIME_1. Ticket sales are monitored through official BTS or BigHit Music _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBigHit Music@content_dividerSouth Korean entertainment company managing BTS – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ channels and primary authorized ticket vendors.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerofficial sources@content_dividerBTS or BigHit Music official websites, verified social media accounts, or primary ticket vendor announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm full ticket sellout within 60 minutes of sale opening for the first 2025 BTS concert tour by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published sales data, official announcements, or screenshots from verified accounts. Backup confirmation includes major verified media reports citing multiple tier-1 sources.

This market resolves 'No' if tickets do not fully sell out within 60 minutes by _$TIME_1, if the concert tour is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if official verification is unavailable or contradictory. If the event never existed or BTS does not hold a 2025 concert tour, resolves 'No'. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official BTS or BigHit Music sources then primary ticket vendors, followed by major media. Data unavailability by deadline also yields 'No'.

items.title: Donald Trump mentions prediction markets on X by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump makes any publicly verifiable statement or official post referencing prediction markets on the social platform X by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPrediction markets@content_dividermarkets where participants trade contracts based on the outcomes of future events – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to direct evidence from official or authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a statement or post by Donald Trump, identified via his verified X account or official public communication channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerX verified account@content_dividerofficial Twitter rebranded as X verified user account – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly references prediction markets before _$TIME_1. Verification requires direct inspection of Trump's verified X posts, official statements, or major media reports with confirmation from at least two tier-1 sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTier-1 sources@content_dividerleading global media outlets with rigorous editorial standards – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified mention exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, or if authoritative sources fail to confirm any mention. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official and direct sources. The market also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or if data is unavailable after applying fallback archival methods.

items.title: U.S. stock market >5% drop during government shutdown by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the U.S. stock market declines by 5% or more from its closing price on September 30, 2025, in either the S&P 500 or Dow Jones Industrial Average indices within the period starting October 1, 2025, through and including _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerS&P 500@content_dividera stock market index based on 500 large companies listed on stock exchanges in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDow Jones Industrial Average@content_dividera stock market index that shows how 30 large publicly owned companies traded on the New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq have traded during a standard trading session – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, conditional on a federal government funding lapse beginning on October 1, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividergovernment shutdown@content_dividera lapse in federal funding causing partial or full closure of non-essential government operations – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. The resolution is based on official closing prices published by the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq through authoritative financial data sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official U.S. federal government shutdown begins on October 1, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerfederal government shutdown@content_divideran official lapse of funding for federal agencies starting October 1, 2025 – official U.S. government announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the S&P 500 or Dow Jones Industrial Average shows a closing price decline of 5% or more relative to their closing price on September 30, 2025, on any trading day between October 1, 2025, and _$TIME_1. Verification requires official government funding status confirmation via the Office of Management and Budget or Congressional reports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerOMB@content_dividerOffice of Management and Budget: U.S. government agency responsible for budget execution – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, and stock prices from the NYSE or Nasdaq official data feeds _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerNYSE@content_dividerNew York Stock Exchange, the largest stock exchange in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Nasdaq _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=7@counter_dividerNasdaq@content_divideran American stock exchange known for technology stocks – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification may include Bloomberg, Reuters, or Financial Industry Regulatory Authority publications.

This market resolves 'No' if no federal government shutdown occurs starting October 1, 2025, through December 31, 2025, if the shutdown is officially cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if the stock market does not drop by 5% or more in either index by _$TIME_1, or if verification data from primary or backup sources is unavailable or insufficient. In case of conflicting data, official U.S. government announcements take precedence. This market also resolves 'No' if the shutdown event does not exist or is not confirmed by authoritative sources.

items.title: Pentakill in 2025 LoL Worlds by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether a pentakill _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPentakill@content_divideran event in League of Legends where a single player kills all five opposing champions in rapid succession during one match – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ occurs during the 2025 League of Legends World Championship matches through official match records on lolesports.com by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one pentakill is explicitly documented in official match statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerlolesports.com@content_dividerthe official Riot Games esports website providing verified match data and statistics – Riot Games)_$ANNOTATION$_ published on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires direct confirmation from lolesports.com or Riot Games official announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRiot Games Official@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification can include major esports media with tier-1 source confirmation or archived official match footage.

This market resolves 'No' if no pentakill is recorded by _$TIME_1, if the 2025 Worlds event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting or ambiguous data is resolved by prioritizing official Riot Games sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 Worlds event does not take place or no official matches occur.

items.title: US federal government shutdown > 15 days by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the US federal government shutdown _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividergovernment shutdown@content_dividera suspension of non-essential government services due to funding lapse – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ lasts more than 15 full calendar days starting October 1, 2025, through December 31, 2025, measured in elapsed calendar days according to official federal records.

Resolves 'Yes' if credible confirmation from official US government sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerofficial US government sources@content_dividerUS government websites, Office of Management and Budget, Congressional reports – https://www.whitehouse.gov/omb/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major verified media _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor media@content_dividertier-1 news organizations with corroboration)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows the shutdown continues beyond 15 full days by _$TIME_1. Verification requires official announcements or documented government operational status reports.

Resolves 'No' if the shutdown ends on or before the 15th day, if officially resolved or funding passed before exceeding 15 days, if the event is cancelled or never occurs, or if reliable verification data is unavailable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting sources are resolved by prioritizing official government publications and Congressional records. This market also resolves 'No' if the shutdown event does not exist or never commenced on October 1, 2025.

items.title: IShowSpeed travel to China again by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the internet personality IShowSpeed _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerIShowSpeed@content_divideran American internet celebrity and livestreamer known for gaming and travel content – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ undertakes any verified travel to China _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerChina@content_dividerthe country in East Asia, timezone UTC+8 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official announcements from IShowSpeed’s verified social media accounts or major streaming platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerVerified social media@content_dividersocial media accounts confirmed by platform verification badges or official company listings – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm travel to China by _$TIME_1. Confirmation may include direct posts, livestreams, or statements published on platforms such as YouTube, Twitch, Instagram, or Twitter, with backup verification from major media outlets reporting based on official sources.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, if travel is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing direct official announcements over secondary reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no evidence exists that IShowSpeed traveled to China again by the deadline.

items.title: Xiaomi surpasses Apple in global smartphone shipments by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Xiaomi Inc. ships more smartphones worldwide than Apple Inc. within the 2025 calendar year according to verified shipment reports by International Data Corporation (IDC) or equivalent market research agencies by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerXiaomi Inc.@content_dividera Chinese multinational electronics company specializing in smartphones and consumer electronics – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerApple Inc.@content_dividerAmerican multinational technology company known for iPhones and consumer electronics – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if IDC or equivalent authoritative sources publish verified annual smartphone shipment data confirming Xiaomi’s total 2025 shipments exceed Apple’s by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerIDC@content_dividerInternational Data Corporation: a premier global provider of market intelligence and advisory services for information technology, telecommunications, and consumer technology markets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires official IDC reports or equivalent market research with direct data or press releases at https://www.idc.com/ or archived equivalents.

This market resolves 'No' if Xiaomi does not surpass Apple in verified 2025 global smartphone shipments by _$TIME_1, if shipment data is unavailable or unverified by authoritative sources by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, postponed, or if the companies cease relevant operations. In case of conflicting data, resolution follows IDC’s official published data as primary and corroborated market research as secondary. Additionally, resolves 'No' if shipment comparisons cannot be confirmed or if the event never occurred.

items.title: Bitcoin > Silver market cap by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's total market capitalization exceeds $1.71 trillion USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 based on circulating supply multiplied by price in USD from authoritative cryptocurrency data platforms.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one authoritative source, such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera popular cryptocurrency price tracking platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, confirms Bitcoin's market cap surpasses $1.71 trillion USD by _$TIME_1 with supporting data publicly accessible at the platform’s official website or verified publications.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not exceed $1.71 trillion USD market capitalization by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or the data is unavailable or unverifiable by that time, or if authoritative sources contradict the claim. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes CoinMarketCap, then CoinGecko, and uses archived snapshots from Internet Archive as fallback. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or silver market capitalization data does not exist or is not measurable as specified.

items.title: Loudio reaches previous all-time high price by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Loudio's LOUD token price in USD reaches or exceeds its previous all-time high price recorded on 2025-09-20 by _$TIME_1 based on data from CoinGecko and Yahoo Finance.

Resolves 'Yes' if the LOUD token price equals or surpasses the 2025-09-20 peak price by _$TIME_1 as documented on CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency price tracking website providing real-time and historical data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Yahoo Finance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerYahoo Finance@content_dividera financial news and data platform offering historical market prices and statistics – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ with verification from both sources or official statements by Loudio.

Resolves 'No' if the LOUD token price does not reach the previous all-time high by _$TIME_1, if trading of LOUD is halted or delisted before _$TIME_1, if the token or price data are unavailable or unverifiable, or if the event to reach the previous high never occurs. Conflicting or missing data are resolved in favor of official or archived sources with precedence given to CoinGecko, Yahoo Finance, and Loudio announcements.

items.title: LeBron James retirement announcement by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether LeBron James officially announces his retirement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRetirement announcement@content_dividera formal public declaration of the end of an athlete's professional career – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in an official statement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-10-14T21:00:00Z UTC, converted from EDT UTC-4)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'Yes' if LeBron James issues a clear retirement statement through his official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerLeBron James official website@content_dividerhttps://www.lebronjames.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified social media accounts (e.g., Twitter, Instagram), or major tier-1 media outlets with explicit confirmation by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived official announcements and major media corroboration.

Resolves 'No' if no verified retirement announcement is made by _$TIME_1, if the announcement is officially denied or postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative sources fail to confirm. Conflicting information resolves by prioritizing official sources and major media. Also, resolves 'No' if the retirement announcement event does not occur or never existed.

items.title: Plasma new all-time high FDV by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Plasma's fully diluted valuation (FDV) exceeds its previous all-time high as recorded on CoinGecko by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFully diluted valuation (FDV)@content_dividerthe total market value of a cryptocurrency project assuming all tokens are issued at the current price – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. The FDV value is taken from the 'FDV' field on Plasma's main CoinGecko page at 23:59:59 UTC on that date.

Resolves 'Yes' if Plasma's FDV shown on CoinGecko at 23:59:59 UTC on _$TIME_1 exceeds its previously recorded peak FDV according to CoinGecko's historical data. Confirmation must come from CoinGecko's official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividerhttps://www.coingecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or official CoinGecko API snapshots. Backup verification can use CoinMarketCap or archived CoinGecko pages via Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividerhttps://archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Plasma's FDV does not exceed its previous all-time high by _$TIME_1, if CoinGecko or backup sources show no new peak, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting data, CoinGecko's official data takes precedence. Also resolves 'No' if Plasma does not exist or is delisted before _$TIME_1.

items.title: United States annexes Greenland by April 1, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the United States formally annexes Greenland as a U.S. territory through a legal transfer of sovereignty recognized by international law and relevant authorities by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAnnexation@content_dividerthe formal legal incorporation of territory into a country, recognized under international law – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one official announcement from the U.S. Department of State _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerU.S. Department of State@content_dividerthe U.S. federal executive department responsible for foreign policy – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, the Danish government _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDanish government@content_dividerthe central government of the Kingdom of Denmark – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or NATO _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerNATO@content_dividerNorth Atlantic Treaty Organization, a military alliance of North American and European countries – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirms the formal annexation by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes official legal documents or international law recognitions published on government or NATO websites.

Resolves 'No' if no such formal annexation confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if credible sources report cancellation or indefinite postponement, if the sovereignty transfer is not legally recognized, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicts are resolved with priority to official government and international body declarations. Also, resolves 'No' if the annexation event never existed or did not take place.

items.title: Aster monthly volume > Hyperliquid by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aster's monthly perpetual trading volume in USD exceeds Hyperliquid's in any full calendar month on or before _$TIME_1 according to independent DeFi analytics platforms and aggregated market reports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonthly perpetual trading volume@content_dividerthe total USD value of perpetual futures contracts traded within a calendar month – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeFi analytics platforms@content_dividerdecentralized finance data aggregators providing blockchain-based trading metrics – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one independent authoritative source such as DefiLlama _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDefiLlama@content_dividera decentralized finance analytics platform aggregating blockchain data – https://defillama.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or comparable verified analytics reports confirm Aster's monthly USD perpetual futures trading volume surpassed Hyperliquid's for any full calendar month on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published monthly volume reports or datasets explicitly showing comparative volumes.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified independent source confirms Aster's monthly volume exceeds Hyperliquid's by _$TIME_1, if data is unavailable or unverifiable, if the event is cancelled or data integrity is officially questioned _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerData integrity concerns@content_dividerofficial statements or platform delistings due to unreliable or manipulated data – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if the platforms cease operation before _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official DefiLlama publications and corroborated market reports. Also resolves 'No' if the comparison event never exists or is not measurable.

items.title: Donald Trump Elon Musk reconcile feud by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump and Elon Musk publicly confirm mutual reconciliation by making clear statements indicating resolution of their feud by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerReconciliation@content_dividera settlement of a quarrel or disagreement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as verified through official statements on verified social media accounts or major news outlets.

This market resolves 'Yes' if both Donald Trump and Elon Musk issue explicit, clear public statements indicating mutual reconciliation on their verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerVerified social media accounts@content_dividerofficial social media profiles confirmed by platform verification badges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or in major news media reports confirmed by at least two tier-1 sources by _$TIME_1. Confirmation must include direct quotes or official posts clearly expressing reconciliation.

This market resolves 'No' if no such mutual reconciliation statements are confirmed by _$TIME_1, if either party publicly denies reconciliation, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information resolves by prioritizing official social media and major verified news outlets. Also resolves 'No' if the reconciliation event never occurs.

items.title: Ethereum ≥ $5,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ spot price in United States Dollars (USD) reaches or exceeds $5,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ as reported by major cryptocurrency exchanges known for high liquidity and regulatory compliance.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMajor exchange@content_dividertop-tier cryptocurrency trading platform such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or Bitstamp – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publishes verified trade data showing ETH/USD spot price ≥ $5,000 by _$TIME_1. Verification requires official exchange price feeds, publicly accessible APIs, or authenticated published reports. Backup confirmation may include aggregated data from CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency price tracking website aggregating exchange data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko.

Resolves 'No' if no verified ETH/USD spot price ≥ $5,000 occurs by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges cease trading or delist ETH before _$TIME_1, or if reliable price verification data is unavailable. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing official exchange sources and trusted aggregators. This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum or its USD spot market ceases to exist or if the price metric specified is fundamentally unavailable.

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) > $5,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_divideran open-source blockchain platform with a native cryptocurrency called Ether – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $5,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange based on the recorded closing or intraday price at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if explicit price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerdigital marketplaces for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or Gemini show ETH trading at or above $5,000 USD at any moment on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed through official exchange APIs or published historical price datasets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerofficial exchange APIs@content_dividerapplication programming interfaces provided by exchanges for market data retrieval – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived snapshots from CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified major financial news outlets reporting the price milestone.

This market resolves 'No' if ETH does not reach or exceed $5,000 USD on at least two major exchanges by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed (e.g., market closures), or if authoritative price data is unavailable. In case of inconsistent data, resolution prioritizes official exchange sources and corroborated third-party aggregators. Additionally, it resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases trading, is delisted from major exchanges, or the price event never occurs.

items.title: Kalshi raises > $1 billion funding by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Kalshi, a prediction market platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerKalshi@content_dividerKalshi: a regulated prediction marketplace platform facilitating legally compliant event-based trading – company website)_$ANNOTATION$_, cumulatively raises over $1,000,000,000 USD in disclosed funding rounds by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Funding includes equity, venture capital, and other financing rounds announced publicly or by company officials.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Kalshi announcements or CEO disclosures on verified social media _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerVerified social media@content_dividerSocial media accounts authenticated by platform verification badges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or reputable financial news sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerFinancial news platforms@content_dividerEstablished financial media outlets such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or CNBC)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm cumulative funding exceeding $1 billion USD by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official press releases, SEC filings, or CEO posts on platforms such as X (formerly Twitter).

Resolves 'No' if the cumulative funding amount does not exceed $1 billion USD by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if no authoritative confirmation is available, or if the funding rounds are materially different from the specified funding type. Conflicting reports resolve by prioritizing official company statements and regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Kalshi ceases fundraising or the event never occurs.

items.title: Russia x Ukraine ceasefire by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Russia and Ukraine formally agree to cease all hostilities in the conflict by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCeasefire@content_divideran agreement to stop fighting temporarily or permanently – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and publicly announce it through authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if both the Russian and Ukrainian governments officially announce a mutual ceasefire agreement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on government websites or verified social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ and confirmation is obtained from at least one major intergovernmental organization such as the United Nations _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUnited Nations@content_dividerinternational organization promoting peace and security – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or neutral observers.

Resolves 'No' if no such official mutual ceasefire is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the agreement covers only one party or partial ceasefires. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official government and United Nations sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the ceasefire event never existed or was never agreed upon.

items.title: US government shutdown end by October 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the US federal government shutdown ends by official Congressional funding approval or continuing resolution enactment by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerGovernment shutdown@content_dividera lapse in federal government funding causing partial closure of government operations – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to authoritative government sources and official publications.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Congressional approval of full-year appropriations or a continuing resolution is enacted and published on official government websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Congressional funding approval@content_dividerformal legislation passed by both chambers of Congress and signed or otherwise enacted – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified federal government communications by _$TIME_1, with verification via at least two of: government websites (e.g., Congress.gov, OMB.gov), official press releases, or major media outlets with explicit confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such funding approval or continuing resolution is enacted by _$TIME_1, if the shutdown continues past the deadline, if official sources confirm cancellation or indefinite postponement of funding measures, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts resolved by prioritizing official government publications. Also resolves 'No' if the shutdown event never occurred or was resolved differently than defined.

items.title: Fluent mainnet launch by November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Fluent's blockchain mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMainnet@content_dividera fully operational blockchain network distinct from testnet, enabling live transactions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches as officially confirmed by Fluent Labs or its verified DAO _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDAO@content_dividerdecentralized autonomous organization: an organization governed by computer code and member consensus – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Confirmation includes announcements on official Fluent Labs channels or verified DAO statements.

This market resolves 'Yes' if explicit official Fluent Labs announcements or verified DAO statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial Fluent Labs announcements@content_dividerstatements published on fluent.io or official Fluent social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm mainnet launch by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived official posts or regulatory filings explicitly confirming launch.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the mainnet launch is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, rebranded without equivalence, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In conflicts, priority is given to Fluent Labs official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if mainnet launch event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Federal Reserve rate cut at least 1 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Federal Reserve _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal Reserve@content_dividerthe central banking system of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ makes at least one official interest rate cut _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRate cut@content_dividera deliberate reduction in the target federal funds rate – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official Federal Reserve communications and Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting calendars _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFOMC@content_dividerthe Federal Open Market Committee, the Fed's monetary policymaking body – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one Federal Reserve target federal funds rate reduction is explicitly confirmed and announced by the Federal Reserve Board or FOMC via official press releases or meeting statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial Fed communications@content_dividerhttps://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy.htm)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes consultation of the official FOMC calendar and publicly archived statements. Backup verification may use major tier-1 financial news outlets reporting with direct Fed confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if no official rate cut is announced by the Federal Reserve Board or FOMC by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative confirmation is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Federal Reserve official sources. This market also resolves 'No' if the Federal Reserve does not exist or the rate cut event never took place.

items.title: LayerZero (ZRO) > $3 before October 21, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of LayerZero (ZRO) cryptocurrency exceeds $3 USD at any time before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLayerZero (ZRO)@content_dividerLayerZero is a blockchain interoperability protocol token – CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) aggregated across 102 exchanges as reported by CoinGecko.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative data from CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency data aggregator providing real-time market prices and volumes – CoinGecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent primary sources confirm ZRO’s VWAP exceeds $3 USD at any moment before _$TIME_1. Verification requires official published price data or snapshots accessible at settlement time. Backup confirmation may include archival data repositories or alternative major crypto market data providers aggregating the same exchanges.

Resolves 'No' if no verified VWAP price above $3 USD occurs before _$TIME_1, if the event is effectively cancelled (e.g., ZRO delisted or trading halted indefinitely), or if authoritative price data is unavailable or insufficient for verification. In case of conflicting data, CoinGecko’s official data takes precedence, followed by corroborating data from at least two major crypto market aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if LayerZero (ZRO) token ceases to exist or trading on the specified exchanges before the deadline.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's price in USD exceeds $150,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using aggregate exchange market prices from major cryptocurrency exchanges according to established financial data providers.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified official market data from at least two major cryptocurrency price aggregators such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency market data provider tracking prices and volumes – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency price tracking platform – CoinGecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin price exceeded $150,000 USD by any moment on or before _$TIME_1. Verification includes data snapshots, exchange price feeds, or official exchange APIs published by Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, or similar leading platforms.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not exceed $150,000 USD at any time by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable or contradicted, if major exchanges cease trading before _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled or otherwise non-existent. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange APIs and price aggregator consensus. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price data sources are permanently inaccessible or the asset ceases to exist.

items.title: 币安人生 token spot listing on Binance by October 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the token named '$币安人生' _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider币安人生@content_dividerthe specific cryptocurrency token titled “币安人生”)_$ANNOTATION$_ is officially listed for spot trading _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerSpot trading@content_dividerthe buying and selling of cryptocurrencies for immediate delivery on an exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on the Binance exchange platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance is a global cryptocurrency exchange platform offering trading services – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Resolution is based on official Binance announcements and verified platform updates.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Binance publishes an official announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividera statement released on Binance’s official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming the $币安人生 token is available for spot trading by _$TIME_1. Verification includes Binance’s website listings, verified Twitter or Telegram channels, or Binance’s official API data endpoints. Backup verification includes major crypto news outlets reporting with explicit Binance confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation of $币安人生 spot listing is available by _$TIME_1, if Binance officially cancels or indefinitely postpones the listing, or if reliable verification sources are unavailable. Conflicting or ambiguous reports defer to official Binance communications as primary. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the $币安人生 token never existed or Binance never planned to list it for spot trading.

items.title: Bitcoin < $119,800 by October 11, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Bitcoin in USD falls strictly below 119,800 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to aggregated data from major cryptocurrency exchanges.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platform with high liquidity and global recognition such as Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, or Bitstamp – CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports a closing Bitcoin price below 119,800 USD by _$TIME_1. Verification requires aggregated price confirmation from at least two independent authoritative sources such as CoinGecko, CoinMarketCap, or BitcoinAverage APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice APIs@content_dividerofficial APIs providing real-time and historical Bitcoin price data – CoinGecko, CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_, with data archived or publicly accessible at the time of settlement.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin's closing price never falls below 119,800 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading data is unavailable or inconclusive, or if the event is cancelled (e.g., market closure). Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and widely recognized price aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading ceases, the asset is delisted, or the event fundamentally differs from this market's conditions.

items.title: Taylor Swift music video or film release by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Taylor Swift releases an official music video or film related to The Eras Tour _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerThe Eras Tour@content_dividerTaylor Swift's concert tour covering multiple career phases – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by official distribution channels by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRelease@content_dividerofficial distribution via cinema, streaming platforms, or music video channels – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ is confirmed through Taylor Swift's or Republic Records' official announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRepublic Records@content_dividermajor American record label owned by Universal Music Group – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires documented announcements on official websites or verified social media accounts. Backup verification includes major media reports with dual tier-1 source confirmation or official ticketing platforms.

Resolves 'No' if no such official release is verified by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled, postponed indefinitely, never planned, or if authoritative confirmation is absent. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Taylor Swift or Republic Records sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or no related content is officially released.

items.title: Ethereum ≥ $4,800 by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Ethereum cryptocurrency price in USD reaches or exceeds $4,800 at any official daily closing price on a major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain platform with smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency@content_dividera digital currency using cryptography for security and operating independently of a central bank – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platform with high liquidity and broad market acceptance, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken)_$ANNOTATION$_ records a USD closing price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerclosing price@content_dividerthe final traded price of an asset at the end of a trading day – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ of $4,800 or higher for Ethereum on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data from at least two independent authoritative crypto market data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividercrypto market data providers@content_dividerentities aggregating and verifying exchange price data for accuracy, e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum fails to reach $4,800 closing price by _$TIME_1, if Ethereum is delisted or trading is suspended on all major exchanges before _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing official exchange data and major market data aggregators. Also resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or trading never occurs before the deadline.

items.title: Ethereum ≥ $4,800 by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Ethereum cryptocurrency price in USD reaches or exceeds $4,800 at any official daily closing price on a major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain platform with smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency@content_dividera digital currency using cryptography for security and operating independently of a central bank – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platform with high liquidity and broad market acceptance, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken)_$ANNOTATION$_ records a USD closing price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerclosing price@content_dividerthe final traded price of an asset at the end of a trading day – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ of $4,800 or higher for Ethereum on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data from at least two independent authoritative crypto market data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividercrypto market data providers@content_dividerentities aggregating and verifying exchange price data for accuracy, e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum fails to reach $4,800 closing price by _$TIME_1, if Ethereum is delisted or trading is suspended on all major exchanges before _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing official exchange data and major market data aggregators. Also resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or trading never occurs before the deadline.

items.title: Aztec Network mainnet launch by November 1, 2025?
items.rules:

This market resolves 'Yes' if the Aztec development team or official Aztec Network sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial sources@content_dividerstatements from the project’s website, verified social media accounts, or official press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly confirm that the fully decentralized mainnet is live and accessible to users by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official blog posts, announcements on https://aztec.network, or statements through verified Aztec social media handles. Backup confirmation may include major blockchain news outlets reporting with direct Aztec source citations.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified official confirmation of the fully decentralized mainnet launch occurs by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if only testnet or partial launches occur without mainnet status, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official Aztec Network sources take precedence. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the mainnet event does not exist or never occurs by the deadline.

items.title: Momentum sale announcement on Buidlpad before October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether an official public statement or listing _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAnnouncement confirmation@content_divideran official public statement or listing by Buidlpad or Falcon Finance via verified channels – Market definition)_$ANNOTATION$_ about the Momentum sale on Buidlpad _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBuidlpad@content_dividerBuidlpad: a crypto launchpad platform facilitating structured token sales for blockchain projects – Market context)_$ANNOTATION$_ is made by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if Buidlpad or Falcon Finance publish an official announcement or listing about the Momentum sale by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source confirmation@content_dividerconfirmation via official websites, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes archived snapshots from Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera digital archive preserving web content for future verification – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and corroboration by at least two tier-1 cryptocurrency news outlets.

Resolves 'No' if no official announcement or listing is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing direct official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Momentum sale or announcement never existed or was never planned.

items.title: DOJ shares Epstein files with Congress by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the United States Department of Justice (DOJ) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDepartment of Justice@content_dividerthe federal executive department responsible for law enforcement and administration of justice – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the House Oversight Committee officially share investigative files related to Jeffrey Epstein with Congress by _$TIME_1 according to documented public release or delivery confirmation.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official DOJ statements or House Oversight Committee announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerofficial DOJ and House Oversight Committee announcements@content_dividerstatements or press releases published on DOJ or House Oversight Committee websites)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm transfer or public release of Epstein investigation files to Congress by _$TIME_1. Verification includes publicly accessible DOJ press releases, congressional committee reports, or official letters published at https://www.justice.gov/ and https://oversight.house.gov/ or archived government repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if no official sharing or delivery is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if sharing is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if verification sources fail to confirm transfer, or if the event never occurred. In case of conflicting information, official DOJ and House Oversight Committee declarations take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the files are not shared with Congress as specified or if the event never existed.

items.title: Abstract Chain TGE before November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Abstract Chain Token Generation Event (TGE) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerToken Generation Event@content_dividerthe official event when a blockchain project's tokens are created and made available to the public – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ occurs by _$TIME_1 according to announcements from Abstract Chain or other authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if Abstract Chain or verified primary sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPrimary source@content_dividerofficial Abstract Chain website, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ publish explicit confirmation of TGE completion by _$TIME_1. Verification can include official press releases, regulatory filings, or major media reports with corroboration from two or more tier-1 sources.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation of TGE completion is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the event never existed, or if data sources are inaccessible or contradictory. In case of conflicting evidence, official Abstract Chain publications take precedence. Also, resolves 'No' if the TGE occurs after _$TIME_1.

items.title: United States Asian American president by December 31, 2030?
items.rules:
This market measures whether a person identifying as Asian American _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAsian American@content_dividera United States citizen having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ holds the office of President of the United States _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPresident of the United States@content_dividerthe elected head of state and government of the United States, as defined by the U.S. Constitution – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to official government certification of election or inauguration records.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official certification of a U.S. presidential election or inauguration _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial certification@content_dividerformal validation by the U.S. Congress or relevant government authorities of election results or presidential swearing-in – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms that the President identifies as Asian American by _$TIME_1, verified by sources such as the National Archives _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerNational Archives@content_dividerthe U.S. federal agency responsible for preserving and documenting government and historical records – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, the U.S. Congress certification records, or the White House official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerWhite House official website@content_dividerhttps://www.whitehouse.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official certification or inauguration occurs by _$TIME_1, if an election is postponed or cancelled beyond _$TIME_1, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the officeholder does not identify as Asian American. In cases of conflicting or missing data, resolution follows official government records as primary source. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the event of having an Asian American U.S. president never occurs or is invalidated.

items.title: Monad mainnet launch by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad Labs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad Labs@content_dividerthe developer organization behind the Monad blockchain project – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially launches the Monad mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividermainnet@content_dividera blockchain network fully deployed and operational for public use, distinct from testnet – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to verified announcements or confirmed network activation notices.

Resolves 'Yes' if Monad Labs publicly confirms mainnet launch via official website, verified social media (e.g., official X account), or regulatory filings by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source URLs@content_dividerhttps://monadlabs.io, https://twitter.com/monadlabs)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if independent blockchain explorers or major media outlets with dual tier-1 verification confirm network activation including token issuance or live block production.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation or verified network activation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, if data is unavailable or unverifiable, or if the mainnet launch differs from specified criteria. In case of conflicting data, official Monad Labs sources take precedence. Also resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch never occurred or was never planned by the deadline.

items.rules:

items.title: @blendino_ talks prediction markets by October 8?
items.rules:

Resolves 'Yes' if a post explicitly discussing prediction markets is published by @blendino_ on X and is confirmed by official Polymarket _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPolymarket@content_dividera decentralized prediction market platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the Discord community signals by _$TIME_1. Verification requires direct evidence from @blendino_’s verified X account or coordinated announcements in Polymarket or Discord official channels.

Resolves 'No' if no such post is found by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or official verification is unavailable. Conflicting or ambiguous reports are resolved by prioritizing direct posts on @blendino_’s verified X account and official Polymarket or Discord community confirmations. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or the post does not discuss prediction markets explicitly.

items.title: Israel x Hamas ceasefire by December 31?
items.rules:

Resolves 'Yes' if a documented ceasefire agreement or explicit statement is publicly announced and verified from Israel, Hamas, or mediating governments (e.g., Egypt, Qatar) by _$TIME_1, with confirmation from at least one authoritative source such as official government publications, major verified media outlets, or international organizations like the United Nations _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_divineresolution sources@content_dividerofficial statements, verified media reports, or UN announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no official ceasefire agreement or verified statement is announced by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if verification sources are unavailable or contradictory, or if the agreement does not meet definition criteria. Also resolves 'No' if the ceasefire event never existed or was never agreed upon by recognized parties.
