This market resolves 'Yes' if Warden Protocol publishes an official public announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on the project’s official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ or launches tokens on its mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerMainnet@content_dividera blockchain network fully deployed and operational beyond testnet – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes confirmation via https://wardenprotocol.io/blog, verified social media channels, or blockchain explorer data indicating token issuance before or at _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if no verifiable official announcement or mainnet token launch occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting information, resolution prefers direct official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the TGE never existed or the project was discontinued before the deadline.

items.title: Monad testnet-only airdrop eligibility by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether community members who participated exclusively in the Monad testnets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad testnets@content_dividertest versions of the Monad blockchain network used to trial features before mainnet launch – official Monad sources)_$ANNOTATION$_ are eligible to claim the Monad airdrop by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-10-14T00:00:00Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to Monad's official claim portal _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMonad official claim portal@content_dividerhttps://claim.monad.xyz or equivalent official Monad website)_$ANNOTATION$_ based on engagement via faucets, dApps, and quests.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Monad's official claim portal or verified Monad communications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerofficial Monad communications@content_dividerMonad's verified Discord, Twitter, or website announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm that participants engaged only in Monad testnet activities (e.g., using Monad faucets, interacting with dApps like Caddy Finance or Ambient Finance, completing Layer3 quests) are eligible to claim the airdrop by _$TIME_1. Verification requires documented eligibility lists, official claim instructions, or claim portal status published by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if by _$TIME_1 no such official confirmation exists, if Monad officially cancels or indefinitely postpones the airdrop, if eligibility excludes testnet-only participants, or if the claim portal is inaccessible or does not list such participants. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Monad's official claim portal and verified official communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the airdrop does not exist or testnet-only participation is not recognized.

items.title: U.S. federal government shutdown > 30 days by October 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the U.S. federal government experiences a funding lapse resulting in a shutdown lasting more than 30 full calendar days starting from October 1, 2025, as documented by official government sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal government shutdown@content_dividerthe temporary closure of non-essential federal government operations due to funding gaps – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and reauthorization dates.

Resolves 'Yes' if official U.S. government publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial U.S. government publications@content_dividerauthoritative documents from U.S. government agencies, including the Office of Management and Budget and Congressional records – USA.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm the shutdown duration exceeds 30 full days by _$TIME_1 with verification from at least two independent government sources or major media confirmed by official statements.

Resolves 'No' if the shutdown ends on or before _$TIME_1 within 30 days after October 1, 2025, if official sources confirm no shutdown occurred, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if no reliable verification is available. In case of conflicting data, official government records take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the shutdown event never existed or funding was maintained continuously.

items.title: Pharos mainnet launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Pharos Network launches its mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMainnet launch@content_dividerthe network going live with token distribution and operational features – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official project announcements and confirmed token activation.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement from Pharos Network _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPharos Network@content_dividera blockchain project founded by ex-leaders from Ant Financial and Alibaba focusing on enterprise-grade DeFi and real-world assets – official website)_$ANNOTATION$_ or its verified channels confirms mainnet launch including token distribution by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official AMAs, website posts, or social media with backup from tier-1 crypto news sources or blockchain explorers showing live mainnet activity.

This market resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch is not confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information resolves by prioritizing official Pharos sources and major media. The market also resolves 'No' if the mainnet event never occurs or is materially different from the defined launch (e.g., no token distribution or operational features by deadline).

items.title: President Trump sends National Guard to New York City by October 17, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether a formal federal order to deploy the National Guard to New York City is issued by President Donald Trump by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNational Guard@content_dividera reserve military force that can be called into federal service by the President for domestic or overseas missions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and announced by the Department of Defense or federal government.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official Department of Defense or federal government announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDepartment of Defense@content_dividerUnited States federal executive department responsible for military forces – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm a formal federal order for National Guard deployment to New York City by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published statements on official government websites or verified federal social media accounts. Backup confirmation may include major media reports with dual tier-1 source verification.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official federal deployment order is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the deployment differs from the specified scope. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing Department of Defense or federal government sources. This market also resolves 'No' if the deployment event never existed or was never ordered.

items.title: Donald Trump invokes Insurrection Act by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether President Donald Trump formally invokes the Insurrection Act _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerInsurrection Act@content_divideran 1807 United States federal law authorizing the president to deploy military forces domestically to suppress insurrections or enforce federal authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ during his presidency by _$TIME_1, verified by official presidential documentation or government announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official presidential act formally invoking the Insurrection Act is documented and publicly confirmed by the White House or the U.S. federal government by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerpresidential proclamations, executive orders, or official government press releases published on govinfo.gov or whitehouse.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if multiple tier-1 media outlets report confirmed invocation with direct sourcing. Backup verification includes court filings or federal agency statements confirming deployment under the Act.

Resolves 'No' if no verified official invocation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or no formal invocation document exists.

items.title: Bitcoin breaks all-time high by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's USD price exceeds its previous highest recorded value on any major recognized exchange at any time before or on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to aggregated exchange data.

Resolves 'Yes' if at any point on or before _$TIME_1, official exchange aggregated price data from at least two major cryptocurrency price aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPrice aggregators@content_dividerplatforms that collect and publish combined market prices from multiple exchanges, e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin’s USD price surpasses the all-time high previously recorded, with verification from primary exchange data sources such as Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken websites or APIs.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not exceed its all-time high by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable or contradictory, if the event is effectively cancelled or unmeasurable, or if authoritative verification fails. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange API data and major aggregator consensus. Also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the price data do not exist for the period.

items.title: Ethereum > $10,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures the closing price of Ethereum in US dollars on major cryptocurrency exchanges at UTC close on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform with a native cryptocurrency called Ether – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using aggregated exchange data from authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Ethereum’s closing price is greater than or equal to $10,000 USD as reported by at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges or an aggregate price index such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes official exchange price data, reputable financial news outlets, or blockchain analytics platforms.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum’s closing price is below $10,000 USD at _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or exchanges are closed preventing price determination, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or insufficient. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and aggregate indexes. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum or the trading market ceases to exist or is indefinitely suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Republicans keep U.S. House control by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Republican Party _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRepublican Party@content_dividera major political party in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ maintains majority control of the U.S. House of Representatives _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerU.S. House of Representatives@content_dividerthe lower chamber of the United States Congress, comprising elected representatives – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as certified by official election results following the November 2026 general election, with all recounts and certifications completed by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official certified election results _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCertified election results@content_dividerfinal, official tabulation of votes as validated by authorized state or federal election authorities – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Republicans hold the majority of seats in the U.S. House of Representatives on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publication by state election boards or the U.S. House Clerk's office _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerU.S. House Clerk@content_dividerthe official responsible for administrative functions of the U.S. House including member certification – U.S. House of Representatives website https://clerk.house.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major media outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if Republicans do not hold the majority by _$TIME_1, if official results show a Democratic or other party majority, if the election is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative certification is unavailable. Conflicting reports default to official government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2026 general election does not occur or if the House composition is otherwise undefined by the deadline.

items.title: Bitcoin close above all-time high by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing price, aggregated from major cryptocurrency exchanges in USD, exceeds its current all-time high by the last trading price before market close on December 31, 2025 by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and aggregated closing price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerClosing price@content_dividerthe final price at which an asset trades during a given trading period – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if Bitcoin's aggregated closing price in USD surpasses the established all-time high as confirmed by official aggregated exchange data from sources such as CoinMarketCap or Kraken by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera widely recognized cryptocurrency market data aggregator – CoinMarketCap website)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Kraken official price feed _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividermajor cryptocurrency exchange and price data provider – Kraken website)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes cross-checking multiple leading exchange data and archival snapshots via the Internet Archive or similar at settlement.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin’s closing price does not exceed its all-time high by _$TIME_1, if the market is closed or trading halted on that date, if authoritative data sources are unavailable or contradictory, or if the event never occurred as specified. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official aggregated exchange data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the relevant exchanges cease to exist or if the all-time high is redefined contrary to market rules.

items.title: MegaETH mainnet launch by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the MegaETH blockchain mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMegaETH mainnet@content_dividerthe fully operational version of the MegaETH Layer 2 blockchain enabling live transactions and token issuance – MegaETH official documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-10-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official MegaETH communications or updates on megaeth.com.

Resolves 'Yes' if an explicit official announcement or update confirming mainnet launch is published by MegaETH's verified communication channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMegaETH official channels@content_dividerofficial MegaETH website https://megaeth.com or verified MegaETH social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official press releases, website status pages, or verified social media posts. Backup confirmation may include major crypto news outlets citing MegaETH's official statements.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation of mainnet launch occurs by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond this date, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing MegaETH's official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Bitcoin > $200,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $200,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at the close of any major regulated cryptocurrency exchange trading session by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one major cryptocurrency exchange with publicly available closing price data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera platform for buying and selling cryptocurrencies, typically providing daily OHLCV data – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially reports a closing price of Bitcoin in USD at or above $200,000 on or before _$TIME_1, verified by CoinAPI _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinAPI@content_dividera provider of unified real-time and historical crypto market data APIs – https://www.coinapi.io/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent authoritative data sources such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera widely recognized cryptocurrency data aggregator and market cap provider – https://coinmarketcap.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_. Alternative confirmation via archive.org snapshots or regulatory filings of exchange data is acceptable.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed $200,000 USD closing price on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if exchanges cease operations or delist Bitcoin before reaching that price, if data sources fail to provide verifiable closing prices, or if all authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting data resolution prioritizes official exchange publications and CoinAPI data. This market also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin never traded or was delisted before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BNB > $1500 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Binance Coin (BNB) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBinance Coin@content_dividera cryptocurrency issued by Binance exchange used for transaction fees and ecosystem participation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds USD 1500 according to aggregated live market data from major cryptocurrency exchanges including Binance by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'Yes' if the official aggregated closing price of BNB on December 31, 2025 UTC, as published on Binance's official website or verified API endpoints _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance official data@content_dividerhttps://www.binance.com/en/price/bnb)_$ANNOTATION$_, equals or exceeds $1500 USD by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes corroboration from at least two major cryptocurrency price aggregators such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko and archival snapshots from Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividerhttps://archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if BNB fails to reach $1500 by _$TIME_1, if trading data is unavailable or insufficient for verification, if the event is cancelled (e.g., Binance delisting BNB), or if the aggregated price data cannot be confirmed by authoritative sources. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing Binance official data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if BNB ceases to exist as a tradable asset before _$TIME_1 or if no verified price data exists by that time.

items.title: Crypto market recovery by October 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the total cryptocurrency market capitalization and price levels of major coins show a significant positive trend or stabilization by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMarket recovery@content_dividera measurable improvement or stabilization in market capitalization and prices of leading cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using data from authoritative market aggregators and financial regulators.

Resolves 'Yes' if official statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial statistics@content_dividerpublished market capitalization and price data from credible sources such as CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or regulatory financial reports)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm a sustained positive trend or stabilization in total crypto market capitalization and major coin prices by _$TIME_1, verified by at least two independent tier-1 data aggregators or regulatory publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerData verification@content_dividercross-verification of data across multiple authoritative sources for consistency)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if the positive trend or stabilization is not confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the crypto market experiences a decline or failure to stabilize, if authoritative data is absent or insufficient for verification, or if the market is officially declared in a prolonged downturn by regulatory bodies. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official regulatory reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the crypto market ceases to exist or data sources become permanently unavailable by the deadline.

items.title: Kalshi valuation > $9 billion by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Kalshi's valuation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerValuation@content_dividerthe monetary worth of a company based on funding rounds or market capitalization – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ surpasses $9 billion according to official funding announcements verified by major financial news outlets by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official funding announcement or company statement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divinerOfficial funding announcement@content_dividerpublic disclosures regarding investment rounds published by Kalshi or verified major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, CNBC, or Reuters)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Kalshi's valuation strictly exceeds $9 billion on or before _$TIME_1. Verification includes archived press releases on https://kalshi.com/ or filings reported by multiple tier-1 financial news outlets.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the valuation is reported at or below $9 billion, if funding rounds are cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official company announcements and corroborated tier-1 media reports. Also resolves 'No' if Kalshi never pursued or announced funding rounds targeting valuations above $9 billion by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Crypto market cap > $5T by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures the total cryptocurrency market capitalization _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerTotal cryptocurrency market capitalization@content_dividerthe combined USD market value of all cryptocurrencies globally at market close – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at or before _$TIME_1 using aggregated data from authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if the total market capitalization equals or exceeds $5 trillion USD as confirmed by official cryptocurrency market aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera trusted cryptocurrency data aggregator – https://coingecko.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires published snapshots or official API data showing $5 trillion or more in combined market cap.

Resolves 'No' if the market cap does not reach $5 trillion by _$TIME_1, if data is unavailable or unverifiable, if the event is cancelled or permanently postponed, or if reliable verification sources fail. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to CoinMarketCap, then CoinGecko, then archived snapshots. Also resolves 'No' if the cryptocurrency market ceases to exist or the metric is not computable.

items.title: China control Taiwan by December 31, 2028?
items.rules:
This market measures whether China establishes effective political or military governance over any part of Taiwan island or government by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerControl@content_dividerthe act or power of governing or dominating a territory or government – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, confirmed by credible international or official sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative confirmation is published by the People’s Republic of China government, the Taiwan government, a United Nations body _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUnited Nations@content_dividerinternational organization promoting peace and security – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or two or more major tier-1 global media outlets by _$TIME_1, explicitly stating that China has established effective governance over any part of Taiwan island or government. Verification includes official government statements, international organization reports, or verified visual evidence from credible sources.

Resolves 'No' if no such confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if the event never occurred. Conflicting evidence is resolved by prioritizing official government and international organization sources. This market also resolves 'No' if China’s control does not include effective political or military governance as defined or if verifiable data is insufficient.

items.title: Donald Trump Xi Jinping meeting at APEC summit by November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether President Donald Trump _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_divider45th President of the United States, serving 2017-2021 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and President Xi Jinping _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerXi Jinping@content_dividerGeneral Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party and President of the People's Republic of China – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ meet at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerAPEC summit@content_divideran annual forum for 21 Pacific Rim economies to promote free trade and economic cooperation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in South Korea by _$TIME_1, with occurrence confirmed by official announcements from APEC organizers or government statements.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official statement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerofficial statement@content_dividerformal announcement by government or event authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or press release from the APEC secretariat _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerAPEC secretariat@content_dividerthe permanent organization managing APEC activities – https://www.apec.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ or from the governments of the United States or China explicitly confirms a meeting between Trump and Xi Jinping at the APEC summit by _$TIME_1. Verification may also be obtained through corroborated major media reports (two or more tier-1 sources) or visual evidence (photographs or videos) with source attribution published by _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividertier-1 sources@content_dividerglobally recognized major news organizations with editorial standards)_$ANNOTATION$_ before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the meeting is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if either leader does not attend the APEC summit, or if reliable verification data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official government or APEC secretariat announcements. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the meeting event never existed or never took place by the deadline.

items.title: BTC > $80,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Bitcoin closing price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $80,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at the end of December 31, 2025 UTC time _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUTC@content_dividerCoordinated Universal Time, the primary time standard by which the world regulates clocks and time – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to aggregated price data from major cryptocurrency exchanges.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the aggregated closing price of Bitcoin on _$TIME_1 exceeds 80,000 USD as confirmed by data published by at least two major cryptocurrency market data providers such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera website providing cryptocurrency market capitalization rankings and price data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency data aggregator providing price and volume information – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible, timestamped price snapshots or official exchange reports.

This market resolves 'No' if the closing price does not exceed 80,000 USD on _$TIME_1, if data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if trading is halted or markets are closed permanently before that time. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data over secondary sources. Also, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the referenced market does not exist or is delisted by _$TIME_1.

items.title: USA x Venezuela military conflict by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures the occurrence of any direct armed engagement between USA and Venezuelan forces before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMilitary conflict@content_dividerany armed engagement between military forces of two countries – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as reported by official government or credible news sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if official sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divinereliable confirmation@content_dividergovernment statements, verified major media, or official military publications)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm any direct armed clash between USA and Venezuela forces by _$TIME_1. Verification requires explicit reports from U.S. Department of Defense, Venezuelan Ministry of Defense, or two or more major tier-1 media outlets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTier-1 media@content_dividerleading global news organizations with editorial standards – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no verified direct armed engagement occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradicts occurrence. The market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or if only indirect or proxy conflicts occur without direct USA-Venezuela armed engagement.

items.title: BTC < $100,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price falls below $100,000 USD according to Binance BTC/USDT trading pair data by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any official Binance BTC/USDT price candle shows a trading price below $100,000 USD at or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Binance price candle@content_dividerverified trading data including open, high, low, close prices from Binance exchange API or website)_$ANNOTATION$_. Confirmation requires Binance's official price data published on their website or authenticated API endpoint _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance official site@content_dividerhttps://www.binance.com/en/price/bitcoin)_$ANNOTATION$_ or corroboration from at least two independent major cryptocurrency data aggregators such as CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividercryptocurrency data platform providing price and market metrics – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Token Metrics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerToken Metrics@content_dividercrypto analytics API for real-time and historical Bitcoin data)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no Binance BTC/USDT price candle below $100,000 USD exists at or before _$TIME_1, if Binance trading data is unavailable or unverified, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification data cannot be obtained by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing Binance official data, then corroborated aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading on Binance BTC/USDT pair does not exist or the price threshold condition never occurred.

items.title: Manchester United top four Premier League by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Manchester United appears in the top four positions of the Premier League official league table as published for the 2025-26 season by the Premier League by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividerthe top professional football division in England organized by the Premier League Limited – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if the official Premier League final table explicitly lists Manchester United in any of the first four positions by _$TIME_1, verified via the official Premier League website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Premier League website@content_dividerhttps://www.premierleague.com/tables)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived official publications. Backup verification includes major verified sports media (e.g., ESPN, BBC Sport) reporting with consistent top four confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if Manchester United is not ranked in the top four in the official Premier League final table by _$TIME_1, if the league season is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing official Premier League sources. Also resolves 'No' if the Premier League 2025-26 season does not take place or if Manchester United is excluded from the league standings.

items.title: Donald Trump announces 2026 presidential campaign by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump makes a formal public declaration of intent to run for U.S. president in 2026 by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAnnouncement@content_dividerformal public declaration of presidential campaign intent – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ verified by official campaign or U.S. government sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement is confirmed by Donald Trump's campaign website or verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial campaign source@content_dividerthe candidate’s authorized campaign website or verified social media profiles)_$ANNOTATION$_, or by formal U.S. government filings such as Federal Election Commission (FEC) documents _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFEC@content_dividerFederal Election Commission: U.S. agency regulating campaign finance – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes major tier-1 media outlets reporting with explicit official confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no verifiable announcement occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official sources deny any announcement, or if reliable verification data is unavailable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official campaign and government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the announcement event never occurs or is materially different than defined.

items.title: Ethereum price < $4,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the trading price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform with its own cryptocurrency ETH – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ falls below USD 4,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to closing prices on major cryptocurrency exchanges denominated in USD.

Resolves 'Yes' if any verified trade price of Ethereum on any major centralized cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ trades below USD 4,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed through official exchange data APIs or publicly available price charts (e.g., Kraken, Binance, Coinbase) accessed via archive or direct verification.

Resolves 'No' if Ethereum never trades below USD 4,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1, or if price data is unavailable, the event is effectively non-existent (e.g., Ethereum delisted), or if authoritative sources fail to confirm any sub-4,000 trades by the deadline. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to official exchange API data, with backup confirmation from multiple major exchanges. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases trading or is officially removed before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BNB > $2,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Binance Coin (BNB) price exceeds $2,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to official closing prices on major cryptocurrency exchanges, primarily Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: global cryptocurrency exchange platform founded in 2017 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if a documented price exceeding $2,000 USD is confirmed on Binance or at least two other major exchanges by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerverified closing price data from Binance.com or equivalent official exchange APIs)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes archived exchange data, official exchange statements, or major financial media reports with dual source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if BNB never closes above $2,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or Binance delists BNB before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts resolve by prioritizing official Binance data, then major exchanges, then financial regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if BNB trading never occurred or the token ceased to exist before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Manchester City wins all next 3 matches by November 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Manchester City Football Club officially wins all three consecutive scheduled matches on October 18, October 25, and November 1, 2025, as confirmed by official Premier League or club sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerManchester City Football Club@content_dividerprofessional football club competing in the English Premier League – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividerthe top tier professional football league in England – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ within the specified period by the deadline _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official match results from the Premier League website or Manchester City’s official announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial sources@content_dividerclub websites, league official websites, or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Manchester City won all three matches by _$TIME_1. Verification includes match outcome publications, official score reports, or credible visual evidence such as broadcast footage or verified photographic records.

This market resolves 'No' if Manchester City fails to win any one of the three matches by _$TIME_1, if any match is cancelled, postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, or if official results are unavailable or unverified. Conflicting or ambiguous data defaults to 'No'. If any scheduled match never occurred or the event is otherwise void, this market also resolves 'No'.

items.title: Elon Musk X Coin launch by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Elon Musk officially launches X Coin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerX Coin@content_dividera cryptocurrency or digital token branded as 'X Coin' associated with Elon Musk – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, defined as public product release or availability according to official announcements or verified statements.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Elon Musk or an official company affiliated with him publishes a direct, explicit launch confirmation of X Coin by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Elon Musk's verified social media accounts or official company websites)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major media reports corroborated by two or more tier-1 sources or official filings disclosing the product launch.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative launch confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the launch is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if verification sources are unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official Elon Musk or company sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if X Coin never existed or was never officially planned.

items.title: China tariff increase on US imports by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the People's Republic of China officially increases tariff rates _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerTariff increase@content_divideran official rise in import duties imposed by a government on foreign goods – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on goods imported from the United States by _$TIME_1 according to formal government notices or trade policy announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China or other official Chinese government agencies _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMinistry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China@content_dividerChina’s governmental department responsible for trade policy and regulation – Official Chinese Government)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly announce a tariff increase on US imports by _$TIME_1 via official channels such as government websites, gazettes, or verified statements. Backup confirmation may be obtained from major international trade bodies or authoritative trade news outlets with dual tier-1 source verification.

Resolves 'No' if no such official tariff increase is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the tariff increase is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the reported changes differ from an actual tariff increase on US imports. Conflicting information shall be resolved prioritizing official Chinese government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never announced.

items.title: Ethereum price ≥ $4,269 by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Ethereum in USD on major cryptocurrency exchanges is at least $4,269 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain platform featuring smart contracts and its native cryptocurrency ETH – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerClosing price@content_dividerthe final price at which a security or asset trades during a regular trading session – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Prices are aggregated from reputable exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, and Gemini _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms that facilitate the trading of cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official closing price data from at least two major exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerMajor exchanges@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platforms with high liquidity and global recognition such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, Gemini – TradingView)_$ANNOTATION$_ show Ethereum closing at or above $4,269 USD on any day up to and including _$TIME_1, verified through primary exchange websites, official API endpoints, or archived trading records _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerVerification sources@content_dividerprimary source exchange data, TradingView charts, and Internet Archive snapshots)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum never closes at or above $4,269 USD by _$TIME_1, if the market or exchanges cease operation, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradicts the threshold. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and archive records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist, is delisted, or the price measurement event never occurs.

items.title: Any player >10 kills in 2025 LoL Worlds final by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any player achieves more than 10 kills (at least 11) in a single game during the 2025 League of Legends World Championship final on November 9, 2025, using official match statistics from Riot Games esports platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLeague of Legends@content_dividera multiplayer online battle arena video game developed by Riot Games – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRiot Games@content_dividerdeveloper and publisher of League of Legends and its esports platform – Riot Games official website https://www.riotgames.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Riot Games esports statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial statistics@content_dividermatch data published on Riot Games esports platform at https://lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm at least one player recorded 11 or more kills in any single game of the Grand Final by _$TIME_1. Verification includes Riot’s public match VODs, official post-match reports, or Riot press releases.

Resolves 'No' if no player reaches more than 10 kills in a single game of the Grand Final by _$TIME_1, if the final is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official data is unavailable or unverifiable, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Riot Games official data and verified sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 Worlds final does not take place or is not conducted as scheduled.

items.title: Game duration < 20 minutes in 2025 LoL Worlds Final by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the 2025 League of Legends World Championship final game lasts less than 20 minutes from official match start to Nexus destruction _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLeague of Legends@content_dividera multiplayer online battle arena video game developed and published by Riot Games – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerWorld Championship@content_dividerthe annual premier tournament for League of Legends organized by Riot Games – Riot Games official)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to the official match timer from Riot Games broadcasts and match records.

Resolves 'Yes' if the final game duration is strictly under 20 minutes as recorded by the official Riot Games match timer and confirmed by Riot Games public match records or official broadcasts by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial Riot Games sources@content_dividerRiot Games official website, Riot Games verified broadcast channels, or official esports match records at https://lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if the final game lasts 20 minutes or more, if the game or final is cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official Riot Games data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Riot Games official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 League of Legends World Championship final game does not take place as scheduled.

items.title: More than 3 Baron Nashor kills in 2025 LoL Worlds Final by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the total Baron Nashor kills _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBaron Nashor kills@content_dividerthe count of kills of the strongest neutral monster on Summoner's Rift in League of Legends – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in the final match of the 2025 League of Legends World Championship _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship@content_dividerannual esports tournament organized by Riot Games – Riot Games Official)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceed 3, based exclusively on official match statistics provided by Riot Games' esports platform (lolesports.com). Data is collected from the in-game official stats for the final match only by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official match statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial match statistics@content_dividerin-game recorded and published data by Riot Games esports platform – lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ show more than 3 Baron Nashor kills in the 2025 final match, confirmed and published on Riot Games’ official esports website or verified Riot Games social media accounts by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived official match VODs or match summary reports from authoritative esports data aggregators with source linkage to Riot Games.

This market resolves 'No' if the final match features 3 or fewer Baron Nashor kills by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, postponed indefinitely, or if official match statistics are unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. If conflicting data exists, resolution defers to Riot Games official published statistics or their esports platform as primary authority. The market also resolves 'No' if the 2025 final match does not occur by the deadline or official records confirm no Baron Nashor kills took place.

items.title: Any player >10 deaths in 2025 LoL Worlds final by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any player records at least 11 in-game deaths _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerdeath@content_divideran in-game player elimination officially recorded by Riot Games during a League of Legends match – Riot Games)_$ANNOTATION$_ in the 2025 League of Legends World Championship final match by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-11-09T15:00:00Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Official match data from Riot Games Esports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRiot Games Esports@content_dividerdeveloper and publisher of League of Legends and official provider of esports statistics – Riot Games Official)_$ANNOTATION$_ will be the primary data source, with verification through GRID esports data distribution and official Riot Games publications.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any player’s official death count in the final match is 11 or more as published by Riot Games Esports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com and Riot Games official data platforms)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires player death statistics posted on Riot Games’ official website or GRID esports data feeds, or validated match VODs with official Riot timestamps confirming death counts.

This market resolves 'No' if no player reaches 11 deaths by _$TIME_1, if the final match is cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if official death data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data resolution prioritizes Riot Games official publications first, then GRID data, followed by corroborated esports media reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 World Championship final does not occur or if no match is played.

items.title: Fluent Mainnet Launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Fluent mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFluent mainnet@content_dividerthe official live blockchain network operated by Fluent Labs, distinct from testnets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches with an official announcement from Fluent Labs or verified channels by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if Fluent Labs or officially verified sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerFluent Labs official website, verified social media accounts, or authoritative press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ publish a clear mainnet launch announcement by _$TIME_1, including details of network activation or public availability. Backup verification includes major media reports citing official statements or visual evidence from verified Fluent channels.

Resolves 'No' if no official mainnet launch announcement is made by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the event never occurred as defined. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Fluent Labs' official communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch event does not exist or is fundamentally different from the defined Fluent mainnet launch.

items.title: Any LoL Worlds 2025 game < 20 minutes by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any match in the 2025 League of Legends World Championship ends in less than 20 minutes according to official match duration data recorded by Riot Games during the tournament, with times measured from game start to finish _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship@content_dividerannual international esports tournament organized by Riot Games for the game League of Legends – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and match times as defined by official Riot Games records _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRiot Games@content_dividerdeveloper and publisher of League of Legends, official source of match data – Riot Games website https://www.riotgames.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any official match in the Worlds 2025 tournament lasts under 20 minutes as per Riot Games published match times by _$TIME_1. Verification requires accessing official Riot Games match statistics via the official LoL Esports website or Riot’s verified APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerLoL Esports@content_dividerofficial competitive League of Legends esports platform operated by Riot Games – https://lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived official records. Backup verification may include corroboration from major esports media outlets with explicit match duration reporting.

This market resolves 'No' if no match ends under 20 minutes by _$TIME_1, if the tournament is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable official match duration data is unavailable. In cases of conflicting data, priority is given to Riot Games official match records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025 Worlds tournament does not occur or no games are played.

items.title: Player >10 kills single game Worlds 2025 by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any player achieves more than 10 kills in a single game during the 2025 League of Legends World Championship by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship@content_dividerannual global esports tournament organized by Riot Games featuring professional League of Legends teams – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using official kill counts from Riot Games' match statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerkill@content_divideran instance of a player eliminating an opponent in a game – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ recorded during Worlds 2025.

Resolves 'Yes' if official tournament data published by Riot Games _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRiot Games@content_dividervideo game developer and esports organizer responsible for League of Legends – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms at least one player records 11 or more kills in a single game by _$TIME_1. Verification requires Riot’s official match statistics or verified statements on Riot’s Worlds 2025 website or verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerofficial source@content_dividerprimary source such as company website or verified social media profiles)_$ANNOTATION$_ by deadline. Backup confirmation includes major esports media reporting with multiple tier-1 source verification or verified visual evidence from official streams.

Resolves 'No' if no player achieves more than 10 kills in any single game by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official statistics are unavailable or incomplete at settlement, or if authoritative verification is absent. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing Riot’s official data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Worlds 2025 does not occur or no games are played.

items.title: Any player >10 deaths in a single game at 2025 LoL Worlds by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any individual player records more than 10 deaths in a single official match during the 2025 League of Legends World Championship by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship@content_dividerannual international esports tournament for the video game League of Legends – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ using official player death statistics from Riot Games match data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRiot Games@content_dividerdeveloper and publisher of League of Legends, official source for match statistics – Riot Games Official Website)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if any player dies 11 or more times in any official Worlds 2025 match according to Riot Games’ official match statistics published by _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRiot Games official sources@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com and Riot Games verified social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes match result pages, official Riot statistics APIs, or authorized esports reporting platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBackup verification@content_dividerInternet Archive snapshots of official match data or tier-1 esports media with Riot confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no player reaches more than 10 deaths in any official Worlds 2025 match by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if official statistics are unavailable or unverified by that deadline. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing Riot Games official data. Also resolves 'No' if the 2025 League of Legends World Championship does not occur or has no official matches.

items.title: More than 3 Baron Nashor kills in any 2025 Worlds game by November 9?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any single game during the 2025 League of Legends World Championship features more than 3 Baron Nashor kills according to official objective takedown statistics recorded by Riot Games during the tournament's Knockout Stage, resolved by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBaron Nashor kill@content_dividerthe official count of Baron Nashor epic monster kills as recorded in match statistics – Riot Games official data)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one match officially documents more than 3 Baron Nashor kills by _$TIME_1 as published on Riot Games' official Worlds 2025 statistics page _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRiot Games official statistics@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com/worlds/2025/stats)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified Riot Games social media accounts. Backup verification includes major esports media outlets reporting with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no game exceeds 3 Baron Nashor kills by _$TIME_1, if the 2025 Worlds Knockout Stage is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official statistics are unavailable or unverifiable, or if the event does not exist. Conflicting data resolves in favor of official Riot Games publications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no games are played or Baron Nashor kills are not recorded.

items.title: Apple foldable iPhone announcement by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Apple Inc. _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerApple Inc.@content_dividerAmerican multinational technology company known for consumer electronics and software – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially announces its first foldable iPhone _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFoldable iPhone@content_dividera smartphone with a flexible, foldable display designed and marketed by Apple Inc. – combined concept)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to Apple’s public communications or press releases published on official platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official Apple public communication or press release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Apple’s official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirms the development or launch of a foldable iPhone by _$TIME_1. Verification includes direct Apple website announcements, Apple Newsroom, or verified Apple social media channels. Backup verification may include major technology media outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such official announcement is made by _$TIME_1, if the announcement is explicitly denied or indefinitely postponed, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. This market also resolves 'No' if the foldable iPhone product is cancelled, rebranded without foldable feature, or if the event never existed. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing direct Apple sources and official press releases.

items.title: Fluent ecosystem > 1 million active users by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Fluent ecosystem _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFluent ecosystem@content_dividera digital platform comprising Fluent’s products, services, and user base – official company definition)_$ANNOTATION$_ surpasses 1 million monthly active users _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMonthly active users@content_dividerthe count of unique users engaging with a service at least once per calendar month – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official Fluent ecosystem metrics.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified Fluent ecosystem metrics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial Fluent ecosystem metrics@content_divideruser activity data published by Fluent on its official website or verified communication channels)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm over 1 million monthly active users by _$TIME_1. Verification requires public statements, official reports, or dashboard data published by Fluent at https://fluent.com or Fluent’s verified social media accounts. Backup confirmation may include major tier-1 media reports independently verifying these metrics.

Resolves 'No' if the threshold is not met by _$TIME_1, if official Fluent sources explicitly deny surpassing 1 million active users, if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official Fluent disclosures. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Fluent ecosystem or active user metric does not exist or is never published.

items.title: Ethereum ≥ $10,000 by December 31, 2030?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the USD price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_divideran open-source blockchain platform with native token ether (ETH) – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $10,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before the deadline _$TIME_1 according to aggregated price data from major cryptocurrency exchanges including Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange platform – Kraken.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ and TradingView _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTradingView@content_dividera financial visualization platform providing real-time market data – TradingView.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified price data from Kraken or TradingView shows ETH price ≥ $10,000 USD at any moment up to and including _$TIME_1. Verification requires archived or official exchange price data published on Kraken's official website https://www.kraken.com/prices/ethereum or TradingView https://www.tradingview.com/symbols/ETHUSD by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation may include corroborating data from at least one other major exchange with publicly accessible price records.

This market resolves 'No' if ETH price fails to reach $10,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, if trading on major exchanges is halted, or if Ethereum is delisted or ceases to exist as a tradeable asset before _$TIME_1. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to Kraken's official price data, followed by TradingView, then other major exchanges. Additionally, the market resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or is fundamentally replaced before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Solana (SOL) > $500 by December 31, 2030?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera blockchain platform native cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $500 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to price data aggregated from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms where digital assets are traded – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified on authoritative market data sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if at any moment on or before _$TIME_1 the official SOL price equals or exceeds $500 USD as confirmed by at least one primary authoritative source such as CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or SolanaFM _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market capitalization tracking website – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividercryptocurrency data aggregator – CoinGecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, or _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerSolanaFM@content_divideron-chain data and price analytics platform for Solana – SolanaFM.io)_$ANNOTATION$_. Confirmation requires publicly accessible historical price records or snapshots reflecting the $500+ milestone.

Resolves 'No' if the SOL price never reaches $500 USD by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges delist SOL or trading halts indefinitely before the deadline, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable. If conflicting data arises, resolution follows majority consensus among primary sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana (SOL) ceases to exist as a tradable asset or is permanently suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $126,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price exceeds USD 126,000 on any major US exchange at 23:59:59 UTC on December 31, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ Price data is based on aggregated trading prices from authoritative US exchanges such as Coinbase, Kraken, and Binance.US _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMajor US exchanges@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platforms registered or operating primarily in the United States with high liquidity and regulatory compliance – CoinDesk)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if any verified major US exchange reports a last-trade or official closing price > USD 126,000 at or before 23:59:59 UTC on December 31, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Verification requires data published on official exchange websites or trusted financial data aggregators like CoinDesk and CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerSources@content_dividerhttps://www.coindesk.com/price/bitcoin, https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Backup verification includes archived snapshots from the Internet Archive and regulatory filings if available.

This market resolves 'No' if no major US exchange reports Bitcoin trading above USD 126,000 by _$TIME_1, if trading halts or exchanges delist Bitcoin before that time, if data is unavailable or unverifiable, or if the event (Bitcoin trading) ceases to exist. Conflicting reports are resolved prioritizing official exchange data and major aggregator consensus. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading never resumes or the market closes permanently before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by November 30?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's price in USD reaches or exceeds $150,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera decentralized digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as determined by aggregated exchange prices at market close UTC on _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if credible price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges or aggregated market data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial exchange APIs, CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or regulated financial data providers)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin's price equals or exceeds $150,000 USD by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published price snapshots or official exchange closing prices accessible at or immediately after _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin's price does not reach $150,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable or contradictory, or if market trading is suspended or halted indefinitely before _$TIME_1. In cases of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange data and aggregated sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or pricing data does not exist or is permanently discontinued.

items.title: BTC ≥ $87,000 before December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (digital cryptocurrency _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) reaches or exceeds a price of $87,000 USD (United States dollar _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerofficial currency of the United States of America – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) on any major cryptocurrency exchange during December 2025 before _$TIME_1. Price is based on closing prices in USD aggregated from major exchanges according to official market data.

Resolves 'Yes' if any credible major exchange (including but not limited to Coinbase, Binance, Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMajor exchanges@content_dividerestablished cryptocurrency trading platforms with high liquidity and regulatory compliance – Forbes Crypto Glossary)_$ANNOTATION$_) reports Bitcoin closing price at or above $87,000 USD on any trading day during December 2025 by _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data published on official websites or trusted financial data providers such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may use archived data from Internet Archive or equivalent.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin never reaches or exceeds $87,000 USD closing price on any major exchange during December 2025 by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges cease operation or suspend Bitcoin trading during that period, or if price data cannot be reliably verified. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and major financial data aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or price reporting does not occur or is suspended during December 2025.

items.title: Recallnet $RECALL token ≥ $1.00 for 30 days by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Recallnet’s $RECALL token _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRECALL token@content_dividera cryptocurrency token issued by Recallnet platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ maintains a price of at least $1.00 USD continuously for a 30-day period ending on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ as measured by aggregated trading data from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividertop recognized digital asset trading platforms offering $RECALL token trading with public price data – CoinAPI, CryptoAPIs)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official trading data from at least two major exchanges confirm $RECALL’s price remains at or above $1.00 USD continuously for any full consecutive 30-day period ending on or before _$TIME_1, as verified by publicly accessible APIs or archive snapshots _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerverification@content_dividerprice data available via official exchange APIs or major data providers such as CoinAPI (https://www.coinapi.io), CryptoAPIs (https://cryptoapis.io), or archived Internet Archive captures)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if the 30-day price stability condition is unmet by _$TIME_1, if the $RECALL token is delisted, trading is halted indefinitely, or if authoritative price data is unavailable. If data conflicts arise, priority is given to official exchange APIs and corroborated market data providers. This market also resolves 'No' if the $RECALL token never existed, was never listed, or if continuous 30-day price data is unobtainable.

items.title: Cryptocurrency liquidations > $500M by October 21, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the total cryptocurrency leveraged position liquidations exceed $500 million USD on October 21, 2025, as aggregated from major exchanges including Binance, Bybit, and OKX via Coinglass.com data covering the full UTC day _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLiquidation volume@content_dividerthe total value of forced position closures due to margin calls or insolvency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and reported in USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Data collection follows exchange reporting cycles and global market closing times standardized to UTC.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative aggregated liquidation data from Coinglass.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinglass.com@content_dividercryptocurrency market analytics platform aggregating liquidation data from major exchanges – Coinglass official site https://www.coinglass.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows total liquidations strictly greater than $500,000,000 USD for October 21, 2025, confirmed by direct Coinglass publication or official exchange confirmation by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived snapshots via Internet Archive or official exchange reports from Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividera major global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, Bybit _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerBybit@content_dividera cryptocurrency derivatives exchange platform – Coinglass and Bybit official sites)_$ANNOTATION$_, and OKX _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerOKX@content_dividercryptocurrency exchange offering spot and derivatives trading – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'No' if total liquidations do not exceed $500 million USD by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if Coinglass.com or exchanges fail to publish verifiable data by settlement time, or if data is insufficient or contradictory. In disputes, resolution follows Coinglass.com data precedence and official exchange disclosures. It also resolves 'No' if the liquidation event never occurred or was never recorded on the specified date.

items.title: Netflix market capitalization > Amazon by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Netflix's market capitalization exceeds Amazon's market capitalization as of the official stock market closing on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMarket capitalization@content_dividerthe total market value of a company's outstanding shares calculated by multiplying share price by number of shares outstanding – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, expressed in billions of USD according to official financial disclosures and stock exchange data.

Resolves 'Yes' if Netflix's official market capitalization at closing on _$TIME_1 is strictly greater than Amazon's official market capitalization at the same time, as published by primary authoritative sources including Nasdaq, NYSE, or company investor relations websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source examples@content_dividerhttps://www.nasdaq.com, https://www.nyse.com, https://ir.netflix.net, https://ir.aboutamazon.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major financial data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or SEC filings.

Resolves 'No' if Netflix's market capitalization does not exceed Amazon's by _$TIME_1, if either company's stock is delisted, trading is halted indefinitely before _$TIME_1, or if official verification data is unavailable or contradictory.
