Conflicting data resolves in favor of primary official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if either company ceases to exist, or if the event never existed (e.g., market data not published).

items.title: NYC temperature > 50°F by December 25, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the maximum daily temperature in New York City _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNew York City@content_dividera major city in the state of New York, United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds 50 degrees Fahrenheit _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFahrenheit@content_dividera temperature scale on which water freezes at 32°F and boils at 212°F – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on December 25, 2025, based on official meteorological data collected and reported by the National Weather Service or equivalent authoritative sources for the local timezone America/New_York _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerAmerica/New_York timezone@content_dividertime zone for New York City, UTC−05:00 standard time, UTC−04:00 daylight saving time – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official meteorological reports from the National Weather Service (https://www.weather.gov/nyc) or the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerNOAA@content_dividerUnited States federal agency focused on the conditions of the oceans and the atmosphere – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ show that the daily maximum temperature recorded in New York City on December 25, 2025, strictly exceeds 50°F by 23:59:59 UTC on that date. Backup confirmation may be obtained via trusted commercial weather services with archived data such as WeatherAPI or Weather Underground.

This market resolves 'No' if the official maximum temperature does not exceed 50°F on December 25, 2025, if official data is unavailable or unverifiable by the deadline, or if the measurement event is cancelled or never reported. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to National Weather Service or NOAA records. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the meteorological event is invalid or does not exist.

items.title: Bitcoin < $100,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price in USD trades below $100,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to closing prices reported by major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera decentralized digital currency without central authority, traded electronically – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and aggregated market data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms for buying and selling cryptocurrencies, e.g., Coinbase, Kraken, Binance – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if any verified major exchange reports a closing price below $100,000 USD at any point on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency trading platform with verifiable and publicly accessible price data – Kraken, Coinbase, Binance)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires price data from at least two independent major exchanges or authoritative financial data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerfinancial data aggregators@content_dividerwebsites providing verified aggregated cryptocurrency price data, e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not trade below $100,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or exchanges are closed before this date _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividertrading halt@content_dividera temporary suspension of trading activity on an exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or insufficient for verification. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange sources and major financial aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the referenced trading event never existed or was delisted by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Virtuals Protocol price > $1 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Virtuals Protocol (VIRTUAL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerVirtuals Protocol@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency token issued on a blockchain platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $1 USD on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ based on the highest verified trade price on major cryptocurrency exchanges.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any recorded trade price of VIRTUAL strictly greater than $1 USD is confirmed by official exchange data sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial exchange data@content_dividerprice data published on verified cryptocurrency exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or Margex)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes archived exchange records, official API endpoints, or authenticated third-party aggregators (e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko).

This market resolves 'No' if no verified trade price exceeds $1 USD by _$TIME_1, if VIRTUAL is delisted, trading halted, or exchanges cease operation before _$TIME_1, or if price data is unavailable or unverifiable. If conflicting data arises, priority is given to official exchange records and aggregate data from multiple tier-1 sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if VIRTUAL does not exist or was never listed by major exchanges before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Super Bowl 2026 attendance > 65,000 by February 8?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the official attendance at the Super Bowl 2026 exceeds 65,000 people as reported in the National Football League's post-event attendance report. Resolution is based on data published by the NFL and verified through multiple authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if the official NFL attendance report or an equivalent authoritative NFL publication _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNFL attendance report@content_dividerthe official post-event report published by the National Football League – NFL.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms attendance exceeding 65,000 by _$TIME_1. Verification may include NFL official website publications, verified NFL social media accounts, or major sports media with explicit NFL confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if attendance does not exceed 65,000 by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official attendance data is unavailable or unverifiable by that deadline, or if conflicting data cannot be resolved by prioritizing NFL official sources. Also resolves 'No' if the event did not occur or was never scheduled.

items.title: Ethereum ≤ $2,500 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum's USD price reaches or falls below $2,500 at any time by _$TIME_1 according to aggregated exchange rates from authoritative cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain with smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCryptocurrency@content_dividera digital currency using cryptography for secure transactions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one authoritative source, including official exchange APIs such as Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange and trading platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinMarketCap, reports Ethereum's USD price at or below $2,500 at any instant before or on _$TIME_1. Verification requires published historical price data or official API logs accessible at settlement.

Resolves 'No' if Ethereum's price never reaches or falls below $2,500 by _$TIME_1, if the market or trading on Ethereum is suspended or delisted before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs and major crypto data aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or trading is permanently halted before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Bitcoin < $100,000 by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing price falls below 100,000 USD on any major cryptocurrency exchange on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using aggregated price data from leading exchanges to determine the official market price in United States Dollars (USD).

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one verified major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor cryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera leading digital asset trading platform such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or Bitstamp – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports Bitcoin's official closing price below 100,000 USD on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed by primary source publication on the exchange's official website or API endpoint _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerverified company website or API data feed)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes corroboration by at least two other tier-1 crypto data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerData aggregator@content_dividerservices like CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko providing consolidated price data – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin's closing price remains at or above 100,000 USD on all major exchanges through _$TIME_1, or if no authoritative price data confirms a lower closing price by that time. Also resolves 'No' if the market or data reporting is disrupted, cancelled, or unavailable. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange sources, then major aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or price reporting never occurred or was suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Bitcoin < $100,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's USD closing price dips below $100,000 at any point on any major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data is based on official closing prices aggregated from institutional-grade exchanges with persistent market data feeds.

Resolves 'Yes' if verifiable closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms facilitating buying and selling of cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows Bitcoin's price closing below $100,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Official exchange websites, institutional data providers like Amberdata _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerAmberdata@content_dividercryptocurrency and blockchain market data provider – company website https://amberdata.io)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Messari _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerMessari@content_dividercryptocurrency market intelligence platform – https://messari.io)_$ANNOTATION$_, or archival data from Internet Archive verify the event.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin's closing price never falls below $100,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if exchanges suspend trading or delist Bitcoin before that, or if authoritative verification data is unavailable or contradictory. If price data sources become inaccessible, resolution uses archived data and regulatory filings. Event non-existence (e.g., Bitcoin trading halts permanently) also results in 'No'.

items.title: SUI > $2.40 by October 19, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the cryptocurrency SUI _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSUI@content_dividera digital asset and native token of the Sui blockchain platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ price exceeds the support level of $2.40 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividersupport level@content_dividera price level that acts as a floor preventing further decline – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before the end of day (23:59:59 UTC) on October 19, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-10-19T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data must be sourced from established cryptocurrency exchanges or aggregators.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges or consolidated market data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerauthoritative sources@content_dividerCoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, Binance official data, or similar)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm that SUI’s price traded strictly greater than $2.40 USD at any time before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible historical price charts or API data snapshots, archived if needed, with timestamps confirming the price level breach.

This market resolves 'No' if no such price breach above $2.40 USD is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if trading data is unavailable or unreliable, if the SUI token ceases trading, or if the market is suspended or delisted before _$TIME_1. Conflicting reports resolve by prioritizing aggregate data from top-tier exchanges and recognized price aggregators. Also resolves 'No' if SUI token or the event never existed or if official price data cannot be confirmed.

items.title: James Wynn X space appearance by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether James Wynn physically participates in a verified X (formerly Twitter) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerX, formerly Twitter@content_dividera social media platform owned by X Corp. enabling posts and live audio spaces – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ Spaces event by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires official confirmation from X platform records or direct visual/audio evidence.

Resolves 'Yes' if James Wynn’s participation in any live X Spaces session is confirmed by official X Spaces logs, verified host announcements or recordings, or direct visual/audio evidence published by the official X account or major media outlets by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerX platform data, verified social media accounts, or major media with dual confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no verified appearance is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if X Spaces containing James Wynn does not exist, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved in favor of official X platform data and verified sources. Also resolves 'No' if James Wynn does not appear on any X Space before _$TIME_1.

items.title: President Trump lowers China tariffs before November 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether President Donald Trump officially lowers any tariffs imposed on imports from China by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerTariff@content_dividera tax or duty to be paid on a particular class of imports or exports – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by official announcements from the White House or U.S. trade authorities.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official statement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial statement@content_dividera formal declaration issued by authorized government office – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ from the White House (https://www.whitehouse.gov) or U.S. trade authorities (e.g., U.S. Trade Representative) explicitly announces a reduction or removal of tariffs on Chinese imports on or before _$TIME_1, verified through published government press releases or regulatory filings. Backup verification includes major tier-1 media reporting with dual-source confirmation or archival regulatory records.

Resolves 'No' if no such official tariff reduction is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if tariffs remain unchanged or are raised, if the event is cancelled or postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting information will be resolved prioritizing official government sources. Also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or was never planned.

items.title: Somnia (SOMI) > $1 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Somnia (SOMI) cryptocurrency exceeds $1 USD on any major crypto exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSomnia (SOMI)@content_dividerSomnia: a digital cryptocurrency token traded on blockchain-based exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the price is denominated in United States dollars according to market closing prices aggregated by recognized crypto price platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if any officially recognized crypto exchange or verified price aggregator _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCrypto exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports SOMI trading above $1 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1, and this is verifiable through at least two independent and reputable sources such as CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or exchange APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice aggregator@content_dividerplatforms that compile and report cryptocurrency prices from multiple exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'No' if SOMI never trades above $1 USD by _$TIME_1, if trading halts or the token is delisted before _$TIME_1, if the token ceases to exist, or if verifiable price data is unavailable or contradictory. In cases of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange API data and recognized aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Somnia (SOMI) token is discontinued, suspended indefinitely, or never listed on any exchange by the deadline.

items.title: Polymarket Token Generation Event by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Polymarket conducts a Token Generation Event (TGE) involving a real-money trade on a regulated Polymarket-operated Designated Contract Market (DCM) by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerToken Generation Event@content_divideran event where a blockchain-based token is officially issued or sold to investors – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDesignated Contract Market@content_dividera regulated trading platform approved by the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) for derivatives trading – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, confirmed by official Polymarket announcements.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a real-money trade occurs on a regulated Polymarket-operated DCM and is publicly confirmed via an official announcement from Polymarket's verified X (formerly Twitter) account by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Polymarket’s verified X account or official website – https://x.com/polymarket)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major media outlets with explicit confirmation or regulatory filings.

This market resolves 'No' if no such trade or official announcement occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official Polymarket sources take precedence. Additionally, it resolves 'No' if the event never exists or does not meet the specified criteria.

items.title: Monad market cap > $20B by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad's aggregate token market capitalization exceeds $20 billion USD at the opening of its airdrop claim portal on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMarket capitalization@content_dividerthe total market value of a company's outstanding shares or tokens calculated by multiplying price by total supply – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as reported by recognized exchanges and derivatives platforms with timing confirmed by official Monad announcements and CoinMarketCap.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Monad communications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMonad official announcements@content_dividerstatements published on Monad's official website or verified social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinMarketCap data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm market capitalization greater than $20 billion USD at the airdrop claim portal opening by _$TIME_1, with data verifiable via archival snapshots or multiple independent exchanges.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the airdrop claim portal opening is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if Monad’s market capitalization does not exceed $20 billion USD at that time. In case of conflicting data, official Monad announcements take precedence. Also resolves 'No' if Monad or the airdrop event does not occur or never existed.

items.title: President Trump pardons 2 turkeys by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether President Donald J. Trump officially pardons two turkeys during a public ceremony by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPresidential turkey pardon@content_divideran official event where the President spares turkeys from slaughter as part of a White House tradition – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as verified by authoritative government or major media sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if explicit confirmation of an official public ceremony pardoning exactly two turkeys is published by the White House or the National Turkey Federation website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNational Turkey Federation@content_dividerUS trade association representing the turkey industry, organizer of the presidential turkey pardon – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, or if major tier-1 media outlets report the event with official White House confirmation or verified visual evidence such as photographs or videos.

Resolves 'No' if no such official ceremony pardoning two turkeys occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if fewer or more than two turkeys are pardoned, if no authoritative verification exists, or if the event never took place. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official White House announcements and National Turkey Federation statements. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the presidential turkey pardon tradition is not observed or altered significantly for 2025.

items.title: Ethos Network profile picture change by October 19, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethos Network updates its profile picture on official platforms by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthos Network@content_dividera trust and reputation protocol for the on-chain economy designed as a trust layer for the crypto industry – source: Ethos official website)_$ANNOTATION$_ using direct visual confirmation methods.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Ethos Network’s profile picture is demonstrably changed on official Ethos Network social media accounts or website by _$TIME_1, verified through visual evidence or official announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial platforms@content_dividerEthos Network's verified social media accounts, official website pages)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified profile picture change occurs by _$TIME_1, if Ethos Network officially cancels or indefinitely postpones any such update, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the underlying event never existed or was not planned.

items.title: Polymarket crypto token announcement by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Polymarket _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPolymarket@content_dividera decentralized prediction market platform operating on blockchain technology – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly announces the release plan of its native crypto token by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercrypto token announcement@content_divideran official public declaration confirming the issuance or launch of a cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official company statements or verified channels.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Polymarket or its authorized representatives publish an explicit official announcement confirming a crypto token release plan by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial announcement source@content_dividercompany website, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings such as SEC documents)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification may include backup confirmation via major tier-1 media reports citing direct company confirmation or authoritative regulatory filings.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official announcement or confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if all authoritative sources fail to verify the announcement. Conflicting or speculative reports without official confirmation do not qualify. The market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never planned.

If primary official sources become unavailable, resolution will use archived versions from the Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividerhttps://archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ or regulatory repositories to verify announcements. Secondary verification includes major media outlets with multiple tier-1 confirmations.

Timing of announcements must be by or before _$TIME_1, which corresponds to 2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC converted from 11:59:59 PM EST as the final inclusive deadline.

items.title: Fluent listed on Binance by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the cryptocurrency token 'Fluent' _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFluent@content_dividera digital asset representing the Fluent project, traded on cryptocurrency exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ becomes officially listed on Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: a major global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to Binance's official announcements or equivalent authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Binance officially announces the listing of the Fluent token via their official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance official website@content_dividerhttps://www.binance.com/en/support/announcement)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified Binance social media accounts by _$TIME_1. Verification includes published listing announcements or trading pair activations explicitly naming Fluent. Backup confirmation may use major cryptocurrency news outlets with dual tier-1 source corroboration.

This market resolves 'No' if no official listing announcement occurs by _$TIME_1, if Binance announces cancellation or indefinite postponement of Fluent listing, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports defer to Binance's official statements. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the Fluent token is never listed on Binance by the deadline or if the event does not exist.

items.title: Donald Trump x Xi Jinping meeting at APEC Korea summit by October 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_divider45th President of the United States of America, serving 2017–2021 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Xi Jinping _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerXi Jinping@content_dividerGeneral Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party and President of the People's Republic of China since 2013 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ hold a bilateral meeting during the APEC summit in Gyeongju, South Korea, from October 31 to November 1, 2025, as verified by official attendance records or joint official statements.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative confirmation from official APEC summit publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerAPEC summit@content_dividerAsia-Pacific Economic Cooperation annual meeting of Pacific Rim economies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, official statements from the United States or Chinese government websites, or verified joint press releases _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial statements@content_dividerstatements published on government websites or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm a bilateral meeting took place by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes major global media reports with explicit corroboration from at least two tier-1 news sources or verified visual evidence _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerVisual evidence@content_dividerphotographs or videos with source attribution from credible institutions)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the meeting is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if the APEC summit does not occur, or if official records confirm no bilateral meeting happened. In case of conflicting reports, official government or APEC sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or if verification data is unavailable or insufficient by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Solana price ≥ $350 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana@content_dividera high-performance blockchain platform and its native cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $350 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to closing prices reported on major cryptocurrency exchanges.

Resolves 'Yes' if official closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerdigital marketplaces for trading cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ such as Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency exchange and wallet platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange providing trading and staking services – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm that Solana's price touched or exceeded $350 USD by _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires publicly archived data or official exchange statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerofficial exchange statements@content_dividerverified announcements or published price data from exchanges)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no such price level is recorded by _$TIME_1, if exchanges suspend trading indefinitely or delist SOL before reaching $350, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by deadline, or if Solana token ceases to exist. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and archived records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana or trading never existed or was suspended before the deadline.

items.title: Ethereum next major network upgrade by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum completes its next major network upgrade _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized open-source blockchain platform featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNetwork upgrade@content_dividera significant protocol-level or hard fork update succeeding Fusaka and occurring on or before _$TIME_1)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official Ethereum developer or ConsenSys announcements by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official Ethereum Foundation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerEthereum Foundation@content_dividernon-profit organization supporting Ethereum development – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or ConsenSys _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerConsenSys@content_dividerblockchain technology company focused on Ethereum infrastructure and software development – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ announcement confirms completion of the next major network upgrade by _$TIME_1. Verification requires explicit published statements on official websites, verified social media accounts, or Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) specifications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerEIP@content_dividerEthereum Improvement Proposal: formal documents describing Ethereum protocol changes – Ethereum.org)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if only partial or non-protocol upgrades occur, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. In data disputes, official Ethereum Foundation sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the upgrade event never existed or was never planned within the defined timeframe.

items.title: Binance new US regulatory action by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividera global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ faces any new formal regulatory action _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerRegulatory action@content_dividerformal enforcement or compliance requirements imposed by a regulatory agency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ from U.S. federal agencies including the SEC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerSEC@content_dividerSecurities and Exchange Commission, the U.S. federal agency regulating securities markets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, DOJ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerDOJ@content_dividerDepartment of Justice, the U.S. federal executive department responsible for law enforcement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, FinCEN _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerFinCEN@content_dividerFinancial Crimes Enforcement Network, U.S. Treasury bureau overseeing anti-money laundering – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or Treasury _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerU.S. Treasury@content_dividerUnited States Department of the Treasury, responsible for financial and monetary matters – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. New regulatory action includes any formal enforcement, compliance mandates, settlements, or official announcements issued by these agencies.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verifiable documentation or official announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=7@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatements published on government agency websites or verified communications)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm new regulatory action against Binance by _$TIME_1. Verification requires evidence from at least one primary source such as official agency press releases, regulatory filings, or DOJ court filings _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=8@counter_dividerRegulatory filings@content_dividerformal documents submitted to regulatory authorities – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may include major media reports with explicit agency confirmation or official data repositories such as the U.S. Treasury or SEC databases.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified new regulatory action is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official government publications take precedence. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the regulatory event never existed or no new enforcement or compliance action is initiated by the deadline.

items.title: Cardano major DeFi protocol launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Cardano _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCardano@content_dividera decentralized public blockchain platform supporting smart contracts and cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly launches a major decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeFi protocol@content_dividera blockchain-based financial application enabling permissionless financial services without intermediaries – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ with verified deployment or mainnet availability and measurable user activity or liquidity pools by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement or confirmation from the Cardano Foundation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCardano Foundation@content_dividera non-profit organization supporting the Cardano blockchain ecosystem – Cardano Foundation website https://cardanofoundation.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Input Output Global (IOG) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerIOG@content_dividerInput Output Global, the primary development company of Cardano – IOG website https://iohk.io)_$ANNOTATION$_ is published by _$TIME_1 confirming a major DeFi protocol launch on Cardano with measurable on-chain user activity or liquidity confirmed by blockchain explorers or major crypto analytic platforms.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation or verified evidence exists by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if measurable user activity or liquidity is absent. In case of conflicting information, official Cardano Foundation or IOG sources take precedence. The market also resolves 'No' if no major DeFi protocol launch occurs or if the event never existed.

items.title: Monad airdrop claim portal and token launch by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad's native token airdrop claim portal opens exactly on October 14, 2025, and the token launch occurs on the same day, based on official Monad announcements and verifiable sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if Monad publicly confirms via official website or verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad@content_dividerMonad, a high-performance Layer 1 blockchain compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) – official project)_$ANNOTATION$_ that both the airdrop claim portal opens and the token launch occurs on October 14, 2025, with documentation published by or before _$TIME_1. Alternative verification includes major media reports with explicit dual-tier 1 source confirmation or archived official announcements.

Resolves 'No' if the claim portal and/or token launch do not occur exactly on October 14, 2025, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if verifiable official confirmation is unavailable by _$TIME_1, or if the event differs from the specified parameters. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing official Monad sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never scheduled.

items.title: Federal Reserve rate cut confirmed by November 6?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Federal Reserve officially announces a reduction in its target interest rate at the FOMC meeting concluding by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal Reserve@content_dividerthe central banking system of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFOMC@content_dividerFederal Open Market Committee: principal monetary policymaking body of the Federal Reserve System – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if the Federal Reserve's official press release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFederal Reserve press release@content_dividerstatement published at https://www.federalreserve.gov/newsevents/pressreleases.htm)_$ANNOTATION$_ issued shortly after the November 6, 2025 FOMC meeting reports a cut in the target federal funds rate by _$TIME_1. Verification requires direct publication from the Federal Reserve's official website or an equivalent official Federal Reserve communication channel. Backup confirmation may include official Board Votes records _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBoard Votes@content_dividerhttps://www.federalreserve.gov/aboutthefed/boardvotes.htm)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major tier-1 financial news outlets citing Federal Reserve official sources.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation of a rate cut is published by _$TIME_1, if the meeting is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the Federal Reserve explicitly states no rate cut occurred, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing direct Federal Reserve official communications. Additionally, the market resolves 'No' if the FOMC meeting does not take place or if the Federal Reserve does not lower the target interest rate as specified.

items.title: BTC > $100,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin closes above $100,000 USD according to CoinMarketCap's BTC/USD closing price at UTC market close on December 31, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency price tracking website providing market data on digital assets – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if the final BTC/USD closing price on CoinMarketCap is strictly greater than $100,000 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ as published on CoinMarketCap’s official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap URL@content_dividerhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes corroboration from CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividercryptocurrency data aggregator website – CoinGecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerCoinCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data provider – coincap.io)_$ANNOTATION$_ closing price data for BTC/USD on the same date.

Resolves 'No' if the closing price is not strictly greater than $100,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if CoinMarketCap ceases operation or delists Bitcoin before the deadline, if reliable data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing CoinMarketCap’s official closing price and then backup sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the BTC/USD pair never existed or traded on CoinMarketCap by the deadline.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $150,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 based on major exchange closing prices in USD.

Resolves 'Yes' if any major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera platform for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports Bitcoin’s USD price above $150,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed by official exchange data accessible at https://www.kraken.com or https://www.binance.com or archived snapshots via https://archive.org by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not exceed $150,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable, or if exchanges cease operations before _$TIME_1. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs, followed by reputable financial news sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the price data event does not exist or is permanently suspended.

items.title: BTC ≤ $70,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing price in USD is at or below $70,000 by _$TIME_1 according to CF Benchmarks _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCF Benchmarks@content_dividera provider of independent cryptocurrency price indices based on aggregated exchange data – CF Benchmarks official)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if CF Benchmarks reports a verified closing price of Bitcoin at or below $70,000 USD on December 31, 2025, 23:59 ET _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://cfbenchmarks.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes direct access to CF Benchmarks closing price publication or archive snapshots by _$TIME_1. Backup verification may use major crypto price aggregators with CF Benchmarks reference or official regulatory filings.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin's closing price exceeds $70,000 USD at _$TIME_1, if CF Benchmarks data is unavailable or unverified by deadline, or if market trading is suspended or Bitcoin ceases to exist. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing CF Benchmarks official data. Market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin never existed or if the price metric is fundamentally different.

items.title: Kansas City Chiefs playoffs by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Kansas City Chiefs officially qualify for the NFL playoffs by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerKansas City Chiefs@content_dividerProfessional American football team based in Kansas City, Missouri, competing in the National Football League – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official NFL postseason qualification announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNFL playoffs@content_dividerNational Football League postseason tournament determining the league champion – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified through league communications following the regular season and wild card rounds.

Resolves 'Yes' if the NFL officially confirms the Chiefs’ postseason qualification by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial NFL confirmation@content_dividerStatements or publications on NFL.com, verified NFL social media accounts, or NFL press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ through direct announcements or published playoff brackets. Verification includes NFL official website (https://www.nfl.com), verified team communications, or major media outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if the Chiefs do not qualify for the playoffs by _$TIME_1, if the NFL season is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond this date, if official sources do not confirm qualification, or if playoff qualification is explicitly denied. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing NFL official sources. This market also resolves 'No' if the 2025 NFL season or Chiefs participation does not occur.

items.title: BTC ≥ $145,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's price in USD reaches or exceeds 145,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ using official closing price data from major US and global cryptocurrency exchanges, verified through authoritative financial data aggregators.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major US or global cryptocurrency exchange reports a verified closing price of Bitcoin at or above 145,000 USD by _$TIME_1, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerofficial source@content_dividercompany websites, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ with backup confirmation from at least one independent major cryptocurrency data aggregator (e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko) or major financial news outlet.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed 145,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if verified price data is unavailable or contradictory at the deadline, if trading on all major exchanges is suspended or halted indefinitely before _$TIME_1, or if Bitcoin ceases to exist as a tradable asset prior to _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin never traded or was delisted before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Elon Musk trillionaire status by December 31, 2027?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Elon Musk’s net worth exceeds $1 trillion USD as tracked by the Bloomberg Billionaire Index and Forbes net worth estimates on December 31, 2027, UTC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividernet worth@content_dividerthe total assets minus total liabilities owned by an individual – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative confirmation from either the Bloomberg Billionaire Index _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBloomberg Billionaire Index@content_dividera real-time ranking of the world's richest people based on net worth estimates maintained by Bloomberg – Bloomberg.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Forbes net worth estimates _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerForbes net worth estimates@content_dividerannual assessments of individual wealth based on assets and liabilities by Forbes magazine – Forbes.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Elon Musk’s net worth exceeds $1 trillion USD by or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published reports or official communications accessible at settlement, including archived sources if necessary.

Resolves 'No' if net worth does not exceed $1 trillion USD by _$TIME_1, if official sources deny or fail to confirm trillionaire status, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verification data from both Bloomberg and Forbes is unavailable or insufficient. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing Bloomberg and Forbes official publications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Elon Musk ceases to exist as a public figure or the concept of trillionaire status becomes obsolete before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Bilibili daily active users > 120M by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bilibili Inc. achieves an average daily active user count of at least 120 million by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDaily active user@content_dividera user who interacts with an online service or platform at least once per day – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, based on official reports published by Bilibili Inc. or its authorized representatives.

Resolves 'Yes' if Bilibili Inc. officially reports, via quarterly or annual filings on its investor relations website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBilibili investor relations@content_dividerhttps://ir.bilibili.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_, or through verified statements on official corporate channels, that the average daily active user count equals or exceeds 120 million by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes corroboration from major tier-1 financial news outlets with explicit confirmation from Bilibili or regulatory filings.

Resolves 'No' if Bilibili fails to reach the specified user count by _$TIME_1, if official reports confirm a lower figure, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if no verifiable official data is available by the deadline. In cases of conflicting data, official Bilibili filings take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bilibili ceases to exist or discontinues reporting daily active users before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Aster (ASTER) > $5 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Aster (ASTER) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAster (ASTER)@content_dividerAster is a cryptocurrency token traded on public digital asset exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ stays strictly above $5 USD according to closing prices on major exchanges by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. The resolution uses official price data from recognized cryptocurrency exchanges with public APIs or verified price aggregators.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one closing price report from a major exchange or authoritative price aggregator _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerAuthoritative price aggregator@content_dividerplatforms such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko that aggregate and verify crypto prices – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms ASTER’s price strictly exceeds $5.00 USD any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible closing price records or official exchange statements by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if ASTER’s closing price never exceeds $5.00 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted, or if the token is delisted or ceases trading prior to _$TIME_1. It also resolves 'No' if price data is unavailable or unverifiable from authoritative sources by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and reputable price aggregators. If ASTER never existed or was withdrawn from markets before _$TIME_1, the market resolves 'No'.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ price in USD exceeds $150,000 at any closing time on aggregated major exchange data up to and including _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if any verified and aggregated closing price from authoritative cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividermajor regulated or widely recognized crypto trading platforms with public price data – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ equals or surpasses $150,000 USD by _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires published official exchange data or regulatory filings _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial exchange data@content_dividerpublicly accessible daily aggregated closing prices from exchanges or trusted aggregators)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification may include major financial news outlets reporting with dual tier-1 source confirmation or blockchain analytics platforms like Chainalysis _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerChainalysis@content_dividerblockchain data platform providing market intelligence – Chainalysis)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not reach $150,000 USD on any verified exchange closing price by _$TIME_1, if the market or exchanges cease operation before the deadline, if the price target is officially withdrawn or redefined, or if data verification is unavailable. Conflicting data will defer to official exchange published prices or regulatory filings. This market also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or is delisted from all major exchanges before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Base token launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Base officially launches a token _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBase token@content_dividerthe Base token is a native digital asset of the Base blockchain network, representing tradable value on the platform – CryptoSlate)_$ANNOTATION$_ that is publicly transferable and tradable by _$TIME_1, based on Coinbase's Eastern Time zone headquarters _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinbase ET@content_dividerCoinbase headquarters operates in Eastern Time (ET), i.e., UTC-5 or UTC-4 daylight saving – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Base or Coinbase officially confirms the token launch by _$TIME_1 via an official announcement on their verified website or social media _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement on Coinbase or Base official sites, or verified Coinbase social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_, showing active public transferability and tradability on recognized exchanges or wallets. Backup confirmation may include major crypto news outlets with dual tier-1 source verification _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBackup verification@content_dividerreports from two or more major crypto news platforms such as CoinDesk, CoinTelegraph)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the token launch is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if no verifiable public transferability or tradability exists by the deadline. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official Coinbase or Base sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the token launch event never occurred or was never announced.

items.title: Somnia (SOMI) ≥ $2.00 before November 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the cryptocurrency Somnia (SOMI) reaches or exceeds a market price of $2.00 USD at any time before or on October 31, 2025, using price data from reputable USD-based exchanges and aggregators.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified price data from CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency market data aggregator and analytics platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency price tracking website and data provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows SOMI trading at or above $2.00 USD at any point before or on October 31, 2025 UTC. Verification requires archived snapshots or official API data from these sources by _$TIME_1. Backup verification may include additional reputable exchanges listing SOMI with USD trading pairs.

Resolves 'No' if no verified price reaches or exceeds $2.00 USD by _$TIME_1, if SOMI is delisted, trading is halted indefinitely before the deadline, or if price data from primary sources is unavailable or insufficient. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko official records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if SOMI token ceases to exist or trading never occurred by the deadline.

items.title: Ethena (ENA) > $0.61 by October 20?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethena (ENA) token price closes above $0.61 USD on any recognized exchange by the end of October 20, 2025 UTC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthena (ENA)@content_dividerEthena: a cryptocurrency token traded on public exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerrecognized exchange@content_dividera trading platform officially listing ENA with publicly accessible closing price data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data is confirmed by authoritative trading platforms and market analysis reports.

This market resolves 'Yes' if ENA's official closing price on any recognized exchange is strictly above $0.61 USD at or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data from at least two independent, reputable sources such as major cryptocurrency exchanges (e.g., Binance, Coinbase) or established market data aggregators (e.g., Brave New Coin) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBrave New Coin@content_dividerhttps://bravenewcoin.com/data-and-charts/assets/ENA/ethena/USD)_$ANNOTATION$_. Alternative confirmation includes official exchange APIs or major media reports explicitly confirming the closing price condition by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if ENA does not close above $0.61 USD on any recognized exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted, ENA is delisted or suspended, or if reliable verification data is missing or contradictory. Conflicts resolve by prioritizing official exchange data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if ENA token ceases to exist, market trading is permanently closed, or price data is unavailable by _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $160,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $160,000 USD in closing price on any major USD-denominated cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platforms with high liquidity and global recognition such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm a closing price of $160,000 or higher on any trading day on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible price records published on exchange websites or reputable financial data aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice data sources@content_dividerhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/ and https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin’s closing price never reaches $160,000 on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or exchanges delist Bitcoin before _$TIME_1, if authoritative price data is unavailable, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange data and verified aggregator records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or trading ceases by _$TIME_1.

items.title: ENA price > $0.40 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Ethena (ENA) token price rises above $0.40 USD after its recent low and before or at _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthena (ENA)@content_dividera cryptocurrency token issued by the Ethena Foundation – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to technical price data from CoinGape _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinGape@content_dividercryptocurrency news and technical analysis platform – CoinGape website)_$ANNOTATION$_ and CoinCodex _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinCodex@content_dividercryptocurrency price tracking and analysis service – CoinCodex website)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official price charts from CoinGape or CoinCodex confirm ENA’s price exceeds $0.40 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires archived or live price records available via CoinGape https://coingape.com/ena-price-analysis/ or CoinCodex https://coincodex.com/crypto/ethena/ by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation can be obtained from CoinMarketCap https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/ethena/ or other major cryptocurrency data providers with consistent pricing data.

This market resolves 'No' if ENA does not exceed $0.40 USD by _$TIME_1, if the token is delisted, trading is halted indefinitely, or if price data is unavailable or unverifiable at _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing CoinGape and CoinCodex official records, then CoinMarketCap. Additionally, resolves 'No' if ENA token never existed, was cancelled, or trading ceased before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BNB > $2,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Binance Coin (BNB) exceeds a closing price of $2,000 USD on any major exchange during October 1 to December 31, 2025 inclusive, using official closing prices from Binance and Kraken.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a verified official closing price above $2,000 USD for BNB appears on Binance or Kraken by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBinance Coin@content_dividerBinance Coin (BNB): native cryptocurrency token of the Binance blockchain ecosystem – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: major global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividerKraken: prominent cryptocurrency exchange known for USD trading pairs – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified by official exchange API data, company website snapshots, or regulatory filings.

This market resolves 'No' if no closing price surpassing $2,000 USD is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event timeframe lapses without occurrence, if trading is halted or BNB is delisted on both exchanges before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting information will be resolved prioritizing official exchange sources and regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Binance Coin trading never occurs or the specified exchanges cease operations before the deadline.

items.title: 1 Million Nads SBT holders claim $MON airdrop by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether holders of 1 Million Nads soulbound tokens (SBT) who completed specified testnet activities can claim their $MON token airdrop starting by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSoulbound token (SBT)@content_dividera non-transferable blockchain token representing identity or achievement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divider$MON@content_dividerthe native cryptocurrency token issued by Monad, a Layer-1 blockchain platform – Monad official site)_$ANNOTATION$_ as verified by the official Monad airdrop claim portal and community communications.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Monad sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMonad official sources@content_dividerMonad’s official website, verified social media accounts, or official announcements – Monad.com, Monad X verified account)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm that holders of 1 Million Nads SBT who completed required testnet tasks are able to claim $MON tokens via the claim portal launched on or before _$TIME_1, supported by published eligibility criteria or authoritative community statements.

Resolves 'No' if the airdrop claim portal does not open by _$TIME_1, if 1 Million Nads SBT holders cannot claim $MON tokens as of _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if eligibility criteria exclude these holders, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradicts claimability. The market also resolves 'No' if the airdrop event never existed or the 1 Million Nads SBT holders were never eligible.

Verification includes direct official statements, official portal screenshots, or major media reports with dual tier-1 confirmations. In case of conflicting evidence, official Monad communications take precedence. Backup verification methods include archived announcements and community records.

Timing references default to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) as no explicit timezone is provided in topic or search context.

items.title: MANTRA Chain (OM) $9 Price by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the MANTRA Chain (OM) coin price reaches or exceeds $9 USD at any major cryptocurrency exchange daily closing price by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMANTRA Chain (OM)@content_dividerMANTRA Chain (OM): a Layer 1 blockchain token for real-world asset tokenization – CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to verified market data sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official price record from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges (e.g., Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: a leading global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, OKX, or Bybit) confirms OM closing price ≥ $9 USD on the same day by _$TIME_1, verified via exchange APIs or reputable aggregator websites such as CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividerCoinGecko: cryptocurrency price aggregator and market data provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Confirmation requires timestamped daily close price snapshots accessible via public archives or official exchange records.

Resolves 'No' if OM price never reaches $9 USD at daily close on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading of OM is halted, delisted, or exchanges cease operation before _$TIME_1, or if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by deadline. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange API data and CoinGecko reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if OM coin or price data does not exist or if the market is suspended indefinitely before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $135,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing or average price in USD on major cryptocurrency exchanges exceeds $135,000 by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to aggregated price data.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges or authoritative price aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms enabling buying and selling of digital currencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ show Bitcoin's closing or average USD price on or before _$TIME_1 exceeds $135,000. Verification must come from official exchange websites, reputable financial data providers, or major media with explicit corroboration _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerverification@content_dividerconfirmation through official or widely recognized data sources)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no verified source confirms Bitcoin’s USD price exceeds $135,000 by _$TIME_1, if exchanges cease operation, if data is unavailable or unreliable, or if the event is cancelled. In case of conflicting data, resolution follows price data from top-tier exchanges by trading volume. Also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or no price data is recorded by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Mohamed Salah first to 20 goals in Europe's top five leagues by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Mohamed Salah scores 20 or more official league goals before any other player in Europe's top five leagues during the 2025-2026 season, as verified by official league statistics by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEurope's top five leagues@content_dividerthe Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, Bundesliga, and Ligue 1 – UEFA)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official league statistics confirm Mohamed Salah is the first player to reach 20 goals in any of the top five leagues by _$TIME_1, verified via official league websites or governing body publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial league statistics@content_dividerdata published by each league's official site or UEFA)_$ANNOTATION$_ or trusted archival sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBackup verification@content_dividermajor verified media outlets with dual tier-1 confirmation and Internet Archive captures)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation by _$TIME_1, if another player reaches 20 goals first, if the event is cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicts resolved prioritizing official league data. Also resolves 'No' if the season or player's participation does not occur.

items.title: Kylian Mbappé first to 30 goals in Europe top 5 leagues by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Kylian Mbappé scores 30 official league goals in any of Europe's top 5 leagues before any other player reaches 30 goals in those leagues by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEurope's top 5 leagues@content_dividerthe five highest-ranked European football leagues: English Premier League, La Liga, Bundesliga, Serie A, Ligue 1 – UEFA)_$ANNOTATION$_, according to official league statistics and UEFA sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if official statistics from the leagues' governing bodies or UEFA _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial statistics@content_dividerpublished goal tallies from La Liga, Premier League, Bundesliga, Serie A, Ligue 1, or UEFA European Golden Boot announcements – official league websites and UEFA.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Mbappé is the first player to reach 30 goals by _$TIME_1. Verification requires public records or announcements accessible at settlement including UEFA Golden Boot updates and league databases.

Resolves 'No' if no verified confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if another player reaches 30 goals first, if official sources report cancellation/postponement of matches affecting the tally, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. If the event (season or league matches) does not occur or is suspended, resolves 'No'. Conflicts resolved by prioritizing official league and UEFA data.

items.title: Erling Haaland first to 30 Premier League goals by May 25, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Erling Haaland scores at least 30 goals in the 2025/26 Premier League season before or by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividerthe top tier English football league season running annually – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as recorded by official Premier League statistics and announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Premier League statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Premier League statistics@content_dividerthe league's published goal tally for players on the official website or verified announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Haaland is the first player to reach or exceed 30 goals in the 2025/26 season by _$TIME_1, verified through official club or league statements found at https://www.premierleague.com and club websites. Backup confirmation may include major sports media with dual tier-1 source verification.

Resolves 'No' if Haaland does not reach 30 goals first by _$TIME_1, if the Premier League season is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if official data is unavailable or unverifiable. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing official Premier League sources. Also resolves 'No' if the Premier League 2025/26 season does not occur or Haaland does not participate in it.

items.title: Solana > $500 before Zcash > $500 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures which cryptocurrency, Solana or Zcash, first reaches a closing price of $500 USD on a reliable cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerClosing price@content_dividerthe final trading price recorded at the official market close of the exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if Solana's official closing price reaches or exceeds $500 USD before Zcash's closing price reaches or exceeds $500 USD, confirmed by authoritative exchange data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAuthoritative exchange data@content_dividerprice data from major cryptocurrency exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or official aggregated sources)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible historical price records or official exchange API data. Confirmation of Solana reaching $500 first must be documented before or on _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if Zcash reaches $500 USD before Solana does, if neither reach $500 USD by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or insufficient. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange records and major market data aggregators. This market also resolves 'No' if either cryptocurrency ceases trading, is delisted, or the price milestone event never occurs as specified.

items.title: Base native network token launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Base, the layer-2 Ethereum network _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBase@content_dividera blockchain scaling solution built on Ethereum to improve speed and reduce cost – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ operated by Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange and blockchain platform provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, officially issues and publicly makes available its native network token by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement from Base or Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividera verified statement published on Base’s or Coinbase’s official website, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms token issuance and public availability by _$TIME_1. Verification includes direct confirmation on official channels or corroboration by major tier-1 cryptocurrency news outlets with dual source confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the token launch is cancelled, postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. In cases of conflicting information, official Base or Coinbase sources override secondary reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no token launch event exists or the event fundamentally differs from the specified token issuance and public availability.

items.title: Ethereum > $5000 before gold by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum's price in USD exceeds $5,000 on any major cryptocurrency exchange before or on _$TIME_1, and whether this price milestone occurs strictly before gold's price exceeds $5,000 per troy ounce on major commodity exchanges, verified by authoritative market data sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if Ethereum's price reaches or exceeds $5,000 USD as confirmed by official aggregate pricing data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera business platform enabling trading of digital currencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ before or on _$TIME_1 and strictly before gold's price exceeds $5,000 USD per troy ounce as confirmed by at least two major commodity exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCommodity exchange@content_dividera marketplace for trading raw or primary products – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires timestamped records available via official exchange websites or recognized financial data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFinancial data aggregator@content_divideran entity providing consolidated financial market data from multiple sources – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Ethereum does not reach $5,000 USD before or on _$TIME_1, if gold reaches $5,000 USD first or simultaneously, if reliable price data is unavailable or disputed by _$TIME_1, or if either market data is officially suspended or exchanges cease operations. Conflicting data resolves to 'No' unless authoritative confirmation supports 'Yes'. Also resolves 'No' if Ethereum or gold price data does not exist or the price measurement methodology is invalid.

items.title: BIO > $0.15 closing price by October 20, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bio-Rad Laboratories, Inc. (a U.S.-based life sciences company _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBio-Rad Laboratories, Inc.@content_dividera publicly traded biotechnology and life sciences company listed on NASDAQ – Yahoo Finance)_$ANNOTATION$_) stock closes above $0.15 USD at the official NASDAQ market close on October 20, 2025, according to the official closing price published in U.S. Eastern Time and converted to UTC.
