Resolves 'Yes' if the official NASDAQ closing price for BIO on October 20, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNASDAQ@content_dividerNASDAQ: National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a U.S. electronic stock exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ is strictly greater than $0.15 USD as reported by the NASDAQ official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerNASDAQ official website@content_dividerhttps://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/bio)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified financial data providers such as Yahoo Finance or FactSet by _$TIME_1. Backup verification may include archived data from the Internet Archive or regulatory filings from the SEC EDGAR database _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerSEC EDGAR@content_dividerhttps://www.sec.gov/edgar.shtml)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if the closing price is $0.15 USD or less, if the stock is delisted, trading halted, or if NASDAQ is officially closed on October 20, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerMarket closure@content_dividerofficial suspension or halt of trading on NASDAQ)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if reliable verification data is unavailable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing NASDAQ official publications and SEC filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the stock does not exist or never traded on the specified date.

items.title: European team wins 2026 FIFA World Cup by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether a UEFA member national team wins the 2026 FIFA World Cup according to the official final match result published by FIFA by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFIFA World Cup@content_divideran international association football tournament organized by FIFA every four years – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUEFA@content_dividerUnion of European Football Associations, the governing body for European football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ standards.

Resolves 'Yes' if the official winner of the 2026 FIFA World Cup final match is confirmed as a UEFA member national team by FIFA's official website or verified FIFA social media accounts by _$TIME_1, with backup verification from at least two tier-1 global sports media sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividertier-1 media@content_dividermajor international media outlets with editorial verification standards)_$ANNOTATION$_ or official FIFA statistical publications.

Resolves 'No' if no UEFA member national team is declared winner by _$TIME_1, if the tournament is cancelled, postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing FIFA official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the tournament does not occur as scheduled or if the winning team is not a UEFA member national team.

items.title: Any NBA player scores ≥50 points in 2025-26 season by April 30?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any specified NBA player scores 50 or more points in a single regular season or playoff game during the 2025-2026 NBA season by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNBA player@content_dividera professional basketball athlete competing in the National Basketball Association – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divider50 points@content_dividerachieving at least fifty points scored in a single game – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, including both regular season and playoff games as officially recorded by the NBA.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any of the following players: Stephen Curry, Nikola Jokić, James Harden, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Anthony Davis, Anthony Edwards, or Karl-Anthony Towns _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPlayer list@content_dividerofficial NBA roster players specified in market definition)_$ANNOTATION$_ scores ≥50 points in a single game during the 2025-26 NBA season by _$TIME_1, confirmed by official NBA statistics published on the NBA website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerNBA official statistics@content_dividerhttps://www.nba.com/stats)_$ANNOTATION$_, NBA verified social media accounts, or major sports media outlets with dual tier-1 source verification. Alternative confirmation includes NBA game box scores archived by authoritative sports databases such as Basketball-Reference _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerBasketball-Reference@content_dividerhttps://www.basketball-reference.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no player from the specified list scores 50 or more points by _$TIME_1, if the 2025-26 NBA season is officially cancelled, postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable by that deadline. In case of conflicting data, official NBA statistics take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the player list changes such that none of the specified players participate in any games or if no games occur for the season.

items.title: Monad mainnet launch before MegaETH mainnet launch by November 30?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad launches its mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMainnet launch@content_dividera blockchain network publicly accessible for transactions with official project announcement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ before the MegaETH mainnet launch and by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-11-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official announcements from either project and verifiable network availability.

Resolves 'Yes' if Monad's mainnet launch is publicly confirmed by official Monad sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMonad official sources@content_dividerMonad’s official website, verified social media, or official press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ before MegaETH’s mainnet launch and before _$TIME_1, verified by at least two tier-1 media reports or blockchain explorers confirming live transaction capability. Backup verification includes archived announcements or regulatory filings.

Resolves 'No' if Monad does not launch before MegaETH by _$TIME_1, if Monad’s mainnet launch is officially canceled or indefinitely postponed, if official verification is unavailable or contradictory, or if the event never occurs. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing direct official statements from Monad and MegaETH. Additionally, resolves 'No' if MegaETH launches first or if neither launches by the deadline.

items.title: Bitcoin > $150,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ denominated in United States Dollars (USD) exceeds $150,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to major global cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms for trading digital currencies such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official price data from at least two major global exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividermajor exchanges@content_dividerestablished cryptocurrency trading platforms with high liquidity and global recognition)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm that Bitcoin’s USD price reaches or exceeds $150,000 at any moment by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published exchange data, official API records, or publicly accessible historical price charts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerverification sources@content_dividerblockchain.com, coindesk.com, or equivalent authoritative crypto market data providers)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin’s price never reaches $150,000 by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges cease operation or delist Bitcoin before _$TIME_1, if trading is halted indefinitely, or if authoritative price data are unavailable or contradictory by _$TIME_1. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange APIs and archival data from reputable crypto market aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the underlying trading event never existed or is fundamentally altered.

items.title: CZ posts 币安人生 on X by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether CZ, the Binance founder, posts the exact phrase '币安人生' _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider币安人生@content_dividerChinese phrase meaning 'Binance Life' referring to Binance community or culture – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on the social media platform X _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerX@content_dividersocial media platform formerly known as Twitter – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any point up to and including _$TIME_1, verified through official Binance or CZ verified social media accounts.

Resolves 'Yes' if the phrase '币安人生' is explicitly posted by CZ or on Binance's official verified X account _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial Binance or CZ accounts@content_dividerverified social media accounts controlled by Binance or CZ, e.g. https://twitter.com/binance or https://twitter.com/cz_binance)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes archived posts or screenshots from authoritative archival services or Binance official website notices.

Resolves 'No' if no such post is found by _$TIME_1, if Binance or CZ official accounts are inaccessible for verification, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing direct official Binance or CZ sources. Also resolves 'No' if the phrase is not posted exactly as specified or if the event never occurred.

items.title: Bitcoin < $20,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in United States dollars falls below $20,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1, based on aggregated data from multiple major cryptocurrency exchanges.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified aggregated exchange data from authoritative sources such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency price aggregator providing market data from multiple exchanges – https://coinmarketcap.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency data aggregator tracking prices from major exchanges – https://coingecko.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin’s USD price dropped below $20,000 at any moment on or before _$TIME_1. Verification includes official exchange APIs, major media reports with dual tier-1 source confirmation, or published official statistics.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin’s price never falls below $20,000 by _$TIME_1, if reliable aggregated price data is unavailable or contradictory by _$TIME_1, or if the underlying trading markets cease operation before _$TIME_1. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange APIs and CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or pricing data does not exist or the cryptocurrency is delisted or permanently suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: XRP ≥ $4 by December 13, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of XRP _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerXRP@content_dividercryptocurrency token issued by Ripple Labs – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $4 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ per token at market close on any major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major cryptocurrency exchange officially reports a closing price for XRP equal to or above $4.00 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerClosing price@content_dividerthe final trading price recorded at the end of a trading period – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires price data from primary sources such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or official Ripple announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerPrimary sources@content_dividercompany websites, verified social media, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may use aggregated price data from CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko archives _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerBackup sources@content_dividercryptocurrency market data aggregators with historical records – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if XRP does not close at or above $4.00 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or XRP is delisted before that time, if the price data is not verifiable from authoritative sources, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange and Ripple sources. This market also resolves 'No' if XRP trading or pricing data is unavailable or if the event fundamentally differs from the market definition.

items.title: Decentralized exchanges surpass centralized exchanges trading volume by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the aggregated trading volume of decentralized exchanges (DEXs) exceeds that of centralized exchanges (CEXs) by _$TIME_1, using monthly or annual volume data reported by authoritative blockchain analytics firms and on-chain sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDecentralized exchange@content_dividera cryptocurrency exchange operating without a central authority, using smart contracts on a blockchain – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCentralized exchange@content_dividera cryptocurrency exchange operated by a central organization controlling order matching and custody – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified reports from at least one leading blockchain analytics firm (e.g., Chainalysis _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerChainalysis@content_dividerblockchain analytics company providing on-chain transaction insights – chainalysis.com)_$ANNOTATION$_) or equivalent authoritative sources confirm that DEX trading volume exceeds CEX trading volume aggregated monthly or annually by _$TIME_1. Verification must include publicly available data, official publications, or direct confirmations from the analytics firms' websites or reports.

This market resolves 'No' if no such verified confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative data is unavailable or insufficient, or if the volumes remain below the threshold. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official analytics firm publications, followed by regulatory filings or government reports, then major media with dual tier-1 verification. Also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or data sources cease to exist.

items.title: Bitcoin > $100,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Bitcoin in USD reaches or exceeds $100,000 at any major exchange's official daily closing price on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using data from authoritative cryptocurrency exchanges.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platforms with high volume and regulatory compliance, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ publishes an official daily closing price in USD equal to or greater than $100,000 by _$TIME_1, verified by exchange website data or trusted financial data aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency price tracking website providing verified market data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification may include archive snapshots or regulatory filings.

Resolves 'No' if no such price is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges cease operation or delist Bitcoin before _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled (e.g., Bitcoin ceases trading), or if authoritative verification data is unavailable. In cases of contradictory data, official exchange data takes precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or is fundamentally altered before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Ethereum > $5,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ trades above $5,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 according to closing price data.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified closing price of ETH on any major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platform with high liquidity and global recognition, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ equals or exceeds $5,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires official exchange data published on exchange websites, API endpoints, or trusted market aggregators like CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividercryptocurrency data aggregator providing price and volume metrics – Industry Source)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived snapshots via Internet Archive or regulatory filings if available.

Resolves 'No' if ETH fails to reach or exceed $5,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if all trading is suspended or exchanges delist ETH before _$TIME_1, or if reliable price verification is unavailable by that time. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing official exchange sources with highest liquidity, then verified aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if ETH trading ceases or the event fundamentally differs (e.g., different token).

items.title: Bitcoin halving strong impact by December 31, 2028?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Bitcoin halving event in April 2028 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin halving@content_divideran event occurring approximately every 210,000 blocks where Bitcoin mining rewards are cut in half – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ causes a strong impact defined as a price change exceeding 20% USD and a notable change in miner revenue from block rewards by _$TIME_1, using blockchain data and major cryptocurrency market prices in UTC.

Resolves 'Yes' if official blockchain data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBlockchain data@content_dividerpublicly accessible records of Bitcoin transactions and mining activity – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified major cryptocurrency exchange price indices _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera platform for trading digital currencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ show a price shift greater than 20% USD and miner revenue change consistent with the halving reward reduction, confirmed by authoritative sources such as blockchain explorers (e.g., Blockchain.com) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBlockchain explorers@content_dividerwebsites providing verified blockchain transaction and mining statistics – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and leading market data providers by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if the halving event does not occur by mid-April 2028, if price changes remain below 20%, if miner revenue does not reflect halving effects, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In data conflicts, resolution prioritizes official blockchain records and exchange price data. Also resolves 'No' if the event never exists or is fundamentally different from the defined halving.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) reaches a closing price of $150,000 USD or higher on any major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. The closing price is determined from official daily settlement prices in USD as reported by major exchanges including Binance, Coinbase, and Kraken, with verification through CoinAPI and archived market data.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any major cryptocurrency exchange officially reports a Bitcoin closing price at or above $150,000 USD on or before _$TIME_1, verified through multiple authoritative sources such as CoinAPI _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinAPI@content_dividerplatform providing fast, reliable, and unified data APIs to cryptocurrency markets – company website)_$ANNOTATION$_ and exchange official data endpoints. Verification includes archived snapshots or regulatory filings where available.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach $150,000 USD closing price on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if the price data is unavailable or unverifiable, if the cryptocurrency markets are officially halted or exchanges delist Bitcoin before the deadline, or if authoritative sources contradict the occurrence. In case of conflicting data, resolution follows official exchange disclosures prioritized by CoinAPI and Binance official records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or trading is permanently suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani wins 2025 NYC mayoral election by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Zohran Mamdani wins the 2025 New York City mayoral general election by certified vote count as officially reported by the New York City Board of Elections and official government sources by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerZohran Mamdani@content_dividerNew York State Assemblymember and 2025 NYC mayoral candidate – Official government and media sources)_$ANNOTATION$_.

The market resolves 'Yes' if Zohran Mamdani is officially certified as the majority or plurality winner of the 2025 NYC mayoral general election by the New York City Board of Elections _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNYC Board of Elections@content_dividerofficial body responsible for conducting and certifying NYC elections – https://vote.nyc)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 with verification from official NYC government publications or verified statements on official NYC Board of Elections websites or major media reporting with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

The market resolves 'No' if Mamdani is not certified as winner by _$TIME_1, if the election is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official certification or authoritative verification is unavailable, or if Mamdani withdraws candidacy. Conflicting information will be resolved prioritizing official NYC Board of Elections certification and official government announcements. Also, resolves 'No' if the 2025 NYC mayoral election does not occur or the candidate does not appear on the certified ballot.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani wins 2025 NYC mayoral election by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Zohran Mamdani wins the 2025 New York City mayoral general election by certified vote count as officially reported by the New York City Board of Elections and official government sources by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerZohran Mamdani@content_dividerNew York State Assemblymember and 2025 NYC mayoral candidate – Official government and media sources)_$ANNOTATION$_.

The market resolves 'Yes' if Zohran Mamdani is officially certified as the majority or plurality winner of the 2025 NYC mayoral general election by the New York City Board of Elections _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNYC Board of Elections@content_dividerofficial body responsible for conducting and certifying NYC elections – https://vote.nyc)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 with verification from official NYC government publications or verified statements on official NYC Board of Elections websites or major media reporting with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

The market resolves 'No' if Mamdani is not certified as winner by _$TIME_1, if the election is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official certification or authoritative verification is unavailable, or if Mamdani withdraws candidacy. Conflicting information will be resolved prioritizing official NYC Board of Elections certification and official government announcements. Also, resolves 'No' if the 2025 NYC mayoral election does not occur or the candidate does not appear on the certified ballot.

items.title: Xi Jinping removal as CCP General Secretary by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Xi Jinping formally ceases to hold the office of General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerChinese Communist Party@content_dividerthe founding and ruling political party of the People's Republic of China – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by official resignation or formal removal as confirmed by recognized Chinese government or CCP sources by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if credible official confirmation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerexplicit announcement or statement from CCP Central Committee, Chinese government official channels, or verified CCP media outlets – e.g., Xinhua News Agency)_$ANNOTATION$_ is published by _$TIME_1 stating Xi Jinping's resignation or formal removal from CCP General Secretary office. Backup verification includes multiple tier-1 international media corroborations and archival government records.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied or indefinitely postponed, or if verification sources are absent or contradictory. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Xi Jinping remains in office through _$TIME_1 or if the underlying event (removal or resignation) does not occur or never existed.

If primary official sources become inaccessible, verification will rely on archived CCP announcements via Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera non-profit digital library for preserving web content – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, major government document repositories, and corroborated international press archives.

In case of conflicting reports, resolution prioritizes official CCP Central Committee publications and Chinese government statements over media reports. All time references are UTC standardized for consistency.

items.title: Russia x Ukraine ceasefire by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Russia and Ukraine formally agree to cease all hostilities in the conflict by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCeasefire@content_divideran agreement to stop fighting temporarily or permanently – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and publicly announce it through authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if both the Russian and Ukrainian governments officially announce a mutual ceasefire agreement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on government websites or verified social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ and confirmation is obtained from at least one major intergovernmental organization such as the United Nations _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUnited Nations@content_dividerinternational organization promoting peace and security – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or neutral observers.

Resolves 'No' if no such official mutual ceasefire is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the agreement covers only one party or partial ceasefires. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official government and United Nations sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the ceasefire event never existed or was never agreed upon.

items.title: US recession declared by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the United States _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerUnited States@content_dividera country in North America comprising 50 states and a federal district – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ is officially declared in a recession by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER) Business Cycle Dating Committee _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNBER Business Cycle Dating Committee@content_dividerthe authoritative US research group responsible for dating recessions – NBER official)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1 according to their formal announcement and Advance Gross Domestic Product (GDP) estimate release.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the NBER Business Cycle Dating Committee officially announces a recession for the US economy by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerNBER announcement@content_dividerofficial statement published on the NBER website or verified US government economic reports – https://www.nber.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ and if the US Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) publishes Advance GDP estimates indicating economic contraction consistent with recession definitions by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerAdvance GDP estimate@content_dividerpreliminary quarterly GDP data released by BEA – https://www.bea.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'No' if no official recession declaration by the NBER Business Cycle Dating Committee occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative verification data is unavailable or contradicts recession status. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official NBER announcements and BEA data. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the US economy is never officially declared in recession by the deadline.

items.title: Federal Reserve rate hike ≥ 25 bps after October 2025 meeting?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Federal Reserve _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal Reserve@content_dividerthe central banking system of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ increases its target federal funds rate by 25 basis points or more following the October 13-14, 2025 Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting, as officially announced in the post-meeting statement or press release by _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFOMC@content_dividerthe Federal Open Market Committee, the principal monetary policymaking body of the Federal Reserve System – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official Federal Reserve announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement or press release published on federalreserve.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_ released by 23:59:59 UTC on October 29, 2025 confirms a rate increase of at least 25 basis points (0.25%) compared to the prior target rate. Verification includes the official Federal Reserve website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerFederal Reserve website@content_dividerhttps://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomc.htm)_$ANNOTATION$_ and backup confirmation from major tier-1 financial news sources with dual-source verification.

This market resolves 'No' if the announced rate change is less than 25 basis points, if no rate change occurs, if the announcement is cancelled or indefinitely postponed by _$TIME_1, or if no authoritative confirmation is available by that time. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing the Federal Reserve’s official statement. Additionally, it resolves 'No' if the FOMC meeting does not take place or no official rate decision is made.

items.title: Pharos Network mainnet launch with RWA support by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Pharos Network _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPharos Network@content_dividera Layer-1 blockchain platform focused on real-world asset finance – CryptoPotato)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches its mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividermainnet@content_dividerthe fully operational version of a blockchain network available to the public – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ with support for real-world asset (RWA) applications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerreal-world asset applications@content_dividerblockchain capabilities enabling tokenization and lending infrastructure for physical or financial assets outside the blockchain – CryptoPotato)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, confirmed by official announcements from Pharos Network via their website or verified social media accounts.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Pharos Network officially confirms the mainnet launch with native support for RWA applications by _$TIME_1 through public statements on their website https://www.pharosnetwork.xyz/ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerPharos official website@content_dividerhttps://www.pharosnetwork.xyz/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified social media (e.g., https://x.com/pharos_network) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerPharos verified social media@content_dividerofficial social media accounts verified by platform)_$ANNOTATION$_, including explicit confirmation that the mainnet supports tokenization and lending infrastructure for RWAs. Backup verification includes major blockchain news outlets or authorized press releases confirming the deployment by the deadline.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the mainnet launch lacks RWA application support as defined, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting reports, priority is given to direct official Pharos Network communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch with RWA support does not occur or never existed.

items.title: Monad airdrop claim portal open by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad’s official airdrop claim portal _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAirdrop claim portal@content_dividera digital interface allowing eligible cryptocurrency holders to claim tokens distributed free by a blockchain project – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ opens to the public by the deadline _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-10-14T13:00:00Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_, as confirmed by Monad's official communications.

Resolves 'Yes' if Monad officially confirms the portal opening via its verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMonad official social media@content_dividerMonad’s verified X (formerly Twitter) account or official website posts)_$ANNOTATION$_ or recognized crypto news outlets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerRecognized crypto news outlets@content_dividermajor cryptocurrency news platforms with editorial standards)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Confirmation must include explicit announcement or visual evidence of portal accessibility.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation or verifiable evidence exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the portal remains inaccessible, or if the event never existed. In case of conflicting information, official Monad sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the airdrop claim portal never opens on the specified date.

items.title: Monad airdrops MON tokens to eligible SBT holders by October 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad issues its native MON token airdrop to eligible soulbound token (SBT) holders via its official claim portal by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad@content_dividerMonad is a high-performance Layer-1 blockchain compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine – official Monad sources)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verifies token claim availability for specified roles as per Monad’s official announcement on X (formerly Twitter).

This market resolves 'Yes' if official Monad channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Monad channels@content_dividerMonad’s verified social media accounts on X and its official claim portal website)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm the airdrop has begun accepting claims from eligible SBT holders by _$TIME_1, with claim functionality accessible at the official portal URL provided by Monad. Verification requires observable claim portal activation and explicit eligibility confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if the airdrop claim portal does not open by _$TIME_1, if Monad officially cancels or indefinitely postpones the airdrop beyond _$TIME_1, if no reliable official verification is available, or if the event fundamentally differs (e.g., airdrop excludes SBT holders or occurs on a different date). In case of conflicting information, official Monad announcements take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the airdrop event never existed or was never scheduled.

items.title: Fluent Testnet dApp announcement by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Fluent Labs publicly announces a new decentralized application (dApp) on the Fluent Testnet by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFluent Testnet@content_dividera developer-focused blockchain test network using ETH for gas on Chain ID 20994 – Fluent Labs official documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_, according to official Fluent Labs communication or recognized blockchain developer platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if an explicit announcement of the new Fluent Testnet dApp is published by Fluent Labs on their official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFluent Labs official website@content_dividerhttps://fluentlabs.xyz or verified social media accounts such as Twitter @fluentxyz)_$ANNOTATION$_ or on reputable developer platforms like GitHub or major blockchain news outlets by _$TIME_1, with confirmation via at least one backup source such as dAppRadar or CoinGecko.

Resolves 'No' if no such announcement is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the announcement is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the dApp does not exist, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, resolution prioritizes direct Fluent Labs sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the new Fluent Testnet dApp event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: AI tokens outperform Layer 1 tokens by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether AI tokens _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAI token@content_dividera blockchain-based cryptocurrency token supporting artificial intelligence services such as decentralized compute or machine learning – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ outperform Layer 1 tokens _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLayer 1 tokens@content_dividercryptocurrency tokens native to base blockchain protocols that provide foundational infrastructure, e.g., Ethereum or Solana – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by achieving a higher market capitalization or greater percentage price growth by _$TIME_1 according to data from major cryptocurrency exchanges and market aggregators like CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading digital asset price and market capitalization aggregator – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ and CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera comprehensive cryptocurrency market data aggregator – CoinGecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if AI tokens collectively show strictly higher market capitalization or strictly higher percentage price growth than Layer 1 tokens as confirmed by official published statistics on CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko websites by _$TIME_1. Verification requires archived snapshots from Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera nonprofit digital library preserving public web content – archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ or official API data exports confirming metrics. Backup sources include major tier-1 financial media reports with explicit data citations.

This market resolves 'No' if AI tokens do not outperform Layer 1 tokens by _$TIME_1, if data from authoritative sources is unavailable or insufficient, if the event is cancelled or invalidated, or if official verification cannot confirm outperformance. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko official data followed by corroborated media reports. Also resolves 'No' if AI tokens or Layer 1 tokens categories do not exist or lack sufficient market presence by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Monad token price < $1 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Monad cryptocurrency token price remains strictly below 1 USD according to aggregated decentralized exchange data by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad token@content_dividera native cryptocurrency token of the Monad blockchain platform – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ and price data aggregation from CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency market data provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'Yes' if the final official aggregated price for Monad token from CoinMarketCap and other decentralized exchange aggregators is strictly less than 1.00 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1, verified by CoinMarketCap's published data or equivalent authoritative price data sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/monad/)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'No' if the Monad token price equals or exceeds 1.00 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, if Monad token ceases trading or is delisted from all tracked decentralized exchanges by _$TIME_1, or if the token never existed or was never listed for trade. Conflicting or incomplete data are resolved in favor of official aggregated pricing from CoinMarketCap or equivalent authoritative market data providers.

items.title: Momentum Finance Token Generation Event by November 16, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Momentum Finance completes its Token Generation Event (TGE) defined as the public launch and full unlock of $MMT tokens by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerToken Generation Event@content_divideran event at which a blockchain project issues and distributes tokens to the public, often marking the token's initial availability – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and official confirmation from Momentum Finance.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Momentum Finance officially announces the public launch and full unlock of $MMT tokens at the TGE by _$TIME_1, verified by a statement on the official Momentum Finance website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMomentum Finance official website@content_dividerhttps://momentumfinance.io)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified social media accounts, or via major tier-1 crypto news outlets with explicit confirmation by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if the TGE is not completed by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, no verifiable confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, or if the token launch differs significantly from the full $MMT token unlock as defined. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Momentum Finance sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the TGE never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Ethereum price > $10,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Ethereum (ETH) in United States dollars (USD) exceeds $10,000 at any time during the calendar day ending _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain platform featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerthe official currency of the United States of America – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data is collected from major cryptocurrency exchanges using closing prices in USD, verified through primary exchange websites and backup market data aggregators.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any major cryptocurrency exchange officially reports an ETH price exceeding $10,000 USD at any moment before or on _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible price data from at least two authoritative exchanges such as Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange and wallet provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency exchange and trading platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or equivalent highly reputable sources, with archival confirmation via Internet Archive if necessary.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified price above $10,000 USD is recorded on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is suspended, if Ethereum is delisted on major exchanges before the deadline, or if authoritative price data is unavailable. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange sources. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist or is discontinued before the deadline.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by November 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price in USD reaches or exceeds $150,000 at any time during November 1, 2025 UTC according to closing prices on major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera platform for buying, selling, and trading cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data is aggregated and verified through primary exchange APIs and official price indices.

This market resolves 'Yes' if credible and explicit confirmation from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges or a widely recognized price index _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice index@content_divideran official compilation of asset prices used as market reference – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ verifies Bitcoin reached or exceeded $150,000 at any point between 00:00:00 UTC and 23:59:59 UTC on November 1, 2025 by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-11-01T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification may include official exchange statements or historical price archives accessible via Internet Archive or similar repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not reach $150,000 by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges officially report no such price reached, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled (e.g., exchange closure). Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange APIs and price indices. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not exist or is delisted by the deadline.

items.title: BNB > $2,000 by October 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Binance Coin (BNB) closing price reaches or exceeds $2,000 USD on any major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 according to authoritative market data providers.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one reputable exchange listed on CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency market data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports a BNB closing price ≥ $2,000 USD by _$TIME_1 using UTC end-of-day price. Verification includes archival data from CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, and Binance official price feeds accessible at settlement.

Resolves 'No' if no such price is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled (e.g., BNB delisted or trading halted indefinitely), or if authoritative verification data is unavailable or contradictory by _$TIME_1. Resolution defaults to 'No' if the price event never occurs or if data sources are inaccessible. Conflicts resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and major market aggregators with archive fallback.

items.title: BTC > $200,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $200,000 USD at any time up to and including _$TIME_1 according to aggregated closing prices from major global cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera marketplace where cryptocurrencies are traded – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative data sources such as the aggregated closing price index published by major exchanges (e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken) or recognized cryptocurrency market data providers (e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko) confirm Bitcoin’s price has hit or exceeded $200,000 USD at any time by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerpublished closing price data or official exchange records)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification may include major financial news outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation or archived exchange data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBackup verification@content_dividerarchived data from Internet Archive or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed $200,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if aggregated authoritative price data is unavailable, or if the event is effectively cancelled by market closure or delisting. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange data and recognized market aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the price measurement index does not exist or is discontinued by the deadline.

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) > $10,000 by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the USD price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain featuring smart contracts and native cryptocurrency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $10,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-04-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ as reported by major cryptocurrency exchanges or official market indices.

Resolves 'Yes' if any authoritative source _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerauthoritative source@content_dividerofficial exchange price feeds, institutional reports, or aggregated market indices)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms ETH’s USD price ≥ $10,000 at least once by _$TIME_1. Verification requires data from official market indices such as the Ethereum Liquid Index (ELX) or CoinMarketCap with institutional report corroboration _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerverification sources@content_dividerhttps://bravenewcoin.com/data/indices/ethereum-liquid-index, https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/ethereum/)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may come from major exchanges’ official websites or trusted financial data providers.

Resolves 'No' if ETH fails to reach $10,000 by _$TIME_1, if market data is unavailable or insufficient for price verification, if the event is invalidated by authoritative sources, or if the market closes before the deadline. Conflicting data resolved by prioritizing official exchange price feeds and institutional reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum or its trading markets cease to exist or are permanently suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC ≥ $123,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price in USD reaches or exceeds $123,000 during December 2025 based on major exchange closing prices aggregated and verified through authoritative cryptocurrency market data providers by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official price data from leading exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or aggregated APIs like Token Metrics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerToken Metrics@content_dividerToken Metrics crypto API offers real-time prices, on-chain data, and AI trading signals – Token Metrics official website)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin’s USD closing price equals or exceeds $123,000 at any time during December 2025 by _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible official exchange records or API outputs archived or accessible at settlement with backup from CoinGecko or CoinMarketCap data snapshots.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price never equals or exceeds $123,000 in USD on any major exchange during December 2025 by _$TIME_1, if trading data is unavailable or unverifiable, or if price thresholds are contradicted by authoritative data sources. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs, followed by major aggregator APIs and archived snapshots. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading is suspended, exchanges delist Bitcoin, or the market ceases to exist during the period.

items.title: Bitget Token significant competitor to Binance Token by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitget Token (BGB) achieves comparable market capitalization, trading volume, or utility metrics to Binance Token (BNB) by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitget Token (BGB)@content_dividernative utility token of Bitget exchange used for rewards, fee discounts, and privileges – Bitget Official Site)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance Token (BNB)@content_dividernative utility token of Binance exchange used for trading fee discounts, staking, and platform services – Binance Official Site)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official exchange data and market analytics.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 official exchange data or reputable market analytics sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial exchange data@content_dividerdata published on https://www.bitget.com, https://www.binance.com, or CoinMarketCap https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ show BGB's market capitalization, 24-hour trading volume, or utility adoption metrics are at least 75% of BNB's corresponding metrics sustained for a minimum of seven consecutive calendar days. Verification requires published reports or data snapshots on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if BGB fails to reach the specified comparative threshold by _$TIME_1, if official data or authoritative analytics are unavailable or contradict the claim, or if BGB is delisted, discontinued, or the event never occurred. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to official exchange disclosures followed by CoinMarketCap and major financial analytics firms. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Bitget Token or Binance Token cease to exist or the market conditions fundamentally differ.

items.title: LeBron James retires by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether LeBron James formally announces his retirement from professional basketball by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRetirement@content_dividerthe act of leaving one's job and ceasing to work, especially after reaching a certain age or due to personal decision – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ through official NBA or LeBron James channels.

Resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 an explicit, official statement confirming LeBron James’s retirement is published on the NBA’s official website, NBA verified social media accounts, or LeBron James’s verified personal accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNBA official website@content_dividerhttps://www.nba.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerLeBron James verified social media@content_dividerLeBron James’s official verified accounts on platforms such as Twitter, Instagram)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may come from major tier-1 media outlets reporting with direct NBA or LeBron James confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no official retirement confirmation is issued by _$TIME_1, if credible sources explicitly deny retirement, if the announcement is a different event such as endorsements or partnerships, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting reports, official NBA sources take precedence. This market also resolves 'No' if LeBron James continues active professional play or the retirement announcement never occurs.

items.title: China yuan-backed stablecoin launch by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether China officially launches a yuan-backed stablecoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divideryuan-backed stablecoin@content_dividera digital currency pegged to the Chinese yuan and issued with official authorization – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official Chinese government or People's Bank of China authorization announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if the People's Bank of China (PBOC) or other official Chinese government entities issue explicit authorization _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPeople's Bank of China@content_dividerthe central bank of the People's Republic of China responsible for monetary policy – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ for a yuan-backed stablecoin by _$TIME_1, confirmed through official government websites, verified PBOC statements, or major tier-1 media with dual-source verification _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial source verification@content_dividerprimary source direct confirmation or major media with explicit official confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no official authorization is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verifiable authoritative evidence is unavailable or contradictory. This market resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or the stablecoin launched is not yuan-backed. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Chinese government and PBOC sources, with backup confirmation from major international financial regulators or archival sources.

items.title: DeepSeek web browser launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether DeepSeek officially launches its own web browser by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLaunch@content_dividerthe public availability of a product or service for general use – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by DeepSeek's official communication channels or verified company releases.

Resolves 'Yes' if explicit confirmation of the public, official availability of the DeepSeek web browser is published by DeepSeek's official website, verified social media accounts, or official press releases by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerstatement from company-controlled platforms or verified releases – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification may include major media reports with at least two tier-1 source confirmations or visual evidence from authoritative sources.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the product is rebranded or fundamentally different than a web browser, or if authoritative verification sources are unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing direct official DeepSeek announcements. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or DeepSeek never planned or attempted a browser launch.

items.title: TikTok AI video generation integration by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether TikTok officially integrates AI technology enabling users to generate AI-created videos on its platform by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAI video generation@content_dividerautomated creation of video content using artificial intelligence algorithms – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by official TikTok announcements or platform updates.

Resolves 'Yes' if TikTok publishes an official announcement or platform update _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial TikTok announcement@content_dividerstatement or update from TikTok's official website, verified social media accounts, or press releases – TikTok.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 confirming AI video generation feature integration, or if TikTok’s platform visibly enables AI video creation tools accessible to users by that date, verified through direct platform evidence or major media coverage with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation or platform feature exists by _$TIME_1, if TikTok cancels or indefinitely postpones the AI video generation integration, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official TikTok sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the AI video generation feature never existed or was never planned by TikTok.

items.title: President Xi calls President Trump by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Chinese President Xi Jinping _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerXi Jinping@content_dividercurrent General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party and President of the People’s Republic of China – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ initiates or participates in a direct telephone or video call with former U.S. President Donald Trump _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_divider45th President of the United States, serving 2017–2021 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official announcements or verified government statements from the People’s Republic of China or the United States government.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an explicit official confirmation from the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMinistry of Foreign Affairs China@content_dividerthe government agency responsible for China's foreign relations – https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/eng/)_$ANNOTATION$_, U.S. government sources, or verified statements on official government websites or verified social media accounts confirms such a call by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation includes major tier-1 media outlets reporting with explicit verification from two or more authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied or not acknowledged by either government, or if the call does not occur by the deadline. In case of conflicting information, official government sources take precedence. Also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or if data is unavailable or unverifiable by the deadline.

items.title: 索拉纳 official Chinese name adoption by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the term 索拉纳 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider索拉纳@content_dividerofficial Chinese transliteration or name for Solana, a blockchain platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ is officially adopted as the Chinese name of Solana according to public or official announcements by the Solana Foundation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerSolana Foundation@content_dividernonprofit organization overseeing Solana blockchain development – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or recognized Chinese governmental or regulatory authorities by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an explicit official statement or publication _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial statement@content_dividerpublic announcement or formal document released by Solana Foundation or Chinese government agencies)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming 索拉纳 as Solana's official Chinese name is published on the Solana Foundation's official website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerSolana Foundation website@content_dividerhttps://solana.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified Chinese government portals, or major tier-1 Chinese media outlets by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived official documents or government filings accessible via Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividerhttps://archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ or other permanent regulatory repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is explicitly denied or indefinitely postponed, or if no official or government-sanctioned adoption of 索拉纳 as Solana's Chinese name exists. Conflicting or ambiguous reports are resolved by prioritizing official Solana Foundation statements and Chinese government publications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if 索拉纳 is never officially adopted or if the event never occurs.

items.title: USDT-margined $YB perpetual futures active by January 11?
items.rules:
This market measures whether USDT-margined perpetual futures contracts for $YB allowing up to 50x leverage are actively traded on LBank as indicated by consistent open interest and volume according to LBank platform data by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerUSDT-margined perpetual futures@content_dividercontinuous derivative contracts settled in USDT, without expiry – Merriam-Webster, Cryptocurrency Glossary)_$ANNOTATION$_ and leverage availability confirmed in LBank's official platform settings.

Resolves 'Yes' if official LBank sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLBank official sources@content_dividercompany website https://www.lbank.com, verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm active trading of $YB USDT-margined perpetual futures with up to 50x leverage by _$TIME_1, supported by publicly accessible trading volume and open interest data showing consistent activity within the preceding 30 days. Backup verification includes reputable third-party market data aggregators and archived platform snapshots.

Resolves 'No' if no verified confirmation from LBank or authoritative third-party sources exists by _$TIME_1, if the product is cancelled, delisted, or indefinitely postponed, if leverage above 50x is not supported, or if trading volume and open interest remain negligible or absent. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing direct official LBank statements and platform data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the product never launched or ceased to exist before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Shanghai Composite > 4500 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Shanghai Composite Index _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerShanghai Composite Index@content_dividera capitalization-weighted stock market index tracking all A and B shares on the Shanghai Stock Exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ closes above 4,500 on any trading day on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_, based on official closing prices published by the Shanghai Stock Exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerShanghai Stock Exchange@content_dividerthe main stock exchange in Shanghai, China – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official closing value of the Shanghai Composite Index is strictly greater than 4,500 on at least one trading day on or before _$TIME_1, as confirmed by Shanghai Stock Exchange official publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://www.sse.com.cn/ or verified SSE social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major financial data providers such as Bloomberg or Reuters with archive snapshots via Internet Archive at resolution date.

This market resolves 'No' if the index does not close above 4,500 on any trading day by _$TIME_1, if the Shanghai Stock Exchange is closed or suspended indefinitely preventing trading, if the index or data source is delisted or discontinued, or if official verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing Shanghai Stock Exchange official data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed, such as if the index was discontinued before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Ethereum price < $4,000 by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the highest USD-equivalent closing price of Ethereum _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform with a native cryptocurrency called ether – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on major global exchanges remains strictly below $4,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at all times up to and including _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if no verified record exists of Ethereum's closing price reaching or exceeding $4,000 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1 as confirmed by official exchange data sources such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial data sources@content_dividerprimary cryptocurrency exchange websites and CoinMarketCap provide authoritative price data)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived exchange data accessible via Internet Archive at settlement.

Resolves 'No' if Ethereum's closing price reaches or exceeds $4,000 USD at any point on a major exchange by _$TIME_1, if no reliable price data is available for verification, if data sources are permanently inaccessible, or if the event is cancelled or fundamentally differs. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and CoinMarketCap. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum or its USD price data do not exist or cannot be verified by _$TIME_1.

items.title: BNB < $1,000 before December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Binance Coin (BNB) price falls below 1,000 US dollars at any time before _$TIME_1. Price data is collected from credible cryptocurrency exchanges aggregated by investing.com and changelly.com using USD as the currency standard.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verifiable exchange price data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerVerifiable exchange price data@content_dividerprice quotes published by regulated or widely recognized cryptocurrency exchanges aggregated by investing.com and changelly.com – Finance Industry Standards)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm BNB trades below 1,000 USD at any time before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published historical OHLC (open, high, low, close) price data from these sources accessible via https://www.investing.com/crypto/bnb/historical-data and https://changelly.com/ by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if BNB price does not fall below 1,000 USD before _$TIME_1, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if exchanges cease BNB trading before the deadline. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to investing.com aggregated data, then changelly.com. Additionally, resolves 'No' if BNB trading or the cryptocurrency itself ceases to exist before _$TIME_1.

items.title: SUI > $10 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of the SUI cryptocurrency token _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSUI cryptocurrency token@content_dividera digital asset native to the Sui blockchain used for transactions and governance – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on major USD-denominated cryptocurrency exchanges reaches or exceeds $10 USD at any official daily close on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividermajor cryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera widely recognized digital asset trading platform with verified market data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly reports a closing price for SUI ≥ $10 USD on any trading day on or before _$TIME_1. Official price data must be accessible via the exchange's website, regulatory filings, or trusted aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency price tracking website providing aggregated exchange data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified through archival sources if necessary.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified closing price ≥ $10 USD for SUI is reported by any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if relevant trading is suspended or the token is delisted before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative data is unavailable or contradictory. In cases of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange data and major aggregator consensus. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the SUI token ceases trading or never attains the specified price by the deadline.

items.title: Donald Trump tariff policy for Europe by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures the implementation of a new tariff policy targeting Europe by former U.S. President Donald Trump as evidenced by official U.S. government executive orders or Federal Register notices by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerTariff policy@content_dividera government-imposed tax or duty on imported goods – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_divider45th President of the United States (2017–2021) and political figure – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one official U.S. government executive order or Federal Register notice explicitly confirms a new tariff policy for Europe signed or issued by Donald Trump by _$TIME_1, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerExecutive order@content_dividera directive issued by the U.S. President with the force of law – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the policy is publicly documented on an official government website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerFederal Register@content_dividerofficial daily publication of U.S. government rules and notices – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent authoritative source. Backup verification includes major U.S. media outlets corroborating with at least two tier-1 sources.

Resolves 'No' if no official executive order or Federal Register notice confirming a new tariff policy for Europe by Donald Trump exists by _$TIME_1, if such policy is cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing U.S. government publications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Donald Trump did not implement or authorize any new tariff policy for Europe by _$TIME_1 or if the event never existed.

items.title: APT > $20 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aptos (APT) cryptocurrency trading price exceeds $20 USD on any major crypto exchange at or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAptos (APT)@content_dividerAptos is a layer-1 blockchain platform and its native token symbol is APT – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ using aggregated exchange data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPrice measurement@content_dividerThe trading price is based on a volume-weighted average across top-tier exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, and Kraken – CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified price data from official exchange APIs or major crypto data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial sources@content_dividerCoinGecko, CoinMarketCap, or direct exchange APIs)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Aptos (APT) traded above $20 USD any time at or before _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived price snapshots via Internet Archive or official exchange historical records.

This market resolves 'No' if Aptos (APT) price does not exceed $20 USD on any verified source by _$TIME_1, if major exchanges delist or halt APT trading indefinitely before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and major aggregator consensus. Resolves 'No' if Aptos (APT) token ceases to exist or trading never resumes prior to deadline.

items.title: Crypto airdrop projects exceed prior 6-month launches by April 30?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the total count of distinct crypto airdrop projects _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCrypto airdrop projects@content_dividerunique blockchain token distributions publicly available for participation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ launched between October 1, 2025 and April 30, 2026 exceeds the total launched between April 1, 2025 and September 30, 2025, based on verified announcements and listings from top crypto airdrop aggregators and news platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAuthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial project announcements, verified aggregator listings, or major crypto news verified by two or more tier-1 media outlets)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm the count of unique airdrop launches in the Oct 1, 2025 to Apr 30, 2026 period exceeds that in the Apr 1, 2025 to Sep 30, 2025 period by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2026-04-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes cross-referencing multiple aggregator databases and official project channels.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the total count does not exceed the prior period, or if data is unavailable or unverifiable. In case of conflicts, priority is given to official project announcements and aggregator consensus. This market also resolves 'No' if the underlying event never occurred or was never planned.

items.title: SUI in top 10 cryptocurrencies by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether SUI _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSUI@content_dividerSui: a blockchain-based cryptocurrency token – CoinMarketCap)_$ANNOTATION$_ ranks among the top 10 cryptocurrencies worldwide by market capitalization in US dollars before or at _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMarket capitalization@content_dividerthe total market value of a cryptocurrency calculated by multiplying its circulating supply by the current price per token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Rankings use circulating supply and price data from authoritative crypto market platforms such as CoinMarketCap and Kraken, collected and verified according to their published methodologies.
