This market measures whether OKX _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerOKX@content_dividera cryptocurrency exchange and blockchain technology company – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ releases a fully automated JavaScript Signing SDK integration enabling user transaction confirmation flows on EVM-compatible _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerEVM-compatible@content_dividerblockchain networks compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ chains by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official OKX developer documentation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOKX developer documentation@content_dividerofficial technical documents published on OKX’s developer site https://www.okx.com/developer)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified OKX GitHub repositories _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOKX GitHub@content_dividerOKX’s official code repositories verified on GitHub https://github.com/okx)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm the release of such an SDK integration with user transaction confirmation flow on EVM-compatible chains by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, if the release is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the SDK lacks full automation or user transaction confirmation flow, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradict the claim. In case of conflicting information, official OKX developer documentation takes precedence. The market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Sporttrade regulated platform launch by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Sporttrade _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSporttrade@content_dividera Philadelphia-based sports betting technology company offering a stock-exchange-like sports betting platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches its regulated sports trading marketplace platform by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2026-04-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Launch is confirmed by an official announcement or operational status verified via Sporttrade’s official website or authoritative state gaming regulators.

Resolves 'Yes' if official confirmation of launch is published on Sporttrade’s primary website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerSporttrade official website@content_dividerhttps://sporttrade.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or via formal communication from state gaming regulatory agencies _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerState gaming regulators@content_dividerUS state authorities regulating sports betting platforms such as the New Jersey Division of Gaming Enforcement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification may include official press releases, regulatory filings, or publicly accessible operational evidence.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing official regulatory confirmation and Sporttrade’s own communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the platform never launched or the event fundamentally differs from the market definition.

items.title: Donald Trump meme coin creation by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump officially creates and publicly announces a new meme coin by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMeme coin@content_dividera cryptocurrency created primarily for social or entertainment purposes without significant intrinsic value – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ through verified Trump social media or major cryptocurrency exchange listings.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official public announcement or launch event by Donald Trump _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_divider45th President of the United States, public figure and entrepreneur – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming creation of a new meme coin is verifiable on Trump's official social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial social media@content_dividersocial media accounts verified by platform blue checkmarks, e.g., X formerly Twitter, Truth Social)_$ANNOTATION$_ or via listing on major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms allowing trading of cryptocurrencies like KuCoin and Public.com – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official announcement or launch occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if Trump publicly denies creation, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Trump sources and major exchange confirmations. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no new meme coin distinct from previously launched $TRUMP coin exists by deadline.

items.title: Buzzing Coin listed on Binance by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Buzzing Coin is officially listed for trading on Binance by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: a major global cryptocurrency exchange platform founded in 2017, providing trading for various digital assets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by Binance's verified official channels.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Binance publicly announces the listing of Buzzing Coin on its verified blog or official social media accounts by _$TIME_1. Verification requires an explicit listing confirmation statement published at https://www.binance.com/en/blog or Binance's verified social media (e.g., Twitter @_ANNOTATION_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance Twitter@content_dividerhttps://twitter.com/binance)_$ANNOTATION$_). Backup confirmation may include major tier-1 media outlets citing official Binance announcements.

This market resolves 'No' if no official Binance confirmation of Buzzing Coin listing exists by _$TIME_1, or if the listing is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to Binance's direct official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Buzzing Coin listing never occurred or was never announced by Binance.

items.title: 2026 FIFA World Cup by July 19?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the 2026 FIFA World Cup _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFIFA World Cup@content_divideran international men's association football championship held every four years – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ takes place fully as scheduled between June 11 and July 19, 2026 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerEvent dates@content_divider2026-06-11T00:00:00Z to 2026-07-19T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ without cancellation or indefinite postponement according to official FIFA announcements and verified event records.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative confirmation from FIFA _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFIFA@content_dividerFédération Internationale de Football Association: international governing body of association football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major sports regulatory bodies confirms the tournament occurs as scheduled by _$TIME_1, supported by official match schedules, venue usage records, or verified media coverage published on FIFA.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerFIFA official site@content_dividerhttps://www.fifa.com/tournaments/mens/worldcup/2026)_$ANNOTATION$_ and corroborated by at least two tier-1 sports news sources.

This market resolves 'No' if by _$TIME_1 the tournament is officially cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond the scheduled dates, if credible authoritative sources confirm non-occurrence, or if no verifiable evidence confirms the event taking place as scheduled. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing official FIFA communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never scheduled.

items.title: Polymarket IPO completion by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Polymarket completes an initial public offering (IPO) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerIPO@content_dividerthe first sale of stock by a private company to the public – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 based on official Polymarket company statements or credible news sources with explicit confirmation.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement or regulatory filing confirming Polymarket’s IPO completion is published by Polymarket’s corporate website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPolymarket corporate website@content_dividerhttps://polymarket.com or official affiliated corporate domains)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major credible news outlets such as Reuters or PRNewswire _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerReuters@content_dividerinternational news agency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerPRNewswire@content_dividerpress release distribution service – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes regulatory filings (e.g., SEC EDGAR database) or official stock exchange listings, and backup confirmation via major financial media with dual tier-1 source verification.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation of IPO completion is available by _$TIME_1, if the IPO is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if the event never existed. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to direct company disclosures and official regulatory filings. This market also resolves 'No' if Polymarket ceases to exist as a corporate entity or if IPO completion differs fundamentally from the market definition.

items.title: Federal Reserve delay interest rate cut by October 29, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Federal Reserve delays the scheduled interest rate cut decision at the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting ending by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal Reserve@content_dividerthe central bank of the United States responsible for monetary policy – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFOMC@content_dividerFederal Open Market Committee: principal monetary policymaking body of the Federal Reserve System – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, originally scheduled for October 28-29, 2025, as confirmed by official FOMC statements and press releases.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the Federal Reserve publicly announces by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on the Federal Reserve website or verified FOMC press release)_$ANNOTATION$_ that the interest rate cut planned for the October 28-29, 2025 meeting is postponed, cancelled, or otherwise delayed beyond the meeting date, with verification from at least one major tier-1 financial news outlet.

This market resolves 'No' if the Federal Reserve proceeds with the interest rate cut at the October 28-29, 2025 FOMC meeting as scheduled, if no official delay announcement is made by _$TIME_1, or if authoritative sources fail to confirm any delay. In case of conflicting information, official Federal Reserve communications take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the FOMC meeting does not occur, is cancelled without delay announcement, or if the interest rate cut event never existed.

items.title: DAX < 23000 by November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the DAX index closing price on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange is below 23,000 points at the close of trading on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDAX index@content_dividerthe Deutscher Aktien Index, a stock market index comprising the 40 major German blue chip companies traded at Frankfurt Stock Exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFrankfurt Stock Exchange@content_dividerthe primary stock exchange located in Frankfurt am Main, Germany – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official closing price of the DAX index is strictly less than 23,000 points on any trading day at or before _$TIME_1, as published by Deutsche Börse AG or verified official financial data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeutsche Börse AG@content_dividerthe German stock exchange operator that owns the Frankfurt Stock Exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major financial news outlets with dual independent tier-1 source confirmation and archived data from authoritative financial repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if no closing price below 23,000 points occurs on or before _$TIME_1, if trading is suspended or the index is delisted before the deadline, or if authoritative data is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, Deutsche Börse AG official publications take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the DAX index or Frankfurt Stock Exchange ceases to exist or is officially closed before _$TIME_1.

items.title: xAI Grokipedia public release by October 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether xAI's Grokipedia beta version 0.1 becomes publicly accessible to all users without restrictions by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPublic release@content_divideravailability of a product or service to the general public without limitations – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official announcements from Elon Musk or xAI on verified channels.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official statement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial statement@content_dividera verified public announcement by the entity responsible – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming the public release of Grokipedia beta version 0.1 is published by Elon Musk or xAI on their verified social media accounts or official websites before or at _$TIME_1. Verification may also use archived web captures or major media reports citing official sources.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the release is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if Grokipedia beta 0.1 is not accessible publicly without restrictions as defined. In case of conflicting information, resolution prioritizes official xAI or Elon Musk channels, followed by major media with dual tier-1 source verification. Also resolves 'No' if Grokipedia beta 0.1 never existed or was never scheduled for release.

items.title: Pi Network token price ≥ $1 by February 29, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Pi Network's cryptocurrency token price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPi Network token@content_dividerthe native digital currency of Pi Network blockchain platform – CryptoCompare)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $1 USD per token according to aggregated data from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividermajor cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerleading centralized and decentralized trading platforms listing Pi token, e.g. Binance, Coinbase, KuCoin – CryptoCompare)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official price data from at least two independent major exchanges shows Pi token closing price at or above $1 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerprice measurement@content_dividerbased on final trade price or daily closing price reported in USD equivalent)_$ANNOTATION$_, corroborated by market capitalization data evidencing consistent valuation at or above $1 per token. Verification requires published exchange records or CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ listing showing price threshold met by deadline.

Resolves 'No' if the price condition is not met by _$TIME_1, if Pi token is delisted or trading is halted indefinitely before the deadline, if official data is unavailable or conflicting by deadline, or if the Pi Network fails to launch mainnet or token trading. In case of disputes, resolution favors official exchange API data and CoinMarketCap archives. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the token or trading event never existed.

items.title: BTC > $70,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (a digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) closes at or above $70,000 USD (United States Dollar _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerofficial currency of the United States of America – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) at any official daily closing price published by major cryptocurrency exchanges aggregated by authoritative sources by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any official daily closing price of Bitcoin in USD, as reported by primary sources such as CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency data aggregator providing price, market capitalization, and volume data – CoinGecko website)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Investing.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInvesting.com@content_dividerfinancial market platform providing cryptocurrency price data and historical OHLC data – Investing.com website)_$ANNOTATION$_, equals or exceeds $70,000 at any point on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires access to daily close price data from these or equivalent authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin never closes at or above $70,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if official price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if authoritative sources confirm market closure, trading halts, or data suspension preventing resolution. Conflicts or discrepancies between sources are resolved by prioritizing CoinGecko and Investing.com official data feeds and archived records. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading or price reporting never occurred or was suspended for the full period.

items.title: Argentina wins FIFA World Cup 2026 by July 19?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Argentina is declared champion of the FIFA World Cup 2026 tournament according to the official final match result by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFIFA World Cup@content_dividerthe international men's association football tournament organized by Fédération Internationale de Football Association – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official FIFA sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFIFA@content_dividerFédération Internationale de Football Association, the international governing body of association football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Argentina as tournament champion on or before _$TIME_1, based on the final match results published at https://www.fifa.com/ and/or official FIFA communications. Backup confirmation includes verified reports from tier-1 sports media and official tournament statistics.

This market resolves 'No' if Argentina is not declared champion by _$TIME_1, if the tournament is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the event never occurs as specified. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official FIFA announcements. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the tournament final or champion declaration does not exist.

items.title: Meta Workplace shutdown by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Meta’s Workplace platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMeta's Workplace platform@content_dividera collaboration software platform developed by Meta Platforms for internal company communication and workflow management – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ ceases all user access and terminates all stored data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerShutdown@content_dividercomplete cessation of service and deletion or termination of data access – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Meta officially announces a full shutdown of Workplace on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerexplicit statements published on Meta’s official website or verified Meta social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ with confirmation from at least two independent tier-1 technology news sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTier-1 technology news sources@content_dividermajor reputable technology news organizations with verified editorial standards)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if verifiable evidence shows complete service termination and data deletion by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if no official shutdown announcement or verifiable full service termination occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is indefinitely postponed or cancelled, or if only partial shutdowns like read-only mode are implemented. In case of conflicting information, official Meta sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Workplace platform continues operating beyond _$TIME_1 or if verification data is unavailable.

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) ≥ $5,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the cryptocurrency Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform with a native cryptocurrency called Ether – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ trades at or above $5,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange before or at the close of trading on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data must be based on official closing prices denominated in USD and sourced from at least two major exchanges with publicly accessible records.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Ethereum’s price meets or exceeds $5,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 as confirmed by authoritative exchange data published on official exchange websites or via recognized aggregated market data providers such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data aggregator – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividercryptocurrency data aggregator and analytics platform – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived exchange price data accessible through Internet Archive or regulatory filings where applicable.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum never reaches $5,000 USD before or at _$TIME_1, if trading is suspended, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable from authoritative sources by _$TIME_1, or if the event (trading of Ethereum at USD value) never existed. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange records and aggregated data providers. Official cancellation or indefinite suspension of Ethereum trading also results in 'No'.

items.title: Erling Haaland top scorer Premier League by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Erling Haaland scores the most official Premier League goals among all players up to and including _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividerthe top professional football league in England – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, as recorded in official Premier League statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial Premier League statistics@content_dividerdata published by the Premier League on https://www.premierleague.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official Premier League data confirms Erling Haaland has the highest total number of league goals by _$TIME_1, verified through the Premier League website or official publications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPremier League official site@content_dividerhttps://www.premierleague.com/stats/top/players/goals)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes reputable sports databases such as Sofascore or Flashscore with historical archived data.

This market resolves 'No' if by _$TIME_1 Erling Haaland does not hold the highest official Premier League goal total, or if the Premier League season is cancelled, suspended indefinitely, or if authoritative goal tally data is unavailable. Conflicting data is resolved prioritizing official Premier League sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Premier League or Haaland’s participation does not exist or is voided by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Kylian Mbappe La Liga top scorer by June 14, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Kylian Mbappe is the official highest goal scorer for the 2025/26 La Liga season _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLa Liga@content_dividerSpain's top professional football league – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, as confirmed by the official La Liga announcement after the last league match, with goals counted only in official La Liga matches.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official La Liga website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLa Liga website@content_dividerhttps://www.laliga.com/en-GB/stats/laliga-easports/scorers)_$ANNOTATION$_ or an official La Liga press release confirms Kylian Mbappe as the top scorer for the 2025/26 season by _$TIME_1, with backup verification from major tier-1 sports media outlets reporting with explicit confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if no official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event (2025/26 La Liga season) is cancelled or indefinitely postponed before completion, if Kylian Mbappe is not the top scorer, or if reliable verification data is unavailable. In case of conflicting reports, official La Liga announcements take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the 2025/26 La Liga season does not take place or the top scorer is never declared.

items.title: Arsenal top Premier League by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Arsenal Football Club ranks first in the official English Premier League standings by the end of the day UTC on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerArsenal Football Club@content_dividera professional football club based in London competing in the English Premier League – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as published by the Premier League and corroborated by verified sports media.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the official Premier League table published on or before _$TIME_1 by the Premier League organization _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividerthe top professional football league in England – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Arsenal is ranked first. Verification requires confirmation from at least one major verified sports media outlet such as ESPN or TNT Sports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerVerified sports media@content_dividerwidely recognized sports news organizations with editorial verification)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Arsenal is not first in the official standings by _$TIME_1, if the Premier League is suspended, cancelled, or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if official or verified standings are unavailable. In case of conflicting data, official Premier League sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Premier League season does not exist or Arsenal does not participate.

items.title: United States ground forces deployment in Venezuela by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the United States deploys military ground forces _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMilitary ground forces@content_dividerarmed personnel operating on land as part of the military – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in Venezuela before or on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerVenezuela@content_dividerthe country in South America bordering the Caribbean Sea – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, confirmed through official U.S. Department of Defense or verified government press releases with corroboration from major media or visual evidence.

Resolves 'Yes' if explicit official confirmation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerstatement or release by the U.S. Department of Defense or U.S. federal government sources – official websites or press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ of U.S. military ground forces physically deployed inside Venezuelan territory is published by or before _$TIME_1. Verification includes government press releases, authorized military briefings, or verified visual evidence (e.g., photographs or videos) with credible source attribution. Backup confirmation may include major U.S. or international media outlets with dual tier-1 verification.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, or if deployment is explicitly denied, cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or if U.S. military presence is limited to naval, air, or advisory roles outside Venezuelan land territory. Conflicting reports are resolved prioritizing official U.S. government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event fundamentally differs from the market specification.

items.title: Comet 3I/ATLAS shows alien technology by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether verified scientific detection of alien technology signatures occurs in comet 3I/ATLAS by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider3I/ATLAS@content_dividerthe third documented interstellar object to pass through the solar system – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as evidenced by spectral analysis, chemical emissions, or telescope imaging from recognized space agencies or accredited scientific institutions.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one authoritative space agency or accredited scientific body _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerspace agency@content_divideran official government or international organization responsible for space research and exploration – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly confirms, through official publications, regulatory filings, or verified media reports by _$TIME_1, the detection of alien technology signatures (e.g., artificial metal alloys, non-natural emission spectra) in comet 3I/ATLAS. Verification may also include corroborated visual evidence from telescopes or space probes archived in persistent public repositories.

Resolves 'No' if no such verified scientific confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially negated or indefinitely postponed, if the comet 3I/ATLAS does not exhibit any such signatures, or if reliable verification data from authoritative sources is unavailable. In cases of conflicting information, resolution prioritizes official government space agencies and peer-reviewed scientific publications. Also resolves 'No' if comet 3I/ATLAS ceases to exist, is reclassified, or never exhibited alien technology signatures by deadline.

items.title: Monad mainnet launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Monad Labs officially launches its mainnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMainnet@content_dividerthe fully operational blockchain network of a cryptocurrency project, distinct from testnets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to announcements made by Monad Labs or other authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if Monad Labs publishes an explicit official announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement released on Monad Labs’ official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming mainnet launch by _$TIME_1, or if two or more major tier-1 crypto news outlets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTier-1 media@content_dividerleading cryptocurrency media organizations with editorial verification standards)_$ANNOTATION$_ report the launch with direct confirmation by that time. Backup verification includes visual evidence _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerVisual evidence@content_dividedeployments or screenshots from official Monad Labs channels)_$ANNOTATION$_ or official blockchain data showing mainnet activation.

Resolves 'No' if no verified official announcement or credible confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if Monad Labs announces cancellation or indefinite delay, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradictory. Also resolves 'No' if Monad mainnet launch does not occur by the deadline or if the event never existed. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to Monad Labs’ official communications.

items.title: Elon Musk public mention of $DOGE by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Elon Musk publicly mentions $DOGE _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDOGE@content_dividera cryptocurrency and digital token known as Dogecoin – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in any verified statement on media or social platforms between 2025-10-20T00:00:00Z and _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a verified public statement by Elon Musk _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerElon Musk@content_dividerElon Musk: CEO of Tesla and SpaceX and notable public figure – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ mentioning $DOGE is published by an official Elon Musk channel (e.g., verified Twitter/X account) or reported by at least two tier-1 media sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividertier-1 media@content_dividermajor global news organizations with rigorous fact-checking standards – internal criteria)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification may use archived social media posts or official press releases.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified public mention occurs by _$TIME_1, if Elon Musk explicitly denies or cancels such mention, or if verification sources are unavailable or contradictory by the deadline. The market also resolves 'No' if Elon Musk does not make any public statement mentioning $DOGE in the specified timeframe or if the event never occurred.

items.title: FC Barcelona 4-0 win vs Olympiacos by October 21, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether FC Barcelona wins their UEFA Champions League match against Olympiacos with a final official scoreline of exactly 4-0 at the end of regulation time on October 21, 2025, determined by UEFA's official match report _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerUEFA Champions League@content_dividerthe annual continental club football tournament organized by the Union of European Football Associations – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFC Barcelona@content_dividerprofessional football club based in Barcelona, Spain – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOlympiacos@content_dividerprofessional football club based in Piraeus, Greece – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if UEFA officially publishes a match report confirming FC Barcelona defeated Olympiacos 4-0 at the end of regulation time on October 21, 2025, by _$TIME_1. Verification requires the final official score from UEFA.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerUEFA official site@content_dividerhttps://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or their verified social media. Alternative confirmation includes major sports news outlets with dual tier-1 source verification or UEFA's official statistics platforms.

This market resolves 'No' if the official final scoreline differs from 4-0, if the match is cancelled, postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if no verifiable official UEFA confirmation is available by _$TIME_1. Conflicting reports are resolved prioritizing UEFA official sources. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the match does not occur or never existed on the scheduled date.

items.title: Federal government shutdown continues until November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the federal government remains unfunded and non-operational through _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal government shutdown@content_dividera partial or full cessation of government activities due to lack of enacted funding bills – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by official government announcements or congressional funding status updates.

Resolves 'Yes' if official U.S. government sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial U.S. government sources@content_dividerfederal agency websites, congressional records, or executive branch announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm the shutdown continues through _$TIME_1, with documented absence of enacted appropriations bills or continuing resolutions funding federal operations by that date.

Resolves 'No' if funding is restored or the government resumes operations at any point before or on _$TIME_1, if authoritative sources confirm the shutdown ended or was lifted by _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification data is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official congressional and executive branch publications. This market resolves 'No' if the shutdown never occurred or is officially cancelled before the deadline.

items.title: Changpeng Zhao replies to @cjhtech in Chinese by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerChangpeng Zhao@content_dividerfounder and CEO of Binance, a global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, replies publicly to the Twitter user @cjhtech on X _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerX@content_dividerthe social media platform formerly known as Twitter – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in the Chinese language by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a public reply post by Changpeng Zhao in Chinese language to @cjhtech on X is verified on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerverification@content_dividerconfirmation via official Changpeng Zhao verified X account or major media outlets explicitly citing the reply)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires either direct evidence from Changpeng Zhao’s official X account _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerverified X account@content_dividerofficial social media account with verification badge of Changpeng Zhao)_$ANNOTATION$_ or corroboration by two or more tier-1 news sources reporting the reply with quoted text or screenshots.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified Chinese-language reply by Changpeng Zhao to @cjhtech is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if Changpeng Zhao publicly denies the reply, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In cases of conflicting evidence, official statements from Changpeng Zhao’s verified X account take precedence. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or the reply is in a language other than Chinese.

items.title: Cristiano Ronaldo ≥ 125M X followers by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Cristiano Ronaldo's official X (formerly Twitter) account follower count reaches or exceeds 125 million by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerX@content_dividerX, formerly Twitter, a social media platform for microblogging and social networking – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, as reported by the official X API _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerX API@content_dividerthe application programming interface providing real-time data from X – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if the official X API follower count for Cristiano Ronaldo's verified account (@cristiano) is recorded as ≥125,000,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed via official X API data accessible through X's developer platform or official X sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial X API@content_dividerhttps://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived API snapshots, major tier-1 media reports referencing official API data, or verified visual evidence from X.

Resolves 'No' if the follower count is below 125 million at _$TIME_1, if the account is suspended, deleted, or if official X API data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. The market also resolves 'No' if the account never existed, is permanently inactive, or if the event (reaching 125 million followers) does not occur by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing the official X API and verified official sources.

items.title: Bitcoin mining carbon neutral by December 31, 2030?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin mining globally achieves net-zero carbon emissions by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin mining@content_dividerthe process of validating and adding transactions to the Bitcoin blockchain through energy-intensive computations – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, defined as carbon neutrality measured by recognized carbon accounting standards such as CCRI or UN frameworks.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial statements from CCRI, United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), or equivalent recognized agencies)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin mining’s net-zero carbon emissions globally by _$TIME_1, with verification through publicly available comprehensive carbon accounting reports or official carbon offset certifications published by CCRI or UNFCCC websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCCRI@content_dividerCrypto Carbon Ratings Institute: organization providing carbon accounting ratings for crypto assets – CCRI.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerUNFCCC@content_dividerUnited Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change: UN agency coordinating global climate action – unfccc.int)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, if Bitcoin mining carbon neutrality is officially denied, postponed, or unverifiable by authoritative sources, or if carbon accounting data is incomplete or conflicting beyond resolution. In case of disputes, resolution follows CCRI and UNFCCC official publications. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin mining ceases to exist or carbon neutrality is fundamentally redefined after market creation.

items.title: Ethereum surpass Visa transaction volume by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ethereum's total transaction volume _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform enabling smart contracts and cryptocurrency transactions – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds Visa's total transaction volume _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerVisa@content_dividera global payments technology company operating electronic payment networks – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in total dollar value transacted during the calendar year ending by _$TIME_1, as verified through blockchain analytics and official financial reports.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerauthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial company reports, regulatory filings, verified blockchain analytics providers, or major financial media with dual tier-1 confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Ethereum's total annual transaction volume surpasses Visa's by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published annual transaction volume reports or datasets from Ethereum blockchain explorers and Visa's official financial disclosures accessible via https://investor.visa.com and major blockchain data platforms.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum does not surpass Visa's transaction volume by _$TIME_1, if data is unavailable or unverifiable, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if official sources contradict the claim. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official Visa and Ethereum blockchain analytics reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if either Ethereum's transaction volume data or Visa's annual volume data do not exist or cannot be reliably measured.

items.title: DeepSeek v3.1 highest-yielding model on nof1.ai leaderboard by October 27, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether DeepSeek v3.1 achieves the highest yield ranking on the official nof1.ai leaderboard by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDeepSeek v3.1@content_dividerDeepSeek v3.1 is a version of an AI model developed to compete on nof1.ai leaderboard based on performance metrics – official deepseek.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ as determined by model performance metrics published on nof1.ai and verified by deepseek.com updates.

Resolves 'Yes' if the official nof1.ai leaderboard data as of end of day UTC on _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerno-f1.ai leaderboard@content_dividernof1.ai is an AI model ranking platform that ranks models by yield and other performance metrics – primary source nof1.ai)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows DeepSeek v3.1 as the highest-yielding model, with verification from deepseek.com official updates _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeepseek.com@content_dividerofficial DeepSeek website providing model performance verifications and announcements – primary source deepseek.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if DeepSeek v3.1 is not ranked highest by _$TIME_1, if the leaderboard or deepseek.com data is unavailable or unverifiable at deadline, if DeepSeek v3.1 is removed, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed from competition by _$TIME_1, or if the event never existed. Conflicting or ambiguous data will be resolved by prioritizing official nof1.ai leaderboard and deepseek.com sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the model's performance metrics differ from those published or if the ranking criteria differ from the market specification.

items.title: Solana leading blockchain for gaming by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Solana _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana@content_dividera high-performance blockchain platform known for speed and low transaction fees – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ becomes the leading blockchain for gaming by _$TIME_1 based on developer adoption, transaction volume, and gaming ecosystem growth as reported by verified crypto analytics and industry reports.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative sources such as major crypto analytics firms (e.g., DappRadar, Chainalysis) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCrypto analytics firms@content_dividercompanies providing blockchain data and metrics analysis – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, industry reports, or official Solana ecosystem disclosures confirm Solana holds the largest market share in gaming blockchain developer adoption, transaction volume, and ecosystem growth by _$TIME_1. Verification requires publication of explicit rankings or metrics from at least two independent tier-1 sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTier-1 sources@content_dividerleading reputable sources with strong verification standards – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Solana does not hold the leading position by _$TIME_1, if reliable verification data is unavailable or contradictory, if the event is effectively cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if the gaming ecosystem metrics show a different blockchain leading. In cases of conflicting evidence, resolution prioritizes official crypto analytics and Solana ecosystem disclosures. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or leadership metrics cannot be verified by _$TIME_1.

items.title: BNB Chain merger with major Layer-1 blockchain by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether BNB Chain _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBNB Chain@content_dividera blockchain platform developed by Binance, consisting of the BNB Beacon Chain and BNB Smart Chain – official site bnbchain.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ merges with another major Layer-1 blockchain _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLayer-1 blockchain@content_dividera base blockchain protocol with its own independent network and consensus mechanism – Merriam-Webster & Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ of comparable scale and community by _$TIME_1. The merger is confirmed only through official Binance or BNB Chain channels.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an explicit merger confirmation is published by Binance or BNB Chain via official websites (binance.com, bnbchain.org) or verified social media accounts by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_divinerules@content_dividerVerification requires direct public announcement or regulatory filing accessible at official sources; backup includes major tier-1 media with dual-source confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the merger is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the event never existed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official Binance/BNB Chain sources. This market also resolves 'No' if the merger involves a blockchain not comparable in scale or community or if the event differs materially from the specified merger.

items.title: BTC > $95,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches a price of at least $95,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange closing price by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. The price is based on aggregated closing prices quoted in USD from major exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, and Kraken, verified via official exchange APIs or published reports.

Resolves 'Yes' if any major cryptocurrency exchange officially reports a closing price of Bitcoin equal to or exceeding $95,000 USD by _$TIME_1, confirmed by exchange websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividerCoinbase: leading US-based cryptocurrency exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerBinance: largest global cryptocurrency exchange by volume – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividerKraken: major cryptocurrency exchange headquartered in the US – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, or equivalent authoritative sources. Backup verification includes major financial news outlets with explicit two-tier-1 source confirmation and archived exchange data via Internet Archive.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach $95,000 USD on any major exchange closing price by _$TIME_1, if all reliable sources confirm non-occurrence, if trading is halted or exchanges delist Bitcoin preventing price verification, or if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by deadline. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the relevant exchanges cease to exist or trading is indefinitely suspended before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Solana (SOL) ≥ $500 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Solana (SOL) token price reaches or exceeds $500 USD at any official market closing price by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera high-performance blockchain platform and its native cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to aggregated official price data from major cryptocurrency exchanges verified by authoritative financial sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if any official closing price of SOL on a major exchange aggregated by Forbes.com _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerForbes.com@content_dividerauthoritative financial news and data provider – https://www.forbes.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $500 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires price data published on Forbes.com or directly from exchange APIs with backup confirmation from CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko.

Resolves 'No' if SOL does not reach $500 USD by _$TIME_1, if the token is delisted, trading is halted indefinitely, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradictory. If the event never occurred or the token ceased trading before _$TIME_1, this market resolves 'No'. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and Forbes.com aggregation.

items.title: Apple highest stock growth by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Apple Inc. _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerApple Inc.@content_dividerAmerican multinational technology company specializing in consumer electronics and software – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ achieves the largest percentage increase in stock price during calendar year 2025 compared to Microsoft, Tesla, Google (Alphabet Inc.), and Amazon, as of _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerstock price growth@content_dividerpercentage increase in stock price from January 1, 2025 closing to December 31, 2025 closing – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official financial data from primary sources such as Nasdaq, NYSE, or company filings _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerofficial financial data@content_dividerpublicly reported stock prices and market capitalization from stock exchanges and SEC filings – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Apple’s stock price percentage gain exceeds all specified companies by _$TIME_1. Verification requires data published or aggregated by reputable financial analytics platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) or official regulatory filings by that date.

This market resolves 'No' if Apple does not have the highest percentage stock price growth among the specified companies by _$TIME_1, if relevant stock data is unavailable or unverified by deadline, or if the event is cancelled (e.g., trading halt, delisting). Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official regulatory filings and stock exchange data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the specified comparative event never occurs or the data cannot be conclusively verified.

items.title: Gen.G win Best of 3 match vs Top Esports by October 23, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Gen.G _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerGen.G; professional esports organization based in South Korea – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ wins the official Best of 3 match against Top Esports _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerTop Esports; professional Chinese esports organization – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at the 2025 League of Legends World Championship _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerLeague of Legends World Championship; annual international esports tournament for League of Legends organized by Riot Games – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on October 23, 2025, as determined by Riot Games _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerRiot Games; developer and organizer of League of Legends esports events – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and official LoL Worlds organizers, using official match results.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Gen.G is officially recorded as the winner of the Best of 3 match by Riot Games or LoL Worlds organizers via official websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerOfficial Riot Games website@content_dividerhttps://lolesports.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified esports streaming platforms by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation may include major esports media reports with explicit verification from at least two tier-1 sources or authoritative esports statistical databases _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerEsports statistical databases@content_dividerSofascore, Flashscore)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Gen.G does not win the match by _$TIME_1, if the match is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if official sources explicitly deny the event or outcome, or if verification data is unavailable or insufficient by the deadline. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing Riot Games official announcements and LoL Worlds organizers as primary sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the match does not occur or never existed.

items.title: Bitcoin price < $60,000 by October 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Bitcoin in United States Dollars on major cryptocurrency exchanges is strictly less than $60,000 at 23:59:59 UTC on October 30, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Price data must be sourced from at least two major exchanges with publicly available official closing prices _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platforms with high liquidity and market capitalization, e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – Industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'Yes' if the official closing price (last traded price or official settlement price) on two or more major exchanges is strictly less than $60,000 USD at or before 2025-10-30T23:59:59Z _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-10-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ and this is confirmed by official exchange data published on their websites or verified market data aggregators such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerPrice confirmation sources@content_dividerofficial exchange websites or major crypto market data aggregators with archival access for future verification)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Alternative verification includes archived snapshots from the Internet Archive of official exchange pages or aggregator APIs.

Resolves 'No' if the closing price is $60,000 or greater on all major exchanges at the specified time, or if no reliable official price data is published by any major exchange or aggregator by the deadline, or if Bitcoin trading or pricing data is unavailable or the market is suspended on all major exchanges by the deadline. Also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or relevant exchanges cease operation before the deadline._$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerNo resolution@content_dividerincludes price ≥ $60, data unavailability, market suspension, or event non-existence)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) price reach $4,300 by November 20, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Ethereum (ETH) cryptocurrency closing price in United States Dollars (USD) reaches or exceeds $4,300 on or before _$TIME_1 according to aggregated exchange data from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform with its native cryptocurrency ETH – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and reliable market data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAggregated exchange data@content_dividercombined trading price data compiled from multiple cryptocurrency exchanges – Finance Glossary)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if the closing price of Ethereum (ETH) is at or above $4,300 USD on any trading day ending on or before _$TIME_1, verified by official cryptocurrency market data providers such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividerleading cryptocurrency market data aggregator – https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ and corroborated by at least one major exchange such as Coinbase or Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividera major cryptocurrency exchange – https://www.coinbase.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerlargest global cryptocurrency exchange by volume – https://www.binance.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Verification includes official daily closing price snapshots published on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum’s closing price fails to reach or exceed $4,300 USD by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable, or if trading on major exchanges is halted or the asset is delisted prior to _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange and aggregator publications. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist, trading is suspended indefinitely, or if the price metric cannot be verified by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Huddle01 major update adding live streaming to Web2 social platforms by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Huddle01 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerHuddle01@content_dividera decentralized video conferencing platform enabling Web3 integration – company website)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially launches a major update adding live streaming capabilities _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerLive streaming@content_dividerthe continuous transmission of live video content over the internet – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ to Web2 social platforms including X, YouTube, Twitch, and LinkedIn by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official Huddle01 announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Huddle01's verified website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ or a widely recognized platform release confirming live streaming to the specified Web2 platforms is published by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes major technology news outlets with explicit source attribution and Internet Archive snapshots _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera digital archive of the World Wide Web and other information – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no such official or widely recognized confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the update is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verification sources are unavailable or contradictory. Also resolves 'No' if the update does not exist or differs fundamentally from the defined scope (e.g., excludes live streaming to Web2 socials). Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing official Huddle01 sources and major media corroboration.

items.title: France reaches quarter-finals of 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup by November 27?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the France national under-17 football team qualifies for the quarter-finals stage of the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup according to official FIFA match results _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFIFA@content_dividerFédération Internationale de Football Association, the international governing body of football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official FIFA published match results _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial FIFA match results@content_dividerresults published on FIFA.com or official FIFA communications)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm France’s qualification to the quarter-finals by _$TIME_1. Verification includes FIFA’s official tournament website, FIFA’s verified social media accounts, or official FIFA press releases. Backup verification may include major sports news outlets with confirmation from at least two tier-1 sources.

Resolves 'No' if France does not qualify by _$TIME_1, if the tournament is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official FIFA verification is unavailable, or if the event never occurred as specified. Conflicting or ambiguous reports are resolved by prioritizing official FIFA sources and archived official documents. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the tournament format changes fundamentally or if France does not participate.

items.title: Drake surprise album release by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Drake officially releases any full-length music album _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAlbum@content_dividera collection of audio recordings issued as a single item on CD, record, or another medium – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ not previously announced with a fixed release date, constituting a surprise release by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to his primary record label or verified social media channels.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official record label press release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerRecord label press@content_dividera formal announcement by a music production and distribution company – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or a verified Drake social media account _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerVerified social media@content_dividera social media account confirmed as authentic by the platform or owner – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms the surprise album release by _$TIME_1, with documentation of the album being a full official release not previously disclosed with a release date. Backup verification includes major media reports with dual tier-1 source confirmation or archive records.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the album release is publicly announced in advance with a fixed date, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official record label announcements take precedence. Also resolves 'No' if no surprise album release occurred or if the event never existed.

items.title: EU AI Act passage by June 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the European Union _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEuropean Union@content_dividera political and economic union of 27 European countries – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ formally passes and enforces a comprehensive AI regulation law known as the EU Artificial Intelligence Act _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerEU AI Act@content_dividerRegulation (EU) 2024/1689 establishing legal framework for AI systems in the EU – Official Journal of the European Union)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official EU legislative records.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the EU AI Act is formally adopted and published in the Official Journal of the European Union _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial Journal of the European Union@content_dividerthe official gazette publishing EU legislation and legal acts – EUR-Lex)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, with verification by EU legislative milestones published on official EU websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerEU legislative milestones@content_dividerofficial EU Parliament and Commission publications confirming adoption stages – https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/regulatory-framework-ai)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Backup verification includes archived EU records and major tier-1 media reports with dual confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if the EU AI Act is not published in the Official Journal by _$TIME_1, if adoption is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved prioritizing official EU sources. Also resolves 'No' if the legislative event never occurred or differs materially from the EU AI Act definition.

items.title: 2025 Africa Cup of Nations winner other than Morocco by January 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the winning national team of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations football tournament is any team other than Morocco according to the official final match result. Resolution is based on official announcements by the Confederation of African Football (CAF) and event organizers, verified through official CAF publications and major media outlets by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAfrica Cup of Nations@content_divideran international football championship of African national teams organized by CAF – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCAF@content_dividerConfederation of African Football, the governing body of African football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official CAF or event organizer source confirms a team other than Morocco won the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations by _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires published final match results on the CAF website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCAF official website@content_dividerhttps://www.cafonline.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent authoritative outlet. Backup verification includes at least two tier-1 major media reports explicitly confirming the winner by the deadline.

This market resolves 'No' if Morocco is officially confirmed as the winner by _$TIME_1, if the tournament is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if no official winner is declared by _$TIME_1, or if verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, official CAF declarations take precedence. If the event never occurred or no final was played, the market resolves 'No'.

items.title: United States federal government shutdown ends before October 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the 2025 United States federal government shutdown formally ends by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFederal government shutdown@content_dividera partial or complete closure of federal government operations due to failure to enact appropriations legislation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ based on formal congressional or executive action resuming full federal funding according to official U.S. government sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 the federal government officially resumes full funding through a continuing resolution, appropriations bill, or executive order as confirmed by authoritative sources such as the U.S. Congress, White House, or federal agency announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerstatements on official government websites, verified social media accounts, or congressional records)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major media outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation and archival records from the Government Publishing Office or Congressional Record.

This market resolves 'No' if no formal resumption of full federal funding occurs by _$TIME_1, if the shutdown is officially extended, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if no verifiable confirmation is available by that deadline. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official government publications and congressional records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the shutdown does not exist or never occurred in 2025.

items.title: Epstein client list full release by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the full Jeffrey Epstein client list naming high-profile individuals _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerJeffrey Epstein client list@content_dividera comprehensive document or compilation identifying persons allegedly connected to Jeffrey Epstein’s activities involving high-profile individuals – Contextual definition)_$ANNOTATION$_ is publicly released by an official United States Department of Justice (DOJ) or congressional announcement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if the DOJ or a United States congressional committee issues an explicit, official public release or confirmation of the full client list naming high-profile individuals by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_divineresolution sources@content_dividerofficial DOJ or congressional announcements, verified government websites, or major tier-1 media reports corroborated by two or more authoritative sources)_$ANNOTATION$_. This includes direct publication, official press releases, or congressional disclosures accessible from persistent public archives.

Resolves 'No' if no such official release or confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if authoritative sources explicitly deny the existence or release of such a list, if the event is indefinitely postponed or cancelled, or if verification data is unavailable or insufficient by _$TIME_1. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official DOJ and congressional records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the client list never existed or was never publicly released in full.

items.title: Cobie mention Coinbase in next Up Only episode by November 3?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Cobie _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCobie@content_dividerpublic pseudonym of crypto influencer and podcaster formerly known as Crypto Cobain – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ mentions Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividerCoinbase: a cryptocurrency exchange platform headquartered in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ during the next Up Only podcast episode airing after October 27, 2025, based on official podcast release and NFT fine print confirmation by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if explicit mention of Coinbase is verifiably confirmed in the episode content released by official Up Only podcast channels or stated in the NFT fine print _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerNFT fine print@content_dividertext attached to a non-fungible token specifying conditions verified via blockchain records or official disclosures)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official podcast streaming platforms, Up Only social media, or NFT metadata repositories.

Resolves 'No' if no verified mention of Coinbase occurs in the specified episode by _$TIME_1, if the episode is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if official verification sources are unavailable or contradictory. This market also resolves 'No' if the episode does not exist or cannot be definitively identified as the next episode after October 27, 2025, using authoritative sources.

items.title: Coinbase burns Up Only NFT by November 1, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Coinbase permanently destroys the Up Only non-fungible token (NFT) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNFT@content_dividera unique digital asset representing ownership of a specific item using blockchain technology – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by sending it to a verified burn address before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerburn address@content_dividera blockchain address designated for irreversible token destruction, inaccessible for retrieval – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification uses blockchain explorer data and official Coinbase announcements.

Resolves 'No' if the official final score does not show Chelsea as winner, if the match is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if no official match result is published by the deadline, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting data, official Premier League sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the match never occurred or was never scheduled as per official Premier League fixture lists.
