items.title: BTC > $190000 by December 15?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $190,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1 according to closing prices from major cryptocurrency exchanges.

Resolves 'Yes' if official closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMajor cryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerleading digital asset trading platforms such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin's USD price met or exceeded $190,000 at any point on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published daily closing prices accessible via exchange websites, trusted financial data vendors, or archived records _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerVerification sources@content_dividerCoinbase https://www.coinbase.com, Binance https://www.binance.com, CoinMarketCap https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed $190,000 USD by _$TIME_1, or if reliable price data is unavailable or conflicting. The market also resolves 'No' if trading is halted, the market is closed, or Bitcoin ceases to exist as a tradable asset by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and archived official records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurs or if verification is insufficient by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Solana (SOL) ≥ $250 by November 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera blockchain platform and cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $250 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-11-15T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ based on aggregated exchange data and market capitalization reported by authoritative crypto analytics platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerauthoritative crypto analytics platforms@content_dividertrusted sources like CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or blockchain data aggregators – industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one verified price report from primary authoritative sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerprimary authoritative sources@content_dividerofficial coin market websites, verified crypto exchange data APIs, or top-tier crypto analytics platforms)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms SOL’s price ≥ $250 USD any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification includes timestamped exchange snapshots, official market cap reports, or blockchain explorer data published by these sources. Backup verification may use Internet Archive snapshots or regulatory filings if primary sources are inaccessible.

This market resolves 'No' if SOL price does not reach $250 by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or SOL is delisted before the deadline, if the token ceases to exist or is rebranded without equivalence, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting data resolves in favor of official and primary source confirmations. This market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed (SOL token discontinued or market closed).

items.title: Japan hunter reward increase by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Japan officially increases the hunter reward amount by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerHunter reward amount@content_dividerthe monetary compensation paid by government or authorized forestry agencies to hunters for specific hunting activities – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by the Japanese government or authorized forestry agencies through official publications or statements.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement or regulatory filing by the Japanese government or authorized forestry agencies _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerJapanese government@content_dividerthe central government of Japan as defined by its official websites and publications – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms an increase in the hunter reward amount by _$TIME_1, with verification through publicly accessible official websites, government press releases, or authoritative forestry agency communications. Backup verification includes major media reports corroborated by two or more tier-1 sources or official forestry statistics.

Resolves 'No' if no verified official increase is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the increase is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if authoritative verification is unavailable, or if the event fundamentally differs from the market specification. In case of conflicting reports, official government publications take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or no hunter reward program is in place.

items.title: Ko Wen-je conviction on political donation crimes by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Ko Wen-je is convicted of political donation crimes according to official court rulings or prosecutorial announcements by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPolitical donation crimes@content_dividerillegal acts involving contributions to political campaigns or parties – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in Taipei, Taiwan.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official court verdict or prosecutorial declaration confirming Ko Wen-je’s conviction for political donation crimes is published by an authoritative Taiwanese judicial source _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerTaiwanese judicial source@content_dividerTaiwan's Ministry of Justice, Taipei District Court official website, or verified government press releases – https://www.moj.gov.tw)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1. Verification may include court documents, government statements, or reputable media with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such conviction is officially confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the prosecution or court publicly dismisses or overturns charges before that time, if the event is indefinitely postponed or cancelled, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information resolves in favor of official judicial declarations. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ko Wen-je is not formally charged or convicted by the deadline.

items.title: Solana price > $191.42 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera blockchain-based cryptocurrency native to the Solana network – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $191.42 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any official daily closing price on major cryptocurrency exchanges by _$TIME_1. Price data is sourced primarily from Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividerKraken: a major cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and backed up by other reliable exchanges such as Bitget, MEXC, and HTX, using UTC timezone closing prices.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one verified official daily closing price for SOL is strictly greater than $191.42 USD on or before _$TIME_1, confirmed by Kraken’s official price listings or equivalent authoritative exchange data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial price data@content_dividerofficial exchange websites, verified trading history APIs, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes corroboration from at least one additional major exchange like Bitget or MEXC, or SolanaFM historical data archives.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified daily closing price exceeds $191.42 USD by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted, SOL is delisted, or if reliable price data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing Kraken’s official data followed by secondary exchanges. The market also resolves 'No' if SOL trading never existed, was suspended indefinitely, or the specified price threshold is never met. Lack of verifiable confirmation by settlement time defaults to 'No'.

items.title: NEAR Protocol > $2.13 by November 7?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of NEAR Protocol _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNEAR Protocol@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform and cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in US dollars remains strictly above $2.13 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on all major cryptocurrency exchanges at the close of trading on November 7, 2025 UTC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUTC@content_dividerCoordinated Universal Time, the primary time standard by which the world regulates clocks and time – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. The resolution uses aggregated closing prices from authoritative exchange sources with backup verification via major market data aggregators.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified official closing prices from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms where cryptocurrencies are bought and sold – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ show NEAR Protocol closing strictly above $2.13 USD on November 7, 2025 UTC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerCoinbase, Kraken, Binance official exchange websites or aggregated data services like CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires archival snapshots or official published data accessible at or before _$TIME_1. Secondary confirmation may include reputable financial news reporting with explicit price confirmation.

This market resolves 'No' if the closing price on November 7, 2025 UTC is equal to or below $2.13 USD, if trading is halted or exchanges delist NEAR Protocol before _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved prioritizing official exchange and aggregator data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if NEAR Protocol trading ceases permanently or the token is invalidated before the deadline.

items.title: Flow price > $0.27 by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the trading price of Flow cryptocurrency _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFlow,cryptocurrency@content_dividera digital asset native to the Flow blockchain network – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ surpasses $0.27 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD,United States dollar@content_dividerthe official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Flow's highest confirmed trading price exceeds $0.27 USD on at least one major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividermajor exchanges@content_dividercryptocurrency exchanges with significant trading volume and global recognition, such as Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, or similar)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires data from official exchange APIs, aggregated market data providers like CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data platform – CoinMarketCap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, or TradingView _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerTradingView@content_dividera financial visualization platform providing real-time market data – TradingView.com)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived price snapshots from Internet Archive or official exchange historical data endpoints.

This market resolves 'No' if Flow price does not surpass $0.27 USD by _$TIME_1, or if trading is halted, the asset is delisted from all major exchanges, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange data and reputable aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Flow cryptocurrency ceases to exist or is no longer actively traded by the deadline.

items.title: Cosmos Interchain Accounts upgrade by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Cosmos network successfully activates the Interchain Accounts upgrade on Cosmos Hub by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCosmos Network@content_dividera decentralized blockchain ecosystem enabling interoperability between independent blockchains – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerInterchain Accounts@content_dividera feature enabling one blockchain to control accounts on another blockchain via Cosmos Hub – Cosmos official documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_ as verified by official governance proposals or announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Cosmos Hub governance proposals or Interchain Foundation statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerInterchain Foundation@content_dividera non-profit organization supporting the Cosmos ecosystem development – Interchain Foundation website https://interchain.io)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm successful activation of the Interchain Accounts upgrade by _$TIME_1, with verification via Cosmos Hub governance records (https://cosmos.network/governance) or Interchain Foundation official channels.

Resolves 'No' if the upgrade is not activated by _$TIME_1, if official sources confirm cancellation or indefinite postponement, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Cosmos Hub governance records and Interchain Foundation announcements. This market resolves 'No' if the upgrade event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Polygon (MATIC) > $0.21 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Polygon (MATIC) closing price _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPolygon (MATIC)@content_dividerPolygon is a blockchain platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPolygon@content_dividera protocol and framework for building and connecting Ethereum-compatible blockchain networks – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and MATIC is its native cryptocurrency token _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMATIC@content_dividerMATIC is the native cryptocurrency token used for transactions and staking on the Polygon network – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) exceeds $0.21 USD on major global cryptocurrency exchanges by _$TIME_1, measured by aggregated closing prices according to authoritative market data providers.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verified official closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency price aggregators such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera cryptocurrency market data aggregator providing price, volume, and market cap information – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera cryptocurrency data platform tracking prices and market metrics globally – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm MATIC's closing price on any major exchange exceeds $0.21 USD by _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires price snapshots or official exchange data published on or before _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes historical OHLC datasets from trusted sources such as Bitget or Yahoo Finance.

This market resolves 'No' if MATIC's closing price does not reach or exceed $0.21 USD on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if reliable official price data is unavailable, or if trading is halted, exchanges delist MATIC, or authoritative verification cannot confirm the price target. Conflicting or delayed data is resolved by prioritizing aggregated data from CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Polygon network or MATIC token ceases operation or is permanently decommissioned before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Elon Musk mentions Mars by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Elon Musk explicitly mentions the word 'Mars' _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMars@content_dividerthe fourth planet from the Sun in the solar system – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ in a public statement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPublic statement@content_dividera communication made openly to the public by verbal or written means – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification is by official or verified Elon Musk channels including verified social media accounts or official press events.

Resolves 'Yes' if any explicit verbal or written reference to 'Mars' by Elon Musk is documented by official sources such as his verified Twitter account _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTwitter@content_dividera social media platform for public posts with verified accounts – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, official SpaceX announcements, or verified press events by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes major media reports corroborated by two or more tier-1 sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTier-1 sources@content_dividerhighly reputable and authoritative news organizations or government publications – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no verified mention of 'Mars' by Elon Musk occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially denied, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting evidence is resolved by prioritizing official Elon Musk channels. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Elon Musk makes no public statements or if the word 'Mars' is never explicitly referenced.

items.title: MegaETH launch ≥ $3B FDV by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether MegaETH's fully diluted valuation (FDV) at launch meets or exceeds $3 billion USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFully diluted valuation@content_dividermarket capitalization calculated as total token supply multiplied by token price at launch – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ based on token generation event (TGE) and exchange listing, verified by primary and secondary market data.

Resolves 'Yes' if official confirmation from MegaETH or verified exchange sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividercompany websites, official social media, or exchange announcements)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows a TGE and public exchange listing occurred by _$TIME_1 and FDV is ≥ $3 billion USD, supported by market capitalization data from public sale and futures markets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMarket capitalization data@content_dividerpublicly accessible token market cap from exchanges and futures platforms)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no official TGE or exchange listing occurs by _$TIME_1, if the launch is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if FDV is confirmed below $3 billion USD at launch, or if authoritative data is unavailable or contradictory by the deadline. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official MegaETH sources, verified exchange data, or major media with dual tier-1 source verification. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never took place or tokens were not issued publicly as defined.

items.title: Buzzing offers 3+ options by November 7, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Buzzing officially offers three or more distinct options _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerOptions@content_dividerdistinct option offerings officially available to customers – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as publicly announced or confirmed by the company or verified financial data by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if credible official disclosures _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial disclosures@content_dividerstatements or filings issued by Buzzing via company website, regulatory filings, or major verified media)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm three or more such options are available by _$TIME_1. Verification includes company reports, regulatory submissions, and corroborating tier-1 media sources.

Resolves 'No' if fewer than three distinct options are confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official sources deny availability, or if verification data is unavailable or insufficient. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing primary source disclosures. The market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or options were never offered.

items.title: U.S. federal government reopens by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the U.S. federal government officially reopens _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerU.S. federal government@content_dividerthe national government of the United States, comprising executive, legislative, and judicial branches – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-12-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ through the passage of a continuing resolution or approved federal budget according to official announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official statement or document from the U.S. government _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial statement@content_dividera formal announcement on government websites, congressional records, or verified federal agency communications)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms reopening by _$TIME_1, including the passage of a continuing resolution or full appropriations act restoring federal funding and operations. Backup confirmation may come from major tier-1 media with dual verification or direct federal agency status updates.

Resolves 'No' if the government remains closed past _$TIME_1, if reopening is officially denied, indefinitely postponed, or no verifiable confirmation is available. In case of conflicting reports, official government sources prevail. This market also resolves 'No' if the government shutdown never occurred or if the reopening event does not exist as specified.

items.title: Nigerian government reduces violent killings in Middle Belt and north by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Nigeria achieves a statistically significant reduction in violent killings by armed groups in the Middle Belt and northern states by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMeasurable reduction@content_dividera statistically significant decrease in violent killings compared to prior official reports – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. The measurement uses official Nigerian government data or credible human rights organizations' reports accessible for verification.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Nigerian authorities or internationally recognized monitoring groups _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAuthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial government publications, Nigerian security agencies, or credible NGOs such as Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm a statistically significant decrease in violent killings by armed groups in the specified regions by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published data, official statements, or reports available at government websites, NGO portals, or major verified media outlets. Backup verification includes archived datasets and recognized international monitoring entities.

Resolves 'No' if no such measurable reduction is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if data sources are unavailable, if the event is effectively negated by official or credible sources, or if the violent killing trend remains stable or increases. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official Nigerian government statistics, then major NGO reports, and finally verified media. This market also resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or if credible data does not exist.

items.title: XRP > $4 by November 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the XRP cryptocurrency price in USD exceeds 4.00 at any point by _$TIME_1, using aggregated live XRP/USD trading data from major cryptocurrency exchanges as reported by authoritative crypto market data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerXRP,cryptocurrency token native to Ripple Labs – Merriam-Webster) _$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividercryptocurrency, digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster) _$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerauthoritative sources, official and widely recognized data aggregators such as CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or regulated market data services)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if any official aggregated closing or intra-day XRP/USD price from at least two independent major exchanges exceeds 4.00 USD by _$TIME_1, with verification from primary source market data websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap, https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/xrp/ )_$ANNOTATION$_, coin exchange APIs, or equivalent authoritative crypto price data aggregators by that deadline. Backup confirmation may include major financial news outlets reporting verified XRP price spikes above 4.00 USD by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if XRP price does not exceed 4.00 USD by _$TIME_1, if cryptocurrency trading of XRP is halted, suspended, or delisted from major exchanges before _$TIME_1, if official price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled (e.g., XRP trading permanently ceases). Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing primary crypto exchange data and major aggregator consensus. Additionally, resolves 'No' if XRP or its trading does not exist or is permanently discontinued before _$TIME_1.

items.title: SocialFi app > 100 million users by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether any SocialFi _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSocialFi@content_dividera social financial platform combining social networking and decentralized finance technologies – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ application surpasses 100 million active users measured by verified platform analytics by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if a SocialFi app publicly reports and verifies an active user count exceeding 100 million by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerverified platform analytics published by the app or official corporate disclosures at https://example.com or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires data from official app analytics dashboards, corporate filings, or multiple major technology news outlets corroborated by at least two tier-1 sources.

This market resolves 'No' if no SocialFi app reaches 100 million active users by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if official or verifiable data is unavailable or contradictory, or if no SocialFi app exists. In event of data conflicts, priority is given to official platform disclosures, followed by corporate regulatory filings, then major media confirmations. The market also resolves 'No' if the concept of a SocialFi app does not exist or was never launched.

items.title: X crypto tipping beyond Dogecoin by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether X (formerly Twitter) integrates a crypto tipping feature supporting at least one cryptocurrency other than Dogecoin by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerX@content_dividerX is the social media platform formerly known as Twitter – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, with resolution based on explicit official announcements or confirmations by X or Elon Musk.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official statement from X's verified channels or Elon Musk's verified communications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividera public statement published on X’s official website, verified social media accounts, or press releases)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms the launch or integration of crypto tipping for cryptocurrencies beyond Dogecoin by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation includes major tier-1 media outlets with dual-source verification or credible visual evidence.

Resolves 'No' if no such verified confirmation occurs by _$TIME_1, if the feature is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if only Dogecoin tipping is supported. If official sources are unavailable or ambiguous by _$TIME_1, the market resolves 'No'. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official X or Elon Musk sources. The market also resolves 'No' if the integration event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Decentralized identity replaces Google login by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether decentralized identity (DID) systems _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDecentralized identity systems@content_dividerdigital identity frameworks that enable self-managed identifiers without centralized authorities – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ become the majority user login method, replacing Google Sign-In _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerGoogle Sign-In@content_dividerGoogle's authentication platform allowing user login via Google accounts – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official adoption statements or usage metrics from authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1, multiple authoritative sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerauthoritative sources@content_dividerofficial company statements, regulatory filings, major verified media reports, or official usage data)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm that DID systems have overtaken Google Sign-In as the primary login method for a majority of users across relevant platforms, supported by usage statistics or verified adoption announcements published on official company websites or regulatory disclosures.

This market resolves 'No' if by _$TIME_1 there is no verified confirmation of majority DID login adoption, if authoritative sources explicitly deny such transition, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable usage data is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official corporate disclosures and regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or DID systems do not constitute a majority login method.

items.title: Galatasaray wins UEFA Champions League by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Galatasaray officially wins the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League, determined by the final match result at the Puskás Aréna in Budapest, verified by UEFA's official publication by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerUEFA Champions League@content_dividerannual European football club competition organized by UEFA – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerGalatasaray@content_dividerGalatasaray Spor Kulübü, major Turkish professional football club based in Istanbul – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if UEFA officially confirms Galatasaray as winners of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League final by _$TIME_1, through UEFA.com or UEFA's verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUEFA official sources@content_dividerhttps://www.uefa.com/)_$ANNOTATION$_, or via legally recognized announcements or final match reports published by UEFA or major verified sports news outlets with at least two tier-1 source corroborations.

This market resolves 'No' if Galatasaray is not officially declared winner by _$TIME_1, if the final match is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if UEFA disqualifies Galatasaray, if no official confirmation of their victory exists by _$TIME_1, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing UEFA's direct official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the Champions League final does not occur or the competition format changes making the event non-compliant.

items.title: BTC > $120,000 by November 15?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin price in USD exceeds $120,000 at any major exchange closing price on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_. Prices must be sourced from recognized exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken and aggregated by official market data providers.

Resolves 'Yes' if explicit official or verified exchange closing price data confirm Bitcoin’s price surpasses $120,000 USD at least once on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerverified exchange websites, major financial data aggregators, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes price snapshots, exchange API records, or official price indices published by authoritative providers such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin price does not exceed $120,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if relevant exchanges are closed or data unavailable, or if no authoritative confirmation exists. If price data are disputed or conflicting, resolution follows the majority consensus of tier-1 exchange data sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading halts indefinitely or the cryptocurrency ceases to exist by the deadline.

items.title: Solana price ≥ $250 by November 30, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana@content_dividera blockchain platform and cryptocurrency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $250 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1, based on aggregated price data from multiple reliable cryptocurrency data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice measurement@content_divideraggregation and normalization of SOL token prices from centralized exchanges, decentralized exchanges, and blockchain oracles)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if any official aggregated closing price or spot price for Solana on any recognized exchange equals or exceeds $250 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_divineresolution deadline@content_divider2025-11-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires data from at least two independent, authoritative crypto data providers such as SolanaFM _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerSolanaFM@content_divideran on-chain Solana data provider offering historical prices and market data – https://solana.fm)_$ANNOTATION$_, Birdeye _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerBirdeye@content_dividera crypto market data platform providing token price tracking and liquidity metrics – https://birdeye.so)_$ANNOTATION$_, or DIA's Solana API _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=7@counter_dividerDIA@content_dividerDecentralized Information Asset providing real-time price feeds via blockchain oracles – https://diadata.org)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes archived data from Internet Archive or other permanent data repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if Solana price does not reach $250 USD by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable or unverifiable, if the event is cancelled (e.g., Solana token delisting), or if authoritative data sources contradict price achievement. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official API feeds and well-established market data providers. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana token ceases trading or the price event never occurs.

items.title: BTC > $130,000 by December 25?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (digital cryptocurrency _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) reaches or exceeds a price of $130,000 USD on any major cryptocurrency exchange closing price by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2025-12-25T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Price data is sourced primarily from CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, and major exchange APIs, with verification through archived historical price databases.

Resolves 'Yes' if any authoritative source publishes verified closing price data for Bitcoin at or above $130,000 USD by _$TIME_1. Official sources include major exchanges (e.g., Coinbase, Binance) and aggregated price indices (e.g., CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency market data provider – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_). Backup confirmation may be obtained through Internet Archive snapshots and independent cryptocurrency data aggregators.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed $130,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable, if trading is halted or exchanges delisted Bitcoin before the deadline, or if the event never occurs. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange closing prices and aggregated market data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading ceases or the underlying market collapses before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Ethereum (ETH) > $4200 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividerthe second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, based on blockchain technology – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $4,200 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1, as determined by aggregated price data from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_divideronline platforms where cryptocurrencies are traded – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if credible official price data from at least two major exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or Gemini _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerMajor crypto exchanges@content_dividerlarge, reputable digital asset trading platforms – derived from primary source websites or verified APIs)_$ANNOTATION$_ show ETH price exceeding $4,200 USD at any point on or before _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires archival access to historical price data from official exchange APIs or reputable aggregators like CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerPrice data aggregators@content_dividerwebsites providing aggregated cryptocurrency market data – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if ETH price does not exceed $4,200 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1, or if reliable price verification data is unavailable, exchanges halt trading, or the event is cancelled. In case of conflicting or incomplete data, resolution follows a hierarchy prioritizing official exchange data, then aggregator records, then archived sources. This market also resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist, is delisted, or trading is indefinitely suspended by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Pharos mainnet launch by January 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Pharos Network _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerPharos Network@content_dividera blockchain platform founded by former Ant Financial and Alibaba leaders aiming at high-performance Layer-1 EVM blockchain – official Pharos website)_$ANNOTATION$_ conducts a mainnet launch _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMainnet launch@content_dividerthe public release of a blockchain network open for general use as announced by official channels – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ during January 2026 according to official Pharos Network announcements or verified authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official public announcement or confirmation of the Pharos mainnet launch is published by the Pharos Network through its official website or verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerhttps://labs.zetachain.com or official Pharos channels)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, explicitly stating the mainnet is live and open for general use. Backup verification includes major blockchain news outlets with explicit confirmation from at least two tier-1 sources or visual evidence (e.g., blockchain explorers or transaction activity) from authoritative entities.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the mainnet launch is officially postponed or cancelled beyond _$TIME_1, or if verifiable data is unavailable. In cases of conflicting information, resolution prioritizes official Pharos Network sources, then major media with dual confirmation. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch event never occurred or was never planned within the specified timeframe.

items.title: Second Monad (MON) airdrop claim after November 3, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether an official second airdrop claim window for Monad (MON) tokens _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMonad@content_dividerMonad: a Layer-1 blockchain platform and its native token MON – official Monad Foundation website)_$ANNOTATION$_ opens after _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2025-11-03T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ as confirmed by the Monad Foundation or equally authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if the Monad Foundation publishes an official announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMonad Foundation@content_dividerthe organization developing Monad blockchain – official Monad Foundation website)_$ANNOTATION$_ or updates the official claim portal _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerClaim portal@content_dividerhttps://claim.monad.xyz, the official Monad token claim website)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming a new airdrop claim window opening after _$TIME_1, verified by primary sources or major Tier-1 crypto news outlets with direct Monad Foundation confirmation by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if no official announcement or claim window occurs by _$TIME_1, if the second claim is officially cancelled or postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, or if verification fails from all authoritative sources. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing Monad Foundation statements and major crypto media with corroboration. Resolves 'No' if the event never existed or is not aligned with the defined second airdrop claim criteria.

items.title: Travis Scott album release by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Travis Scott or his label Cactus Jack officially releases a new album publicly available on digital streaming platforms or as a physical product by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAlbum release@content_dividerofficial public availability of a music album on digital or physical formats – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement or release confirmation from Travis Scott or Cactus Jack is published on their verified websites or social media, or reported by at least two tier-1 media sources by _$TIME_1. Verification includes direct statements, digital platform listings, or physical product distribution evidence _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerverified artist/label websites, social media accounts, or major media with explicit confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified album release occurs by _$TIME_1, if the release is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing direct artist/label announcements. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no album release event exists or takes place by the deadline.

items.title: Ethereum > $4,800 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Ethereum _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized open-source blockchain featuring smart contract functionality – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $4,800 USD by _$TIME_1, using aggregated official exchange price data from Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividercryptocurrency exchange platform headquartered in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFRED@content_dividerFederal Reserve Economic Data: comprehensive U.S. economic data repository maintained by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis – FRED official website)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if official aggregated price data confirms Ethereum’s closing price on any trading day on or before _$TIME_1 is equal to or greater than $4,800 USD. Verification requires published closing prices from Coinbase’s official exchange data feed and corroborating FRED data accessible at relevant official URLs. Backup verification includes archived snapshots from Internet Archive and major crypto market data aggregators like TradingView and CoinMarketCap.

This market resolves 'No' if Ethereum’s price does not reach $4,800 USD by _$TIME_1, if the event is invalidated by permanent trading suspension, exchange delisting, or data unavailability. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing Coinbase official data, then FRED, then major market aggregators. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Ethereum ceases to exist, is replaced, or if official price data is permanently inaccessible by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Karak Network cross-chain staking launch by November 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Karak Network officially launches cross-chain staking functionality enabling staking of assets such as ETH, stablecoins, and Bitcoin across multiple blockchain networks by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCross-chain staking@content_dividerstaking assets across multiple blockchain networks to earn rewards – Merriam-Webster and blockchain technology concept)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if Karak Network or its verified official channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividercompany website, verified social media accounts, or official platform updates)_$ANNOTATION$_ publish explicit announcements confirming the launch by _$TIME_1. Verification includes documented feature releases, platform update logs, or official press releases accessible via Karak Network's main website or authenticated social media. Backup verification may include major blockchain industry news outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation or archived snapshots _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerArchive verification@content_dividerInternet Archive, regulatory filings, or public records)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no authoritative confirmation of cross-chain staking launch occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if the feature is materially different from defined cross-chain staking, or if verification data is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to Karak Network's official announcements. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was never planned as defined.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $150,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange closing price by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official closing price data from at least two independent major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital platform for trading cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ show Bitcoin closing at or above $150,000 USD on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible exchange data or authoritative aggregate price indices such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinGecko, archived or live at settlement.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach or exceed $150,000 USD on any major exchange closing price by _$TIME_1, if official price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if trading of Bitcoin is suspended, delisted, or otherwise unavailable on all major exchanges by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange APIs and aggregate index providers per documented hierarchy. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or is no longer actively traded before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Hyperliquid daily volume > $30B by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Hyperliquid _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerHyperliquid@content_dividera decentralized perpetual swap trading platform – based on search context)_$ANNOTATION$_ achieves any single 24-hour period of USD-denominated executed trades exceeding $30 billion before or at _$TIME_1. Daily trading volume aggregates all executed trades converted to USD using official exchange data feeds.

Resolves 'Yes' if official exchange data feeds _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerexchange data feeds@content_divideraggregated real-time trade data provided by Hyperliquid or associated verified sources)_$ANNOTATION$_ from Hyperliquid or its parent platform confirm a daily trading volume over $30 billion for any 24-hour UTC day on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publication on Hyperliquid's official website, verified social media, or major tier-1 crypto data aggregators with explicit volume confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no verified daily trading volume exceeds $30 billion by _$TIME_1, if Hyperliquid ceases operation or data feeds become permanently unavailable, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting data resolution prioritizes official Hyperliquid sources and major crypto analytics platforms. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Hyperliquid does not exist or never operates before the deadline.

items.title: MEXC Exchange account freezes >5% before December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the incidence of account freezes _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAccount freeze@content_dividertemporary blocking or restriction of a user's cryptocurrency trading account preventing transactions or withdrawals – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ affecting more than 5% of active users on MEXC Exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMEXC Exchange@content_dividera cryptocurrency exchange platform offering digital asset trading services – company official website)_$ANNOTATION$_ is reduced by _$TIME_1. The incidence percentage is calculated as (number of active users with frozen accounts / total active users) × 100%, verified through official disclosures or credible industry reports.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 MEXC Exchange or a regulatory body officially discloses a reduction in account freezes affecting over 5% of active users, confirmed via company website statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerMEXC official website@content_dividerhttps://www.mexc.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified social media, or major industry reports from at least two tier-1 sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTier-1 sources@content_dividerhighly credible established media organizations with independent verification – Merriam-Webster/Oxford)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if by _$TIME_1 no authoritative confirmation is available, if the incidence remains above 5%, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if official data is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved prioritizing MEXC official disclosures, followed by regulatory filings and major media. The market also resolves 'No' if the account freeze metric or reporting never existed or is unverifiable.

items.title: Aster surpass Hyperliquid market share by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aster’s share of decentralized perpetual trading volume over any continuous 30-day period up to and including _$TIME_1 is strictly greater than Hyperliquid’s share according to trusted decentralized finance analytics platforms and official protocol data _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDecentralized perpetual trading volume@content_dividervolume of perpetual derivative contracts traded on decentralized exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMarket share@content_dividerthe portion or percentage of total trading volume held by a given protocol relative to the whole market – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one authoritative source such as official protocol disclosures, verified DeFi analytics platforms (e.g., DeFiLlama, Dune Analytics) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDeFi analytics platforms@content_dividetrusted platforms aggregating decentralized finance metrics, volumes, and TVL – DeFiLlama https://defillama.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirms Aster’s market share surpasses Hyperliquid’s by _$TIME_1 with supporting documentation or data snapshots covering a 30-day volume period ending no later than _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes Internet Archive captures, major blockchain data aggregators, or official social media announcements.

Resolves 'No' if no verified confirmation of Aster surpassing Hyperliquid exists by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if data is unavailable or insufficient to confirm surpassing. In case of contradictory data, resolution defers to primary official protocol sources or highest-ranked analytics platforms. Also resolves 'No' if either protocol ceases operation, the event never occurs, or market share cannot be reliably ascertained.

items.title: BTC > $115,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds $115,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1 as determined by the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerVolume-weighted average price@content_divideran average price weighted by trading volume at each price point – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ across major cryptocurrency exchanges including Coinbase _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinbase@content_dividera major US-based cryptocurrency exchange platform – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ and verified market data sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative price data from official exchange APIs or websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial exchange APIs@content_dividerdirect data endpoints provided by exchanges like Coinbase)_$ANNOTATION$_ or major financial data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerFinancial data aggregators@content_dividertrusted platforms aggregating market prices from multiple exchanges)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin’s VWAP exceeds $115,000 USD at any moment on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires timestamped price records published by these sources or archived snapshots accessible via the Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera digital archive of the World Wide Web and other information – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin’s VWAP does not exceed $115,000 USD at any time by _$TIME_1, if trading on major exchanges is suspended or Bitcoin is delisted before this date, or if authoritative data is unavailable or insufficient to verify price action. Conflicting or incomplete data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange sources and major financial news verification. Additionally, this market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin trading does not exist or Bitcoin ceases to exist before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $150,000 by November 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the spot price of Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceeds 150,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1, using aggregated price data from leading global cryptocurrency exchanges at market close in UTC.

Resolves 'Yes' if authoritative cryptocurrency price aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrice aggregator@content_dividerplatforms that compile and report cryptocurrency prices from multiple exchanges – Finance industry standard)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified exchange data publish a Bitcoin spot price exceeding 150,000 USD at any point on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published data or official statements from major exchanges such as Coinbase, Binance, Kraken, or CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividercryptocurrency price tracking website – https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin spot price does not exceed 150,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if reliable price data is unavailable, or if trading on major exchanges is halted or suspended beyond _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs and major aggregator consensus. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin spot price data or trading activity ceases to exist or the market fundamentally changes (e.g., Bitcoin replaced or delisted).

items.title: BTC > $120000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) reaches or exceeds a price of $120,000 USD based on aggregated global exchange data by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if any authoritative and verifiable source _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative source@content_dividerofficial exchange data aggregators, major crypto market data providers, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Bitcoin’s highest traded price in USD equals or exceeds $120,000 at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires published price data from primary sources such as CoinDesk, CoinMarketCap, or CryptoCompare accessible via official websites or APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinDesk@content_dividerhttps://www.coindesk.com/price/bitcoin)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not reach $120,000 by _$TIME_1, if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1, or if trading is halted, Bitcoin is delisted, or the market ceases to exist by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange data and regulatory disclosures. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the price market never existed or is permanently suspended.

items.title: United States federal government shutdown ends by November 10, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the 2025 United States federal government shutdown officially ends on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerGovernment shutdown@content_dividera partial or complete closure of government operations due to lack of enacted funding legislation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, as confirmed by authoritative government announcements or Congressional funding legislation.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement or publication by the United States federal government _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUS federal government@content_dividerthe national government of the United States of America – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or the United States Congress _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUnited States Congress@content_dividerthe bicameral legislature of the United States, comprising the Senate and House of Representatives – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms the end of the shutdown by _$TIME_1, including enactment of funding legislation or formal declaration restoring normal government operations. Verification requires official government websites, Congressional records, or verified government press releases _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_divineresolution sources@content_dividerhttps://www.congress.gov and https://www.usa.gov)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the shutdown continues beyond _$TIME_1, if the shutdown is officially prolonged, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official government sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the shutdown event does not exist or never started.

items.rules:

This market measures whether Optimism _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerOptimism@content_dividera blockchain scaling solution designed to improve Ethereum transaction speed and reduce costs – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially integrates with at least one major Web2 application, Reddit _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerReddit@content_dividera social news aggregation, web content rating, and discussion website – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or Discord _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerDiscord@content_dividera VoIP, instant messaging and digital distribution platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, by _$TIME_1. The integration is defined as an official announcement by Optimism or the Web2 app confirming functional interoperability or partnership enabling use of Optimism technology within the app.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 an official announcement _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on Optimism’s or Reddit’s or Discord’s official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms such integration. Verification includes published blog posts, press releases, or verified social media posts from official corporate accounts. Backup verification may include major tier-1 media outlets explicitly citing and linking to official confirmations.

This market resolves 'No' if no official announcement meeting the criteria is published by _$TIME_1, if the integration is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. In cases of conflicting information, resolution prioritizes official corporate sources over media reports. This market also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or no integration plans were officially made.

items.title: Avalanche top 3 DeFi blockchain by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Avalanche (AVAX) ranks among the top 3 blockchains in decentralized finance (DeFi) by total value locked (TVL) and market capitalization according to reputable blockchain analytics platforms by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAvalanche (AVAX)@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform supporting smart contracts and DeFi applications – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeFi@content_dividerdecentralized finance: financial services conducted on blockchain networks without intermediaries – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTotal Value Locked (TVL)@content_dividerthe aggregate value of assets locked in DeFi protocols on a blockchain – Reputable blockchain analytics platforms)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerMarket Capitalization@content_dividertotal market value of a cryptocurrency calculated by multiplying price by circulating supply – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Resolution uses official statistics reported by authoritative blockchain analytics sources such as DeFiLlama, CoinGecko, or CoinMarketCap, with backup via Internet Archive snapshots and regulatory filings.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 an official report from at least two reputable blockchain analytics platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerReputable platforms@content_dividerDeFiLlama: https://defillama.com, CoinGecko: https://coingecko.com, CoinMarketCap: https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms Avalanche ranks within the top 3 blockchains for DeFi by combined TVL and market capitalization metrics. Verification requires published rankings or data snapshots dated on or before _$TIME_1. Alternative confirmation includes official Avalanche Foundation statements or major media reports citing such data.

This market resolves 'No' if Avalanche is not ranked in the top 3 blockchains for DeFi by TVL and market capitalization by _$TIME_1, if the ranking event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification data is unavailable. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official platform reports and Avalanche Foundation disclosures. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or no ranking data is published by the deadline.

items.title: Russia-Ukraine war complete end by June 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Russia-Ukraine war _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRussia-Ukraine war@content_dividerarmed conflict between Russia and Ukraine beginning in 2014, escalating in 2022 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially ceases all hostilities as recognized by major international bodies or governments by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if authoritative confirmation _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative confirmation@content_dividerofficial government or major intergovernmental organization confirmation – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ of complete cessation of hostilities is published by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-06-30T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_ through official statements, treaties, or declarations by both Russia and Ukraine and recognized by at least one major international organization such as the United Nations _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerUnited Nations@content_dividerinternational organization promoting peace and security – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or similar bodies.

This market resolves 'No' if no such authoritative confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if hostilities continue beyond _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicting reports are resolved prioritizing official government and international organization sources. It also resolves 'No' if the war never officially ended by the deadline or if the event never existed.

items.title: Solana price > $222 by November 15, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Solana (SOL) cryptocurrency exceeds $222 USD on any major cryptocurrency exchange by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera blockchain platform and its native cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, using official trade data denominated in United States dollars.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least one major cryptocurrency exchange publishes an official closing price for SOL strictly greater than $222 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerclosing price@content_dividerthe final price at the end of a trading session – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified through primary exchange data sources such as Coinbase, Binance, or Kraken websites or APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_divinerelated URLs@content_dividerhttps://www.coinbase.com/price/solana, https://www.binance.com/en/price/solana, https://r.kraken.com/c/2223866/687155/10583)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived snapshots thereof.

Resolves 'No' if no verified closing price above $222 USD is reported by any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if SOL trading is suspended or delisted before _$TIME_1, or if data verification fails or sources become unavailable. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange disclosures and aggregated market data providers. Also resolves 'No' if Solana or the specified price event does not exist or never occurs.

items.title: Ethereum price < $3000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Ethereum (ETH) in USD falls below $3,000 on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_divideran open-source blockchain-based platform with native cryptocurrency ether (ETH) – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as reported by major cryptocurrency exchanges including Kraken _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerKraken@content_dividercryptocurrency exchange platform providing real-time price data – Kraken.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Binance _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividerleading global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Binance.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if an official record from Kraken, Binance, or an equivalently authoritative exchange confirms a closing price below $3,000 USD by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerclosing price@content_dividerthe final trading price of the day on the exchange – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Alternative verification includes corroboration from at least two major tier-1 financial data providers or archived exchange data accessible through permanent repositories such as the Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividera non-profit library of millions of free books, movies, software, music, websites, and more – InternetArchive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'No' if no verified closing price below $3,000 USD occurs on or before _$TIME_1, or if all authoritative sources fail to confirm such a price. It also resolves 'No' if the market data is unavailable, exchanges cease trading Ethereum, or the event is otherwise non-verifiable by the deadline. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing data from Kraken and Binance, followed by major financial data providers. The market resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or price data is permanently inaccessible.

items.title: Donald Trump announces 2026 campaign by November 30?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Donald Trump formally announces a presidential campaign for the 2026 U.S. midterm elections by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDonald Trump@content_dividerDonald John Trump, 45th President of the United States from 2017 to 2021 – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ via verified official channels or authoritative U.S. political news outlets.

Resolves 'Yes' if a clear announcement of an official presidential campaign for the 2026 midterms is published by Donald Trump's verified social media accounts, official website, or reputable U.S. political news sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divineresolution source@content_dividerofficial Trump channels include https://www.donaldjtrump.com/, verified accounts on Truth Social, or major media outlets such as Associated Press, Reuters, or CNN with explicit confirmation)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Alternative confirmation may include official campaign filings or press releases.

Resolves 'No' if no verified announcement is made by _$TIME_1, if the announcement is explicitly denied, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official Trump sources and major U.S. political news outlets. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurs or if Trump explicitly states he will not run.

items.title: Aztec Network Layer 2 mainnet launch with programmable privacy by November 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aztec Network _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAztec Network@content_dividera privacy-focused Layer 2 blockchain built on Ethereum enabling private and public smart contract execution – Official Aztec Website)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches its Ethereum-based Layer 2 mainnet with programmable privacy features _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerProgrammable privacy features@content_dividercapabilities allowing private smart contracts and private state execution on the network – Aztec documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official confirmation of the mainnet launch with programmable privacy features is published by Aztec Network through its official communication channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial communication channels@content_dividerAztec Network's official website, verified social media accounts, or verified developer updates)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires explicit announcements or developer release notes clearly stating the mainnet launch and programmable privacy feature availability.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is published by _$TIME_1, if the launch is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradictory. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the network launches without programmable privacy features as defined or the event never occurs or is never planned. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Aztec Network sources and verified developer communications.

items.title: Fluent mainnet launch by October 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Fluent officially launches its mainnet for the blended execution network by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMainnet launch@content_dividerthe formal release of a blockchain network's fully operational main environment – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official Fluent Labs announcements or verified press releases.

Resolves 'Yes' if Fluent Labs publishes an official statement or press release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFluent Labs@content_dividerFluent Labs: the company developing the Fluent blended execution network – Official company website)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming mainnet launch on or before _$TIME_1, verifiable via Fluent Labs' official website, verified social media accounts, or major media outlets with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation is available by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing direct official Fluent Labs sources. This market also resolves 'No' if the mainnet launch event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Huang Mingzhi charged with murder of Xie Youxin by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Malaysian singer Huang Mingzhi is formally charged with the murder of Taiwanese model Xie Youxin by official public statement or court filing, confirmed by authoritative sources by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCharge@content_dividera formal accusation of a crime made by a governmental authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official public statement or court filing from Malaysian authorities or verified Malaysian judicial sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividergovernment publications, police announcements, court documents, or official Malaysian judiciary websites)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirms a formal charge against Huang Mingzhi for murder by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation may include major Malaysian or Taiwanese media outlets with independent tier-1 verification or official court records repositories.

Resolves 'No' if no such formal charge is confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory, or if the charge pertains to a different individual or crime. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official Malaysian government and judiciary sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event (formal charge) never existed or has not occurred by the deadline.

items.title: Iran U.S. restore full diplomatic relations by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Iran and the United States formally reestablish full diplomatic relations _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFull diplomatic relations@content_dividerformal reestablishment of embassies and full diplomatic recognition announced by official government statements from both parties – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1, based on official government declarations and verified authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if both the Iranian and U.S. governments publicly announce the restoration of full diplomatic ties, including embassy reopening and formal recognition, via official government websites or verified statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividerauthoritative government publications, official press releases, or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Backup verification may include major international media with dual tier-1 source confirmation or statements from recognized intergovernmental organizations.

Resolves 'No' if no verified official announcements occur by _$TIME_1, if the restoration event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to official government communications. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the diplomatic restoration event does not occur or never existed.

items.title: North Korea ICBM launch by April 1, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether North Korea launches an intercontinental ballistic missile _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerIntercontinental ballistic missile@content_dividera ballistic missile with a range greater than 5,500 kilometers capable of reaching the U.S. mainland – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ before _$TIME_1 according to official government or state media announcements from North Korea or allied monitoring agencies.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official or state media announcement by North Korea or an allied monitoring agency _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAllied monitoring agencies@content_dividergovernmental or intergovernmental organizations monitoring missile activity, e.g., U.S. Department of Defense, South Korean or Japanese defense agencies)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirms an ICBM launch capable of threatening the U.S. mainland by _$TIME_1.
