items.title: Solana Foundation new validator delegation program by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Solana Foundation officially launches a new validator delegation program including updated performance requirements for validator eligibility and stake delegation metrics by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana Foundation@content_dividera nonprofit organization supporting the Solana blockchain ecosystem – official website https://solana.org/foundation)_$ANNOTATION$_, verified by official announcements or delegation criteria updates.

Resolves 'Yes' if the Solana Foundation publicly announces and publishes the new delegation program with updated performance requirements by _$TIME_1, confirmed through official Solana Foundation channels such as their website, verified social media, or regulatory filings _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerhttps://solana.org/foundation, verified Solana Foundation social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major tier-1 media reports citing Foundation sources or archival captures.

Resolves 'No' if no official announcement or verifiable publication of a new delegation program with updated performance requirements occurs by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting information resolves in favor of official Solana Foundation publications. The market also resolves 'No' if the program never existed or failed to meet the defined updated criteria.

items.title: Apple AI assistant rivaling ChatGPT announced by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Apple formally announces an AI assistant intended to rival ChatGPT as a major public release or significant update to Siri by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAI assistant@content_dividera software agent that can perform tasks or services for an individual based on artificial intelligence – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerChatGPT@content_dividerChatGPT is an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI using large language models – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Apple publishes an official announcement or press release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerApple official announcement@content_dividerstatements from Apple’s official website, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 confirming the launch or major update of an AI-powered assistant rivaling ChatGPT, supported by corroborating reports from at least two tier-1 technology news outlets _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividertier-1 tech news@content_dividerestablished major technology media such as The Verge, TechCrunch, or Wired)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such official announcement occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if only minor or unrelated AI features are released without qualifying as a rival to ChatGPT, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing direct Apple sources and official media confirmations. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the AI assistant launch event never existed or was never planned.

items.title: Tesla market cap > $1.5 trillion by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures Tesla, Inc.’s market capitalization defined as the stock price multiplied by the number of shares outstanding as reported in official quarterly or annual financial filings. Resolution uses authoritative financial data from Tesla’s SEC filings and reliable financial data providers by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMarket capitalization@content_dividerthe total market value of a company's outstanding shares of stock – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerTesla, Inc.@content_dividerAmerican electric vehicle and clean energy company listed on Nasdaq – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Tesla’s market capitalization equals or exceeds $1,500,000,000,000 USD as officially reported in Tesla’s financial statements or by Nasdaq and corroborated by at least one additional major financial data provider such as Macrotrends by _$TIME_1. Verification requires Tesla’s SEC quarterly or annual filings available at https://www.sec.gov/edgar and Nasdaq official market cap data at https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/tsla. Backup confirmation may include archived financial reports or trusted financial news outlets with dual tier-1 source verification.

This market resolves 'No' if Tesla’s market capitalization does not reach $1.5 trillion USD by _$TIME_1, if Tesla is delisted, undergoes a trading halt indefinitely prior to _$TIME_1, or if official data is unavailable or contradicts the threshold. Conflicting data are resolved by prioritizing SEC filings and Nasdaq data. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Tesla ceases to exist as a public company or the event never occurs.

items.title: 黃明志 formally charged by December 21, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether 黃明志 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider黃明志@content_dividerMalaysian Chinese singer and public figure – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ is formally charged _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFormal charge@content_divideran official accusation made by police or court alleging a crime – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by Malaysian authorities on or before _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official police or court announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcements@content_dividerstatements published by Malaysian government agencies or judicial bodies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ explicitly confirm formal charges against 黃明志 by _$TIME_1. Verification requires publication on Malaysian police or court websites, official press releases, or major verified Malaysian media with dual-tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such formal charge confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if charges are officially denied, cancelled, or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting information, official Malaysian government or judicial sources take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or never existed.

items.title: Federal Reserve QE resumption by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Federal Reserve officially announces a resumption of quantitative easing _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerQuantitative easing@content_dividera monetary policy in which a central bank purchases securities to increase the money supply and stimulate economic growth – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-05-31T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Resolution is based on official Federal Reserve or Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) communications.

Resolves 'Yes' if an explicit official announcement by the Federal Reserve Board or FOMC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFederal Reserve Board@content_dividerthe governing body of the Federal Reserve System of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified release _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerFederal Open Market Committee@content_dividerthe principal monetary policymaking body of the Federal Reserve System – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming a resumption of quantitative easing is published by _$TIME_1. Verification includes Federal Reserve official website statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerFederal Reserve official website@content_dividerhttps://www.federalreserve.gov/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or FOMC meeting minutes and press releases. Backup verification includes major media with dual tier-1 source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if no such official announcement occurs by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative confirmation is unavailable. Conflicting information resolves by prioritizing official Federal Reserve sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if no quantitative easing resumption event exists or takes place by the deadline.

items.title: Las Vegas Aces win 2026 WNBA Championship by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Las Vegas Aces win the 2026 Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA) Championship _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerWNBA@content_dividerprofessional women's basketball league in the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ before or on _$TIME_1 according to official final series results announced by the WNBA.

This market resolves 'Yes' if the WNBA officially confirms the Las Vegas Aces as 2026 Champions by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerstatement published on the WNBA official website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_, supported by final series results published on primary sports data platforms (WNBA.com, ESPN, NBA app). Backup verification includes reputable tier-1 media reports with explicit confirmation and archived sources.

This market resolves 'No' if the Las Vegas Aces are not confirmed as champions by _$TIME_1, if the 2026 WNBA Championship is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if the league suspends or voids the championship, or if authoritative confirmation is unavailable or contradicts the claim. In case of conflicting information, official WNBA sources have priority. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the championship never occurs or the final result differs from the market specification.

items.title: Base native token launch by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Base _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBase@content_divideran Ethereum Layer-2 blockchain platform developed by Coinbase – Official Coinbase documentation https://www.coinbase.com/base)_$ANNOTATION$_ launches a native token by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 there is explicit confirmation from Coinbase official channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinbase official channels@content_dividerCoinbase's official website https://www.coinbase.com/, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if a smart contract representing a native token is deployed on Base and verified via trusted blockchain explorers such as Etherscan _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerEtherscan@content_dividera verified Ethereum blockchain explorer https://etherscan.io/)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no such confirmation or verified deployment occurs by _$TIME_1, if the token launch is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if official sources deny the launch. In case of conflicting or unavailable data, resolution follows authoritative Coinbase statements first, then major regulatory filings, and finally blockchain explorer verification. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Base never announced or launched a native token by the deadline.

items.title: Aerodrome Finance market cap > Uniswap by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aerodrome Finance's market capitalization in USD exceeds Uniswap's market capitalization in USD at any moment on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMarket capitalization@content_dividerthe total market value of a company's outstanding shares or tokens calculated as price multiplied by circulating supply – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to data aggregated from authoritative cryptocurrency market data providers.

Resolves 'Yes' if any official or primary source website or verified API _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAuthoritative source@content_dividerofficial company websites, Coinlore, CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or equivalent with verified data feeds)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports Aerodrome Finance's market cap strictly greater than Uniswap's at any timestamp on or before _$TIME_1. Confirmation requires either direct data snapshots, official statements, or corroborated real-time market cap data published by at least two independent tier-1 aggregators by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if no verifiable evidence confirms Aerodrome Finance's market cap surpassing Uniswap's by _$TIME_1, if market data sources are unavailable or conflicting without resolution by the deadline, if the event is cancelled, or if either cryptocurrency ceases to exist or is delisted before _$TIME_1. In case of data conflicts, priority is given to official aggregator APIs and archival data from Internet Archive or regulatory filings. Additionally, resolves 'No' if either token does not exist or has no reported market cap.

items.title: Cooper Flagg > 60 points next 3 NBA games by November 28?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Cooper Flagg's total points scored in official NBA games _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerNBA games@content_dividerprofessional basketball games organized by the National Basketball Association – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ after November 14, 2025, across the next three NBA games he plays, exceed 60 points according to official NBA box scores or ESPN statistics.

Resolves 'Yes' if the sum of Cooper Flagg's official points scored in his next three NBA games following November 14, 2025, is greater than 60 points, confirmed by NBA official box scores _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerNBA official box scores@content_dividergame statistics published by the National Basketball Association on its official website or verified sources)_$ANNOTATION$_ or ESPN statistics _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerESPN statistics@content_dividerofficial player stats published by ESPN – ESPN.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Verification requires data published on NBA.com, ESPN.com, or verified NBA social media accounts.

Resolves 'No' if total official points do not exceed 60 by _$TIME_1, if Cooper Flagg plays fewer than three NBA games after November 14, 2025, if the games are cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable official statistics are unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing NBA.com official box scores over ESPN and other sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Cooper Flagg does not participate in any NBA game after November 14, 2025.

items.title: Mia Khalifa creates adult content again by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Mia Khalifa _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerMia Khalifa@content_dividerMia Khalifa is a social media personality and former adult film actress – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ publicly releases or monetizes new adult content _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAdult content@content_dividerexplicit videos or photos distributed or monetized on adult platforms such as OnlyFans or similar channels – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ under her name by _$TIME_1 according to official publication or platform records verified through authoritative sources.

Resolves 'Yes' if any new explicit adult content credited to Mia Khalifa is publicly released or monetized on recognized adult platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOnlyFans@content_dividerOnlyFans is an adult content subscription platform allowing creators to monetize content – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent by _$TIME_1, confirmed by official platform statements, verified social media announcements from Mia Khalifa or her representatives, or major media reports corroborated by two or more tier-1 sources.

Resolves 'No' if no verifiable new adult content under Mia Khalifa’s name is publicly released or monetized by _$TIME_1, if official sources deny such creation, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. In case of conflicting information, priority is given to direct official sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never occurred or no new content was created.

items.title: BTC > $100,000 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's USD price exceeds $100,000 strictly at _$TIME_1 based on aggregated closing prices from major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_divideraggregated price@content_dividera combined price derived from multiple sources weighted by volume – Finance Market Data)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if the volume-weighted average closing price of Bitcoin in USD from at least three major exchanges (e.g., Coinbase, Binance, Kraken) is strictly greater than $100,000 at _$TIME_1. Official confirmation requires price data published or archived by authoritative sources such as CoinDesk's CCCAGG index _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinDesk CCCAGG@content_dividerCoinDesk’s regulated aggregate index using volume weighted average price methodology – CoinDesk API documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CoinMarketCap, verified via Internet Archive or direct API records by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'No' if the aggregated Bitcoin price is less than or equal to $100,000 at _$TIME_1, if any required exchange data is unavailable or unreliable, if trading is suspended or Bitcoin is delisted by _$TIME_1, or if authoritative price verification sources fail to confirm a price above $100,000. This also applies if Bitcoin ceases to exist or the price measurement event never occurs. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official aggregate indices and verified exchange data archives.

items.title: U.S. government Crypto Strategic Reserve full implementation by May 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the U.S. federal government fully implements a Crypto Strategic Reserve including Bitcoin, Solana, and XRP as defined by official Treasury reports or executive communications by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerCrypto Strategic Reserve@content_dividera federally established and managed stockpile of specified cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin, Solana, and XRP – defined for this market as per U.S. Treasury and executive order disclosures)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 the U.S. Department of the Treasury or the Executive Office officially confirms the federal establishment and active management of the Strategic Bitcoin Reserve and Digital Asset Stockpile explicitly including Bitcoin, Solana, and XRP via Treasury reports, executive orders, or verified executive communications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial confirmation@content_dividerpublished statements or reports on treasury.gov, whitehouse.gov, or verified executive social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may come from major tier-1 media outlets with dual-source verification or official published asset holdings.

Resolves 'No' if no such official confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the implementation is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if the Strategic Reserve excludes any of the specified cryptocurrencies, or if authoritative sources are unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting reports, official Treasury or Executive Office declarations take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or was not formally initiated.

items.title: Solana > 500,000 daily active users by June 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Solana blockchain _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana@content_dividera high-performance blockchain platform known for fast transaction speeds – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ daily active users (DAU) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDaily active users@content_dividerunique blockchain addresses initiating at least one transaction within a calendar day – TheBlock.co methodology)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceed 500,000 by _$TIME_1 according to on-chain data aggregated by authoritative blockchain data providers such as TheBlock.co _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTheBlock.co@content_dividera leading blockchain data and analytics provider – https://www.theblock.co/)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if official on-chain metrics from TheBlock.co or equivalently authoritative sources confirm that Solana daily active users are strictly greater than 500,000 on the calendar day ending at _$TIME_1. Verification requires published data accessible via TheBlock.co’s official data portals or APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial data portals@content_dividerhttps://www.theblock.co/data/on-chain-metrics/solana/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived snapshots. Alternative verification may use reputable blockchain analytics firms with consistent methodology.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative data confirms daily active users exceed 500,000 at or before _$TIME_1, if Solana blockchain ceases operation or is indefinitely suspended before _$TIME_1, or if data sources are unavailable or contradictory at settlement. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing TheBlock.co’s official data, followed by other major blockchain analytics providers. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana does not exist or daily active user data is fundamentally unavailable or not measured as specified.

items.title: Solana > 500,000 daily active users by June 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Solana blockchain _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana@content_dividera high-performance blockchain platform known for fast transaction speeds – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ daily active users (DAU) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDaily active users@content_dividerunique blockchain addresses initiating at least one transaction within a calendar day – TheBlock.co methodology)_$ANNOTATION$_ exceed 500,000 by _$TIME_1 according to on-chain data aggregated by authoritative blockchain data providers such as TheBlock.co _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTheBlock.co@content_dividera leading blockchain data and analytics provider – https://www.theblock.co/)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if official on-chain metrics from TheBlock.co or equivalently authoritative sources confirm that Solana daily active users are strictly greater than 500,000 on the calendar day ending at _$TIME_1. Verification requires published data accessible via TheBlock.co’s official data portals or APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial data portals@content_dividerhttps://www.theblock.co/data/on-chain-metrics/solana/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or archived snapshots. Alternative verification may use reputable blockchain analytics firms with consistent methodology.

This market resolves 'No' if no authoritative data confirms daily active users exceed 500,000 at or before _$TIME_1, if Solana blockchain ceases operation or is indefinitely suspended before _$TIME_1, or if data sources are unavailable or contradictory at settlement. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing TheBlock.co’s official data, followed by other major blockchain analytics providers. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana does not exist or daily active user data is fundamentally unavailable or not measured as specified.

items.title: Ethereum Fusaka upgrade activates by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Ethereum blockchain network completes and activates the Fusaka upgrade, defined as a mainnet hard fork at block slot 13,164,544 or equivalent timestamp, before or at _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerFusaka upgrade@content_dividerEthereum mainnet upgrade raising block gas limit and adding PeerDAS and Verkle Trees for Layer 2 scaling – Official Ethereum Documentation)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official Ethereum client release notes or Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerEIP@content_dividerEthereum Improvement Proposal: standardized design documents for Ethereum upgrades – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm activation of Fusaka at or before _$TIME_1 at block slot 13,164,544 with documented increase of block gas limit from approximately 45 million to 150 million and implementation of PeerDAS and Verkle Trees. Confirmation must come from Ethereum Foundation’s official website, verified GitHub repositories, or verified core developer communications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerEthereum Foundation@content_dividerEthereum’s official development organization – https://ethereum.org)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if Fusaka is not activated on mainnet by _$TIME_1, if the upgrade is officially cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if no authoritative source confirms the activation and improvement criteria. In case of conflicting data, priority is given to official Ethereum Foundation sources and validated client release notes. Also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or the upgrade differs materially from the defined criteria.

items.title: Dogecoin integration with 3 major payment platforms by November 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Dogecoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerDogecoin@content_dividera cryptocurrency created as a peer-to-peer digital currency – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ payment acceptance is activated on at least three distinct major payment platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerMajor payment platforms@content_dividerwidely used payment service providers such as PayPal, Amazon, or similar – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official corporate or payment platform announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if at least three unique major payment platforms officially announce and activate Dogecoin payment acceptance by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement or press release on the company’s verified website or social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Verification includes direct statements from the payment platforms or major corporate websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerVerification sources@content_dividercompany press releases, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ and may be supplemented by major media reports with multi-source confirmation.

Resolves 'No' if fewer than three major payment platforms activate Dogecoin payments by _$TIME_1, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory, or if the integration does not meet the defined activation criteria. Conflicting reports are resolved by prioritizing official corporate sources. Also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or platforms never planned activation.

items.title: Nigerian Super Eagles fail to qualify for 2026 FIFA World Cup by November 16, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Nigerian men's national football team, the Super Eagles _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSuper Eagles@content_dividerNigeria's men's national soccer team – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, fails to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerFIFA World Cup@content_dividerthe international soccer tournament held every four years organized by FIFA – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as officially determined by FIFA _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerFIFA@content_dividerFédération Internationale de Football Association, the international governing body of association football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or CAF _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCAF@content_dividerConfederation of African Football, the governing body of African football – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ after the final playoff match on November 16, 2025, with qualification outcome published by authoritative sources.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official FIFA or CAF announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatements published on FIFA or CAF official websites or their verified social media)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Nigeria does not qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup by _$TIME_1. Verification requires published playoff final match results from FIFA or CAF by the deadline. Backup confirmation may include major sports media with dual tier-1 verification or official CAF statistics repositories.

This market resolves 'No' if Nigeria qualifies for the World Cup by _$TIME_1, if no official confirmation of failure occurs by the deadline, or if the playoff final match is cancelled, postponed indefinitely beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative sources are unavailable. In case of conflicting information, official FIFA announcements take precedence. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the playoff final match never occurs or Nigeria does not enter the qualification process.

If official data sources are inaccessible at settlement, verification will use archived FIFA or CAF records _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerArchives@content_dividerincluding Internet Archive snapshots of FIFA/CAF websites and FIFA official reports)_$ANNOTATION$_ or corroborated major media reports. Failure to verify qualification status by _$TIME_1 results in a 'No' resolution.

The market deadline is November 16, 2025, end of UTC day _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=7@counter_dividerTimezone@content_dividerMorocco local time WET/UTC+0, converted to UTC for settlement)_$ANNOTATION$_ to allow for match timing and official result confirmation.

items.title: 4 new apps launch on Fluent platform by December 10?
items.rules:
This market measures whether at least four new applications _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@applications@content_dividersoftware programs designed for end-users – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ become publicly available or accessible on testnet _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@testnet@content_dividera testing environment that simulates a blockchain network for development purposes – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ via the Fluent platform _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3$Fluent platform@content_dividerthe software ecosystem and network operated by Fluent.xyz for decentralized app deployment)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official Fluent announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4$Official Fluent announcements@content_dividerstatements published on Fluent.xyz website or verified Fluent social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm the launch of four distinct new apps by _$TIME_1. Verification includes direct posts on official Fluent.xyz channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5$Fluent.xyz@content_dividerofficial website domain of Fluent platform)_$ANNOTATION$_ or verified social media accounts such as Fluent’s X (formerly Twitter) handle. Backup verification can use archived snapshots _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6$Archived snapshots@content_dividerInternet Archive or similar web archiving services)_$ANNOTATION$_ of official sources.

This market resolves 'No' if fewer than four new apps launch by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if verifiable confirmation is absent by the deadline. If source data conflicts, resolution prioritizes official Fluent.xyz announcements over third-party reports. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or if any launched app does not meet 'launch' criteria of user accessibility (public or testnet) by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Ethereum vs Gold $5,000 first by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures which asset, Ethereum (ETH) or Gold (XAU), reaches or exceeds $5,000 USD first by the close of any 1-minute candle within regular trading hours on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividerEthereum, a decentralized blockchain platform with native cryptocurrency ETH – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerGold@content_dividerGold, a precious metal commodity traded per troy ounce – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, based on Binance price data for ETH and COMEX price data for Gold.

Resolves 'Yes' if a verified 1-minute candle close price of Ethereum on Binance reaches or exceeds $5,000 USD before Gold's 1-minute candle close price on COMEX reaches or exceeds $5,000 USD by _$TIME_1. Verification requires official price data accessible via Binance API _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerBinance API@content_dividerhttps://binance-docs.github.io/apidocs/spot/en/) and COMEX official reports or Bloomberg/Reuters price feeds _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCOMEX@content_dividerCOMEX, a primary US commodity futures exchange for gold and precious metals – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Backup confirmation may use archive.org snapshots and secondary verified financial news sources.

Resolves 'No' if Ethereum does not reach $5,000 USD before Gold by _$TIME_1, if either market is closed without trading data, if the event is cancelled or postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative price verification is unavailable or contradictory. In case of conflicting data, official exchange data takes precedence. Also resolves 'No' if either asset never reaches $5,000 USD by _$TIME_1 or if the event never existed.

items.title: BTC > $100000 by November 25?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin's closing price on major cryptocurrency exchanges exceeds $100,000 USD at the end of day UTC on November 25, 2025 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerClosing Price@content_dividerthe final trading price recorded at the close of a trading period – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if official aggregated closing price data from at least two major cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCryptocurrency Exchanges@content_dividerplatforms where cryptocurrencies are bought and sold, e.g., Coinbase, Binance – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ shows Bitcoin closing above $100,000 USD by _$TIME_1 and is confirmed by authoritative financial data providers or regulatory disclosures accessible at https://coinmarketcap.com or https://coingecko.com.

Resolves 'No' if Bitcoin does not close above $100,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if trading is suspended or exchanges delisted Bitcoin before the deadline, or if no verifiable closing price data is available by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data will be resolved by prioritizing official exchange APIs and archived data via Internet Archive. Also resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist or trading never occurs by the deadline.

items.title: Manchester United ≥3 wins next 5 matches by November 22, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Manchester United _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerManchester United@content_dividerEnglish professional football club playing in the Premier League – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ wins at least three of their next five official Premier League matches _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerPremier League@content_dividertop tier professional football league in England, consisting of 20 clubs – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ scheduled after the current date and completed by _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if official match results published by the Premier League or Manchester United's official channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial sources@content_dividerManchester United official website https://www.manutd.com and Premier League official website https://www.premierleague.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Manchester United wins at least three of these five matches by _$TIME_1. Verification includes match reports, scorecards, and league standings.

Resolves 'No' if fewer than three wins occur in the next five official Premier League matches by _$TIME_1, if any match is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1 without rescheduling, or if official results are unavailable or unverifiable. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing Premier League official records. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the next five matches do not exist or are never played by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Solana > Ethereum 24h Volume by April 30, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Solana's 24-hour trading volume in USD surpasses Ethereum's 24-hour trading volume in USD on any major decentralized exchange, aggregated at the network level, at any time on or before _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_divider24-hour trading volume@content_dividerthe total value in US dollars of tokens traded within a rolling 24-hour period on decentralized exchanges – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if verified data from official or primary sources such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com/api/documentation/v1/)_$ANNOTATION$_ or The Block _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerThe Block@content_dividercryptocurrency news and data platform – https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot)_$ANNOTATION$_ show Solana's 24-hour USD trading volume exceeding Ethereum's at any measured point by _$TIME_1, confirmed through at least one additional independent major data provider or official network analytics dashboards, with accessible historical data for verification.

Resolves 'No' if no such volume surpassing event occurs by _$TIME_1, if data from all authoritative sources fail to confirm surpassing volume, if major decentralized exchanges cease operation or delist either token before _$TIME_1, or if volume data is unavailable or unverifiable by the deadline. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes primary source direct confirmation, then corroboration by secondary sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Solana or Ethereum trading volume data is permanently unavailable or if the event never occurs.

items.title: TikTok revenue-share model for all creators by July 1, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether TikTok officially introduces a revenue-share model _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRevenue-share model@content_dividera system where creators receive a percentage of revenue generated from their content – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ available to all creators globally or in all markets by _$TIME_1, verified by TikTok's official announcements.

Resolves 'Yes' if TikTok publishes an explicit statement or update _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividera formal communication on TikTok’s verified website or verified social media accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirming rollout of a revenue-share model for all creators globally or across all markets by _$TIME_1. Verification includes official press releases at https://newsroom.tiktok.com or equivalent official TikTok channels _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerTikTok newsroom URL@content_dividerhttps://newsroom.tiktok.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ and corroboration from at least two tier-1 media sources _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerTier-1 media@content_dividermajor global news organizations with editorial standards – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'No' if no such official announcement or verifiable confirmation exists by _$TIME_1, if the rollout is limited to specific regions or subsets of creators, if the event is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification data is unavailable by the deadline. In case of conflicting information, official TikTok sources take precedence. Also resolves 'No' if the revenue-share model for all creators never exists or is not deployed globally or across all markets by _$TIME_1.

items.title: Quantum computers commercial availability & Bitcoin crash by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether quantum computers are commercially available for general use and whether Bitcoin’s price declines by over 30% within 30 days of such availability announcement by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerQuantum computers@content_dividercomputers that perform calculations using quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ and Bitcoin _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ price crash defined as a >30% drop within a 30-day period after commercial quantum availability announcement or deployment.

Resolves 'Yes' if official or primary source evidence confirms quantum computers are purchasable and operational for general use by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCommercial availability@content_dividerquantum computers are offered for sale and operable by non-specialist customers for general computational tasks – inferred composite definition)_$ANNOTATION$_, and Bitcoin’s price falls by more than 30% within 30 days following the announcement or deployment, verified by at least two authoritative cryptocurrency price aggregators (e.g., CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko) or major financial media reports with explicit confirmation. Verification requires dated official product release announcements or direct company statements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerOfficial source@content_dividercompany websites, verified social media accounts, or regulatory filings)_$ANNOTATION$_ and timestamped market price data.

Resolves 'No' if commercial quantum computers are not confirmed available by _$TIME_1, if Bitcoin price does not drop >30% within 30 days of availability announcement, if the event is cancelled, postponed indefinitely, or if authoritative verification is insufficient or absent. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official sources and major financial data providers. Additionally, resolves 'No' if either the commercial availability event or the price crash event never occur or do not meet the specified criteria.

items.title: BTC > $120,000 by December 14, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Bitcoin (digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividerdigital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_) surpasses its previous all-time high price above $120,000 USD by _$TIME_1 using aggregated global exchange data converted to USD.

This market resolves 'Yes' if official aggregated price data from major global cryptocurrency exchanges or authoritative financial data providers _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerauthoritative financial data providers@content_dividerCoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, Bloomberg, or similar platforms with verified exchange aggregation)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm Bitcoin’s price exceeded $120,000 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires publicly accessible, timestamped price records or official statistics published by these sources.

This market resolves 'No' if Bitcoin fails to surpass $120,000 USD by _$TIME_1, if credible price data is unavailable, or if the event is cancelled (e.g., market closure or delisting). Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange aggregated sources and major financial data providers. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin or the underlying price market ceases to exist or is fundamentally altered before _$TIME_1.

items.title: BTC > $100,000 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the closing price of Bitcoin (BTC) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerBitcoin@content_dividera digital cryptocurrency created and held electronically without central authority – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major USD-based exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividerleading cryptocurrency trading platform with high liquidity and official price data – CryptoCompare)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $100,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by the end of December 31, 2025, UTC, with price determined by the official daily closing price on that date.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one major USD exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividermajor exchange URL@content_dividerhttps://www.coinbase.com, https://www.binance.com, https://www.kraken.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ reports a verified closing price of BTC at or above $100,000 USD on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires official exchange price records or aggregated authoritative price indices _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerprice indices@content_dividerCoinMarketCap, CoinGecko official aggregated price data)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup confirmation may include multiple tier-1 financial news outlets reporting and exchange API snapshots archived by the Internet Archive _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerInternet Archive@content_dividerhttps://archive.org)_$ANNOTATION$_.

This market resolves 'No' if no verified closing price at or above $100,000 USD is recorded by any major USD exchange by _$TIME_1, if trading is halted or exchanges are suspended preventing price formation, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or conflicting. In case of disputes, resolution follows primary exchange data prioritized by liquidity and market capitalization. Additionally, resolves 'No' if Bitcoin ceases to exist, or major USD trading markets permanently close or delist BTC before _$TIME_1.

items.title: Jack Doherty video on drug charges by November 23, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Jack Doherty officially releases a YouTube video discussing his drug possession charges by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerJack Doherty@content_dividerpopular YouTuber with over 15 million subscribers – search context)_$ANNOTATION$_, confirmed via his official YouTube channel or verified social media accounts.

Resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 an explicit video discussing the drug possession charges is published on Jack Doherty's official YouTube channel _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerOfficial YouTube channel@content_dividerJack Doherty’s verified YouTube account URL or platform verification)_$ANNOTATION$_ or confirmed via his verified social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerVerified social media@content_dividersocial media accounts verified by platform verification badges)_$ANNOTATION$_. Backup verification includes major media reports citing direct official confirmation or archived video evidence accessible on Internet Archive or comparable repositories.

Resolves 'No' if no such video is published or confirmed by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting data resolves to 'No' unless primary official sources confirm. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the video or discussion on drug possession charges never exists or is not published as specified.

items.title: XRP ≥ $2.7 by November 24, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the cryptocurrency XRP _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerXRP@content_dividera digital asset and cryptocurrency created by Ripple Labs – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds a price of $2.70 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any point by the end of November 24, 2025 UTC _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUTC@content_dividerCoordinated Universal Time, the primary time standard by which the world regulates clocks and time – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_, based on official exchange closing prices in USD.

This market resolves 'Yes' if verifiable price data from authoritative cryptocurrency exchanges _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchanges@content_dividerplatforms for buying and selling digital assets – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ or aggregated indices such as Bloomberg XRP Index _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividerBloomberg XRP Index@content_divideran official price index calculated using time-weighted average prices from multiple sources – Bloomberg)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirm XRP’s price reached or exceeded $2.70 USD at any time on or before _$TIME_1. Verification requires official published data accessible via exchange websites, Bloomberg, CoinGecko, CoinMarketCap, or other recognized market data providers.

This market resolves 'No' if XRP does not reach $2.70 USD by _$TIME_1, if authoritative sources confirm market closure, trading halts, or delisting before the deadline, or if price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. Conflicting data is resolved by prioritizing official exchange data and Bloomberg Index pricing. Additionally, resolves 'No' if XRP or the pricing event never existed by the deadline.

items.title: Zcash price ≥ $900 by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Zcash (ZEC) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerZcash@content_dividera decentralized cryptocurrency focusing on privacy and security – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $900 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ as determined by aggregated exchange data and market capitalization at market close on or before _$TIME_1.

Resolves 'Yes' if the closing price of ZEC on any major cryptocurrency exchange or the aggregated market price index is verified to be at least $900 USD by _$TIME_1. Verification requires official price data from primary sources such as CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, or major exchange APIs _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPrimary price data sources@content_dividerhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/zcash/, https://coingecko.com/en/coins/zcash)_$ANNOTATION$_ or equivalent authoritative financial data aggregators, with backup confirmation from at least two independent tier-1 financial news outlets.

Resolves 'No' if ZEC price does not reach or exceed $900 USD by _$TIME_1, if relevant exchanges cease trading ZEC, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradictory by the deadline. Also resolves 'No' if Zcash ceases to exist as a tradable asset before _$TIME_1 or if data sources confirm delisting, permanent trading halts, or protocol discontinuation. In case of conflicting data, resolution follows the highest-authority source hierarchy: official exchange data, then aggregators, then major media. Absence of verified confirmation defaults to 'No'.

items.title: Avantis (AVNT) > $10 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Avantis (AVNT) token price in US dollars _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAvantis (AVNT)@content_dividera cryptocurrency token issued by Avantis, traded on various exchanges – Crypto Glossary)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $10 on any major exchange (Binance, Upbit, or Bithumb) by _$TIME_1 according to official market trading data.

Resolves 'Yes' if official closing or spot price data from any of Binance, Upbit, or Bithumb _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerBinance@content_dividera major global cryptocurrency exchange platform – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_, _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerUpbit@content_dividera South Korean cryptocurrency exchange platform – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_, or _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerBithumb@content_dividera South Korean cryptocurrency exchange platform – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ confirms AVNT price ≥ $10 at any time up to and including _$TIME_1. Verification requires published price records or official exchange APIs or archived snapshots.

Resolves 'No' if AVNT price never reaches $10 by _$TIME_1, if AVNT is delisted, trading halted, or the token ceases to exist on all major exchanges before _$TIME_1, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or contradicts the condition. Conflicting data resolves by prioritizing official exchange sources and archived data. Also resolves 'No' if Avantis token or its trading never existed or was cancelled.

items.title: Aztec Network airdrop allocation to node runners by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Aztec Network officially allocates airdrop rewards to node runners or ecosystem contributors with eligibility and distribution announced via Aztec Network's official channels by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAztec Network@content_dividera privacy-focused Layer 2 Ethereum scaling solution – https://docs.aztec.network/)_$ANNOTATION$_ and _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerAirdrop@content_dividera cryptocurrency token distribution to eligible users, often free – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official announcement confirming eligibility criteria and completed airdrop distribution to node runners or contributors is published on Aztec Network's official website or verified social media by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerOfficial announcement@content_dividerstatement published on aztec.network or verified Aztec Twitter/X account)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification includes Aztec Airdrop Portal records or corroboration by at least two tier-1 crypto news sources.

Resolves 'No' if no official confirmation is made by _$TIME_1, if the airdrop is cancelled, indefinitely postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if eligibility or distribution announcements fail to appear on official channels, or if verification sources are unavailable. Conflicting information resolves according to the authority hierarchy favoring official Aztec communications. Also resolves 'No' if the event never existed or no airdrop was planned.

items.title: Polymarket token airdrop by May 18, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Polymarket officially announces and performs a token airdrop _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerAirdrop@content_dividera distribution of cryptocurrency tokens to multiple wallet addresses, usually for free or as a reward – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ to eligible users based on engagement and trading activity post-U.S. relaunch by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerDeadline@content_divider2026-05-18T23:59:59Z UTC)_$ANNOTATION$_. Official confirmation must be verifiable through Polymarket's official channels.

This market resolves 'Yes' if Polymarket publicly announces the airdrop eligibility criteria and completes the token distribution by _$TIME_1 on official Polymarket platforms _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerPolymarket official channels@content_dividerofficial website, verified Twitter, Discord, or Telegram accounts)_$ANNOTATION$_. Verification requires published announcements and evidence of completed airdrop distribution such as transaction records or official statements. Backup verification may use major cryptocurrency news outlets with corroboration from two or more tier-1 sources.

This market resolves 'No' if no official announcement or distribution occurs by _$TIME_1, if the airdrop is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if reliable verification is unavailable. Conflicting information is resolved by prioritizing official Polymarket sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or eligibility conditions are not met as specified.

items.title: Japanese PM Takaichi retracts Taiwan statement by December 31, 2025?
items.rules:
This market measures whether Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi or the Japanese government publicly withdraws or clarifies her Taiwan-related remarks by _$TIME_1 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerRetraction@content_divideran official statement publicly withdrawing or clarifying a prior statement – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ through authoritative government publications or mainstream media reports.

Resolves 'Yes' if an official retraction or clarification statement is published by the Prime Minister's Office or Japanese government website _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerJapanese government official sources@content_dividerofficial statements on Cabinet Secretariat or Prime Minister’s Office websites – https://japan.kantei.go.jp/)_$ANNOTATION$_, or if major Japanese or international media outlets report the retraction citing two or more tier-1 sources by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes archived government records and major media archives.

Resolves 'No' if no verified retraction or clarification is published by _$TIME_1, or if the event is cancelled, indefinitely postponed, or if authoritative verification is unavailable. Conflicting reports are resolved prioritizing official government announcements. Also resolves 'No' if the retraction event never occurred or was never announced.

items.title: Solana (SOL) ≥ $200 by December 31?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Solana (SOL) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerSolana (SOL)@content_dividera decentralized blockchain platform and its native cryptocurrency token – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $200 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ at any time on or before _$TIME_1 based on aggregated trading data from major cryptocurrency exchanges and market capitalization rankings published by authoritative platforms.

Resolves 'Yes' if by _$TIME_1 any credible, verifiable source such as CoinMarketCap _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerCoinMarketCap@content_dividera leading cryptocurrency market data provider – https://coinmarketcap.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, CoinGecko _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerCoinGecko@content_dividera major cryptocurrency data aggregator – https://coingecko.com)_$ANNOTATION$_, or official exchange APIs confirms SOL’s price reached or exceeded $200 USD. Confirmation requires either an official statement, real-time historical price charts, or exchange-level transactional data from at least two independent top-tier sources.

Resolves 'No' if SOL does not reach $200 USD by _$TIME_1, or if reliable verification is unavailable, or if the event is cancelled, trading is halted, or Solana ceases to exist as a tradable asset. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes primary exchange API data followed by major aggregator consensus. Also resolves 'No' if Solana token or market never existed or was delisted before the deadline.

items.title: Los Angeles Lakers Western Conference Finals by December 31, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the Los Angeles Lakers basketball team _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerLos Angeles Lakers@content_dividerprofessional NBA basketball team based in Los Angeles, California – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ officially secures a spot in the Western Conference Finals round _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerWestern Conference Finals@content_dividerthe penultimate playoff round in the NBA Western Conference, determining the conference champion – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1 according to official NBA announcements _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividerNBA official announcements@content_dividerstatements or publications from the National Basketball Association's official channels – nba.com)_$ANNOTATION$_ .

This market resolves 'Yes' if the NBA officially confirms the Lakers have clinched a Western Conference Finals berth by _$TIME_1 through NBA.com or verified NBA social media accounts _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerNBA official sources@content_dividerhttps://www.nba.com and verified NBA social media handles)_$ANNOTATION$_ . Backup verification includes major sports media with at least two tier-1 source corroboration or visual evidence such as game results and playoff brackets published by authoritative sports data providers.

This market resolves 'No' if the Lakers do not secure a Western Conference Finals spot by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or postponed beyond _$TIME_1, if the NBA season or playoffs are suspended or not held, or if authoritative verification is unavailable or contradictory. Conflicts are resolved by prioritizing official NBA sources. Additionally, resolves 'No' if the event never existed or Lakers never qualified for the specified round.

items.title: Ethereum ≥ $5,000 by March 1, 2026?
items.rules:
This market measures whether the price of Ethereum (ETH) _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=1@counter_dividerEthereum@content_dividera decentralized, open-source blockchain platform featuring smart contracts and its native cryptocurrency ETH – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ reaches or exceeds $5,000 USD _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=2@counter_dividerUSD@content_dividerUnited States Dollar, the official currency of the United States – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ on any major cryptocurrency exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=3@counter_dividercryptocurrency exchange@content_dividera digital marketplace for buying and selling cryptocurrencies – Merriam-Webster)_$ANNOTATION$_ by 23:59:59 UTC on March 1, 2026 _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=4@counter_dividerdeadline@content_divider2026-03-01T23:59:59Z)_$ANNOTATION$_ according to official market closing prices in USD.

This market resolves 'Yes' if at least one major exchange _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=5@counter_dividermajor exchange@content_dividercryptocurrency trading platform with significant market volume and recognized industry standing – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ publishes a verified closing price of ETH at $5,000 or higher on or before the deadline, confirmed via official exchange websites _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=6@counter_dividerofficial exchange websites@content_dividerprimary source URLs of recognized cryptocurrency exchanges)_$ANNOTATION$_ or through authoritative financial data aggregators _$ANNOTATION$_(@subject=7@counter_dividerfinancial data aggregators@content_dividerplatforms providing aggregated, verified market price data such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko – Oxford Dictionary)_$ANNOTATION$_ by _$TIME_1. Backup verification includes data archives such as the Internet Archive for historical snapshots or regulatory filings when available.

This market resolves 'No' if ETH does not reach $5,000 on any major exchange by _$TIME_1, if the event is cancelled or trading is halted indefinitely before the deadline, or if authoritative price data is unavailable or unverifiable by _$TIME_1. In case of conflicting data, resolution prioritizes official exchange sources, followed by dual major aggregator confirmation. Also, resolves 'No' if Ethereum trading or price reporting ceases to exist or is fundamentally altered before _$TIME_1.
